Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rachelmaris
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel a higher rating and I probably will when I stay there next year. However I will request a room with a window. I had read from many other travelers about the rooms without a view. Yes they were correct - it's just not that great. But this place is worth it alone for the location. Seriously LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! I've been coming to New Orleans for 7 years straight and this place has the best location in the quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The patio was very nice and if I had a group joining me this would be an even stronger plus. Great place to start with a bottle of wine! Again we had an inside room without a window. The room size wasn't bad but the hotel is old. I can't imagine the cost to upkeep them all. We were on the 2nd floor and we could hear any noise above us. The bed was a bit old but better than the B&B I stayed at last year. To sum it up this place is worth the location and I will book next year as well. But I am going to find a room with a window!

Reviews.Title: “great location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: kleopatra561
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. Nice, outdoor pool. Pretty courtyard to sit in, read a paper, have a drink & relax. Great location! the staff was very friendly & very helpful. We got an INCREDIBLE deal on our room b/c it was summer & we booked it way in advance. Very basic continental breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, but fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SC79_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March 2012. The hotel was full of character and the perfect location for exploring the French Quarter. We had no problems walking back late at night from Frenchman Street. Our room was small and basic, but this was fine as we weren't planning on spending much time in it. The bathroom was also small and only had a walk in shower, but it was clean and manageable. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: Leftyalone
Reviews.Content: Stayed three night for French Quarter Fest. Convenient to the entire Quarter. Wonderful Court yard. Room was very nice and staff exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Location and Charm”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSuntanned
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Place d"Arms Hotel for the past 8 years and would not stay anywhere else.The location is great and the staff is always friendly. Special kudos to Dionne who is always gracious and helpful. Booked a Junior Suite with a balcony which overlooked the pool which was awesome. Will definitely return to Place d"Arms!

Reviews.Title: “So New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: RAS2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed for French Quarter Fest. Unbeatable location. Convenient parking, fast & nice valets. Front desk and bellman super friendly. Beautiful courtyard and pool...tons of character. Rooms are comfortable and have classic NOLA features (exposed brick walls, high ceilings and similar) but aren't luxurious. Continental breakfast is served in a pretty, sunny little room.( The breakfast itself isn't much but who cares.) This isn't a luxury hotel but it is my favorite place in the whole city and I will return again and again. Love this little hotel soooooo much.

Reviews.Title: “Old Louisiana Charm & Perfect FQ Accessibility”
Reviews.Author: Mzscahlett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the PdA four out of our five visits to New Orleans. The only occasion we did not stay here we booked at the Provencial over on Ursulines (the Place d'Armes was already booked full with a convention). On our first visit we were able only to secure an interior room which was dark and damp (pretty recently after Katrina) but perfectly adequate. Our second room was right on the courtyard, and tho a bit noisy on the pool, we had a lovely stay there. The last two visits we've been lucky and have been given a large private "suite" at the back of the hotel, the windows of which face out onto Chartres. We found the room itself lovely, the new bathroom is huge and there was plenty of room for all my shoes. (You think a girl would learn before packing). As for the staff? Absolutely delightful (hey Ryan & Chris, hat's off to you both for making us feel at home). After reading several of the reviews, it seems the negs are all the same. Bugs (It's New Orleans people), noise outside the windows (um, still in New Orleans, and right in the heart of the Quarter) and age of the facilities. (may I remind y'all that the character of these places is in the history, which means they are OLD buildings?). Kidding aside, if you want a real Old South experience, this is your Hotel. If you would be happier in a slick corporate hotel, know yourself well enough to admit it. Head up to Canal, stay at a Marriott and walk back into the Quarter. You'll be comfortable and the rooms won't have bugs. Of course they won't be in a crazy beautiful historic building, but we all need what we need. I need to be in the heart of things, and Place d'Armes does not disappoint. The only complaints that seem bizarre, and borderline untruthful, are those about the staff. The bell hops, in particular, have without exception gone out of their way to make our stay easy and comfortable. The idea that they are rude or inattentive is preposterous. I often wonder why some people leave home. Traveling for me is an adventure, a submission to the elements around me and most of all, accepting the culture and friendships offered along the way The gals at the front desk are not overly ebullient, but do they have to be? I found them cordial and willing to get what I needed done. I don't ask more than that. The Place d'Armes has become a home away from home. We just wouldn't be happy anywhere else. It's a magical place, and yes, there are loud noises on the street at night and early morning. If that bothers you, just do what I did. Have a nice jungle juice cocktail before you go to bed. Everclear and kool-aid does wonders for a nap. Yes, the air is always wet and it gets into the fibers of everything, and I do mean everything. Yes, the rooms can be dark, but they are not at all unclean, as some have stated. The humidity in this part of the country will leave a lingering must in things that are old, like the walls, and it just is what it is. But the staff does their job, and the rooms are clean, the toilets flush and there was plenty of hot water. The breakfast is a continental one, and it's free. I love the "dining reviews" on free food. Really? Because it's not a courtesy? Sometimes in reading these reviews, I wonder if folks on vacation are looking to be unhappy with things. Traveling is expensive, and spent money can bring a kind of regret that has nothing to do with the hotels in which one stays. But I can make you a promise. In the land of the "big easy life" if you open your heart, slap on a smile, and just say "hey, how y'all doing?" before asking for assistance, you will find that the South will charm you too, especially at the Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Armes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryHeedy
Reviews.Content: Make sure when you stay here, that you get the newer part of the property for your room. We stayed here twice. The first time was a very pleasant stay. Our room was very quaint and had the old French setting. The second time, we were in a very old part of the property and our room was not so nice. Our mother wound up being able to be moved and they gave her a wonderful suite. They do have the most wonderful crescents for their continental breakfast. The staff is very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm in great location”
Reviews.Author: missinggs
Reviews.Content: We didn't choose to pay for a balcony room, so our room was rather dark. Otherwise, the room had the charm of New Orleans. Very comfortable bed, air conditioning worked very well (great due to the warm and humid weather), nicely updated bathroom. The courtyard was a beautiful place to relax morning, afternoon, or evening. Since we really don't want a huge breakfast, we enjoyed the continental breakfast that was available. Good coffee, juice, and fresh muffins and other pastries in a cozy room with windows looking out on St. Ann Street. The hotel is in a great location, just steps from Jackson Square and easy walking distance to everything in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and character”
Reviews.Author: towndaily
Reviews.Content: Would most definitely stay here again. Had a room on the second floor with a window. This floor also had a hallway leading to a large balcony with a table and chairs facing Chartres St. The hotel itself gives the feeling of old New Orleans with brick, fountains, courtyards, and trees. The continental breakfast isn't much to boast about but there is coffee, also in room coffee pots. The best part is the location. Jackson Square, Cafe Du Monde, Frenchmen St., Superdome, Bourbon St. and most attractions are just a walk away. What you can't walk to you can take trains, streetcars or taxis. We were there for the Final Four, even then it wasn't wall to wall people, as there is so much to see and do day or night near this hotel. Staff is helpful and Chris the Bellman even arranged a van to take us through the drive through Daiquiri Bay Cafe in Metairie on our way to the airport. Can't wait to get back again and will stay at the Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I had hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Guzi2
Reviews.Content: The place d armes is a beautiful old hotel!!! I am a little bit picky when it comes to hotel accommodations and this place was great! I was a little nervous about my "inner" room, but since you really only shower and sleep there, I found that it wasn't an issue at all. All of the staff is wonderful and friendly, especially one of the bellhops ( don't know the name, sorry) who got my husband and I some antiseptic wipes and medical salve after we were stung by a caterpillar while visiting the park at Jackson square ( apparently new oleans is having a problem with the creepy little critters because of their mild winter, so beware! They're in all of the trees!!)! The courtyard is beautiful ( except for the caterpillars- not the hotel's fault), the location is great, and the place is beautiful, clean and has comfy beds. Definitely would stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: Tiff07
Reviews.Content: Hotel with character - originally a school built in the 18th cent. (reputably has a ghost) . Very comfortable room overlooking St Ann's Street didn' present a problem. Cool Courtyard. Continental breakfast was adequate, what do you expect for free. Obliging staff. Convenient for Jackson Sq. & the riverfront tram. French Market Place worth a visit - great CD stall.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LeenMS
Reviews.Content: We were here for the Final Four weekend. Many things were booked and prices were exhorbitant everywhere. This hotel was reasonable in comparison and couldn't have been better for us. It's location is right across from Jackson Square and a few quick blocks from Bourbon Street. It was clean and nicely decorated. I would stay here again. It has a charming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sweetieshotrod
Reviews.Content: Got the room with balcony! We had a blast! We stay out on the balcony, unlike the rest of the guest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the New Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ybbil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one half block from Jackson Square and less than two blocks to Bourbon Street. This hotel is very old. Considering the age of the property, it was clean and comfortable certainly not fancy. A light continental breakfast was included with the room. The staff was very accommodating arranging taxis to the airport. Our only disapointment was that the pool was under construction and we had teenagers that were counting on using it. There was a nice courtyard, but a tiny lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We were totally ripped off”
Reviews.Author: LMerch
Reviews.Content: We came for the mens final four, booked months in advance, had to leave a huge deposit and totally pay for the room a month ahead of time. Paid over $300.00 per night for a couple of the nights and close to the rest. Got there and the room was very, very small, balcony looked out of construction, Balcony next to us was off the hallway so everyone smoked out there, so our room smelled like smoke. The pool was empty and dug up. We arrived on a Wednesday and were told it would be fixed by Friday, then Monday and when we left on Wednesday no one had even started the repair. Also we had to book a minimum 4 nights and while we were there they we accepting people for one night at $89.00 per night. Horrible experience. Beds were horrible, worn out.

Reviews.Title: “I kneed a window in my room”
Reviews.Author: jeannnemarie
Reviews.Content: Pool was closed. Rooms small and no windows. Good walking distance to everything I needed. Sent shirts to laundry on Thursday, not back on Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rniadreamers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel many years ago, and loved the location. We enjoyed this hotel again. It is located virtually steps away from the main sights in the French Quarter. Our room was small but nicely decorated and quiet. The people tending to the breakfast bar and the valet for the parking lot were very friendly. The receptionists seemed to have tended to too many guests to be friendly, but they did their job in a professional manner. The room prices tend to be high for the modest size of the rooms, but we can forgive that because of the beautiful courtyards and the convenience of having the best of the French Quarter right outside the doorway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 days in New Orleans and this hotel was the perfect location!!! We were close enough to Bourbon street to walk and enjoy the nightlife but far enough away to have quiet and relaxation at the end of the day!! We were also a block from Decatur street and Cafe Du Monde.The room was cozy and quiet for sleeping and the internal garden was lovely for sitting and relaxing. Great value for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deja Vu at Place 'd Armes”
Reviews.Author: Ezed K
Reviews.Content: Any hotel that warrants repeat visits must be doing something right; such is the case with the Place 'd Armes. Great location, excellent and friendly staff, and a very nice courtyard to gather for an unofficial "happyhour" every evening and a chance to meet other guests and perhaps share information about places to shop, eat, or visit while in New Orleans. Our group is already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “right in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Megan T
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing! We came to New Orleans for a bachelorette party - 6 girls and 2 rooms (119 and 120) and couldn't have asked for a better location to be. Far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to party and walk home!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Charm”
Reviews.Author: percy763
Reviews.Content: A friend had recommended this hotel and we were not disappointed. What a special find to enjoy an elegant lush courtyard just for us guests - right in the middle of the French quarter! You can walk nearly everywhere you would want to go in New Orleans. A quiet oasis in the middle of the city. Rooms were charming. Only small issue was the hard pillows (bring your own if you like soft ones). Other than that, the staff was incredibly helpful, going above and beyond ordinary attention to answer our questions and meet our needs. Hotel is highly recommended and we'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KateALondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Place dâ€™arms for New Year 2010 but I am not able to select that date on trip advisor. This is a great great little hotel, what it lacks in modern decor it makes up for in location and charm. Located right off Jackson Square you could not be better placed for the French Quarter. The rooms are good but not great, quite old and could do with an update, but that is part of the charm of most New Orleans hotels. If you expect bang up to the minute hotels in this city you will pay a very high price for it and it will be a far more corporate experience. The hotel is great value; the staff were wonderful and really made our stay memorable. New year in Nola is a crazy time, with the New Year celebrations as well as the sugar bowl college football, the town is filled with revellers. However you are never far away from a quite street or bar to take a rest from it all. This hotel has charm, its like stepping back in time, from the gas lamps on the streets you could very well be in the 19th century.

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Armes Hotel -- Quiet jewel.”
Reviews.Author: Nottingkin
Reviews.Content: Delightful European style hotel with secluded courtyard. Friendly helpful staff. Right in the heart of French Quarter with next-door parking facility. Had trouble c bathtub draining and they fixed it right away. Great price.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in good position just away from Bourbon Street noise.”
Reviews.Author: SueH9
Reviews.Content: Rooms excellent if you ask for quiet room. Our room had separate bedroom and good facilities; also plates, cutlery, table and chairs etc. TV in our lounge and bedroom. Continental breakfast is bit sparse, danish and tea/coffee, apples. Location good as far enough away from Bourbon Street but in nice restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Greenb0511
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so cute, and in such a great location. We took a cab from the airport and just walked everywhere. It's an older hotel, but it is classic New Orleans. We had the two rooms in the back with the private courtyard for a big party. It was perfect. And they were very accommodating with splitting the rooms 8 ways. I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane V
Reviews.Content: Was on a Carnival Cruise and met some really nice people that we had a wonderful time with sailing on the Carnival Conquest. They recommended this hotel as they frequent yearly. We were not disappointed at all. This hotel is in the French Quarter walking distance from all the fun! But the hotel itself was quaint, beautiful, rich in history, had a beautiful courtyard with a pool, french rod iron table and chairs, lush gardens, and a wonderful view of the lovely rooms. Our inside room on the 4th floor appeared recently remodeled but kept the charm and beautifully decorated with historical antiques. Mrs. Clean was here prior to obtaining this room. They had coffee, fruit, and French pastries for breakfast in the morning in a sun room that had comfortable table and chairs. The staff was friendly and directed us whenever we asked for help. They gave us a 3am wake up call and had our taxi waiting for us when we were ready to leave for the airport. We are already discussing a return trip and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location! Cozy Courtyards, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: matherdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this March for a large scale family reunion. The rooms were decent sized and clean but the real value were the courtyards and outside sitting areas. The hotel courtyards were great for sitting with family and catching up on stories. On a great street just down from Bourbon Street with none of the noise. Only a stroll to the river, parks, Cafe Du Monde, and lots of restaurants! Highly recommend and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A genuine New Orleans experience!”
Reviews.Author: KimblyD
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved this hotel. It was quaint and quirky and maybe a little bit haunted. (We had a couple of unexplainable experiences, but oddly they were not too scary and only added to the hotel's unique charm.) We had a ground floor room in the back near the smaller courtyard which was extremely private and felt like it was just for us. When we first walked in I was immediately aware of a musty odor in the room. We turned on the AC and I sprayed some Febreeze and soon it was gone. I think it was from being unused for a while and maybe a little of the smell of NOLA itself. I guess you get used to it. The room was large and clean enough, but we stayed three nights and never once had a visit from housekeeping. The lobby was small and you must go through it when leaving and entering the hotel. There was a lovely gated walkway right outside the lobby that could have been used to enter and exit without going through the lobby, but it was kept locked the entire time we were there. The lobby staff and valet were friendly and helpful but not overbearing. The absolute best perk of this hotel is the location, location, location! I loved being minutes away from Jackson Square and my favorite, Cafe Dumonde. Bourbon Street is close, but far enough away to not be bothered by the noise and craziness. I can't wait to go back to NOLA and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Reasonable French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rroyuk
Reviews.Content: Look no further for a hotel in New Orleans famous French Quarter! For the price, for the beauty, for the friendliness of employees, for the proximity to all the famous spots in the Quarter, there is no hotel that is better than the Place d'Armes. We were there with 12 former high school classmates on a mini-reunion #53 and had a fantastic time. We had a ground level room in the courtyard which became our social gathering place amongst beautiful flowering plants. For a bunch of 70 yr.olds, it was the perfect place to gather. Thank you Mr. Valentino for your southern hospitality! We'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good service, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Tntraveler89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location in the French Quarter. Steps away from Jackson Square, 1 block from Cafe Du Monde and the French Market, 2 blocks from Bourbon St. The Hotel has really cool architecture and the best hotel court yard in the Quarter. Our room was an inside windowless room which was priced well below any other similar hotel in the area. The rooms themselves really really need updating. Our bed linens were old and worn, the mattresses should have been replaced years ago and the carpet was not dirty, but clearly not new either. Overall, we really liked the hotel and do recommend it, but don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to New Orleans for years and have stayed at other hotels that were very nice. We only stay at the Place d' Armes now. After discovering this gem, we're hooked. The hotel entrance is just steps from Jackson Square. The hotel entrance used to be the carriage entrance back in the day. The hotel is a collection of quaint old buildings surrounding a beautiful garden courtyard. The people that work at the hotel are very helpful and courteous. Stay a few times there, and they become good friends. If you want the New Orleans experience that people from around the world come for, you can't do better than the Place D' Armes!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: "Shabby Chic" has become a rather overused term but it really does describe the Place d'Armes. It is old and quaint and not for anyone expecting luxurious 5-Star accommodations. However, it is clean, the staff is great and the location is perfect! Just steps from St Louis Cathedral and Jackson Square; you can see Cafe du Monde from the front entrance. We walked the River Walk and the French Quarter all day every day and when we returned, we were always pleasantly greeted. Hot coffee and a continental breakfast was available each morning. We booked our tours directly from the hotel and were picked up and dropped off in front. Next trip to NO we will definitely be staying at the Place d'Armes, though not in an interior room. The only negative of the stay was a musty smell from the old bricks that was evident in the interior rooms. Otherwise we had a great stay at a great hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terry1949”
Reviews.Author: 384Terry
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, and we injoyed the second stay as well as the first. This will not be our last. We love staying there because every one are so ready to please us. we also like to stay at a place with so much history,Keep up the good work,looking forward to seeing you all again,The Sanders

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: langel275
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed several days and nights here recently. We had a terrific time. You can't beat the location or the character of the hotel. Loved the room and the balcony view. We could see Jackson Square. The staff were very helpful. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, still pleased”
Reviews.Author: terrynok
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Place d' Armes. Our reservation was just as promised. No problems at check-in~ very friendly and effeceint. We were placed in the same room as our last visit so we enjoyed the private balcony. We spent a lot of our time exploring outside of the Quarter and needed our car several times a day. The attendant provided prompt service each time. All of the staff we had contact with was helpful and polite when we asked about places to eat and things to do. Another great stay at this lovely historic, old hotel. I'm sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Location & courtyard charm”
Reviews.Author: Scampbell7398
Reviews.Content: Location is 90% of the reason we come back to this hotel again & again. Don't expect modern amenities like a big tv or large bathrooms- most of this place is 200 years old. For me the creaky floors are part of the charm...but be specific about your room requests because many rooms do not have any windows at all, if you don't spend much time in your room then this would be ok, if you like to hang out in your room, request the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Location was the best !!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel307
Reviews.Content: we were able to walk everywhere from this hotel - check in was slow upon arrival (they stick to the 4 pm check in time) but everything else was awesome !! Cafe de Monde is only a few steps from the front door !! loved it here and will definitely stay here each time we're in the Big Easy

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras and the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: crackur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Place D'Armes for Mardi Gras and realized we could not have made a better choice. Our room (229) with a private balcony right over the front door was a great place to watch people and relax. It had an incredible bathroom and you could tell it had been updated even with a flat screen not that you will be watching much tv! It is only a short walk to Jackson Square, Cafe Du Monde, Bourbon St or EVERYTHING ELSE!!!!!! We were able to shop, eat and walk on Bourbon as we choose because our hotel was so close we just ventured back and forth to change,rest, etc. The people that work at PDA was great as well. We never really needed anything or had to bother anyone because it was such a simple trip. Whenever I go back, I will definitely choose this hotel =)

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: RN1969
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th visit to the Place D' Armes over the last three years. I adore this hotel and most everyone that works there. The location is beyond compare and staff is very accommodating. The rooms are very nice, although some are dated. I do know that the hotel has been doing upgrades and renovations. I have seen the difference since my first stay in 2009. One thing, be sure and verify room rates directly with the hotel. I booked a junior suite for this stay, called and asked what the max. occupancy was told 4 people. When my friends and I arrived, we were charged an additional $20 per person, per night for the third and fourth guest. I was, to say the least, upset. When I inquired about it, I was told the rates are based on one or two people in a room. Really? Then tell me that when I ask about the maximum occupancy. As an extremely loyal customer, I was shocked. I have never been charged an extra fee for a third or fourth person during my previous stays. I do have plans to address this with the management. That aside, it is a true gem in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Armes Hotel...glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: recker2
Reviews.Content: I originally had booked at the number one rated travelers lodge, but changed after talking to a relative who had stayed at the Place d'Armes Hotel. This was our first visit to New Orleans. We decided to have a mini vacation in NOLA, before getting on the Royal Caribbean cruise ship. As they say in real estate...location, location, location. The Place d'Armes is in a great location. It is in great walking distance for everything in the French Quarter. It is an older hotel with a lot of history. It is not the most fancy place we have ever stayed, but it was very clean and cozy. If we returned to NOLA we would stay here again. They have a nice little breakfast every morning. We enjoyed visiting New Orleans. It is an interesting city that we are glad we made extra time for.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Craig-hopeithelps
Reviews.Content: Another stay at the Place d' Arms on St Ann was great! Location,location location. Right off the Square and Royal. The hotel is old but cute, bathrooms are small but OK.If you are looking for local charm this a place for you. If you are looking to party hardie this is not the place. Parking with grate but at thirty dollars a day it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway trip.”
Reviews.Author: MagHoustonTx
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Plade d' Armes in the French Quarter. The European charm of the structure and ambience is outstanding. The rooms are clean and comfortable, absolutely love the courtyard. Safety is one of my main issues at any hotel, I have never been disappointed. We had dinner and brunch at Muriels in the French Quarters- FANTASTIC, Oceana's @ 739 Conti & Bourbon St., seafood crepes -WONDERFUL, Pat O'Brien's crawfish cakes must have every time I visit New Orleans. The paddle boat tour was interesting, we did not have the lunch which consisted of fied chicken and starchy sides. Our Cafe du Monde experience is always one of the first places we visit (the prices have increased). Absolutely love sitting in Jackson Square to people watch. I can't wait or my next trip to the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Old style treasure”
Reviews.Author: mgelfand
Reviews.Content: This is likely the best place to stay in French Qurter. It is a block from Burbon street but you can sleep in perfect quiet on Mardis Gras night and wake up at 11 am refreshed. Bed is excellent. The hotel is really buitifil but iot is old and old style and just cannot make that spakling clean impression that newer plastioc ones do. So I saw that some reviewers get upset over it. I think they actually scrub it all the time, it is justy an old building. I recommend taking a junio suite (we did) it is very spacious, actually quite a real suite and you can invite friends to spend a night if they stayed late in French Quarter. I recomment asking for second or third flor room over the first one. Don't know about breakast, I never go to hotel breakfast anyway. Stuff is helpful when you need them but otherwise leaves you alonne. It is certainly not a flashy place, very low key and hidden, the Roosevelt will be much better place for theatrics. We were there for romantic escape and it worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay .... so we returned again the following week.”
Reviews.Author: den06611
Reviews.Content: Would you like to stay at a small cozy hotel with a lot of character? Look no further. The price was very reasonable for spacious rooms, a pleasant continental breakfast, with parking on the premises, and in the heart of the French Quarter. I had to give the Place d'Armes the highest marks. Their staff was absolutely outstanding! From the parking attendants, to the front desk staff, to even the maintenance man.... everyone was very most helpful and courteous. They showed us what southern hospitality is really about. Before I left I thanked the General Manager, Mr. Valentino, for a "second" wonderful stay. If you are planning a trip to New Orleans this hotel should be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wvchick69
Reviews.Content: We have been to New Orleans many times and this is by far our favorite place to stay. It is close to all the action of the French Quarter yet quiet. Staff have always been friendly enough. The courtyard is beautiful and the balcony from our room had a view of St. Louis cathedral and Jackson square. The room was a little small and I don't care much for the louvered bathroom doors but still quite happy with our accommodations. We don't spend very much time in the room anyway...not in New Orleans The croissants at breakfast are heavenly but it would be nice to have a few more items to choose from. We'll definitely return to Place d'Armes, mainly because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of The action”
Reviews.Author: KCFANPetaluma
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of french quarter and easy to walk to everything. Didn't need a car for the 3 days we were here. It's close to the action but not too close. It feels very new orleans and has a lot of character. It's not your marriot but that's not what you came to New Orleans for is it?

Reviews.Title: “BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vinal B
Reviews.Content: we were stuck in the back where it was being renovated, we were told construction wouldn't start till 10am but we were woken up at 8:30am. the parking fee was allot more then what was posted online. the girl at the front desk was rude and said i needed a deposit because i paid with cash. the only good service was from the valet. i will never stay here again!! the only thing this hotel has in its favor is location but THE HOTEL PROVINCIAL is allot better in every aspect!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby sheik?”
Reviews.Author: Brooks M
Reviews.Content: Yes, I gave it two stars but we keep staying here year after year and each time I ask myself "why"?. This is a courtyard boutique, small hotel made from one of the oldest school buildings in New Orleans. It has charm, patina and a beautiful courtyard. The Cafe du Mond is a three minute walk from your room in the morning and Jackson Square and the State Museum are even closer. The great shopping on Royal Street is a half block to your right and Bourbon Street is two blocks away (which makes it close but far enough away that you cannot hear it or smell it). The rooms are aging and need some repair but they are clean. This year the internet router, with it's weak, slow signal, hung from the ceiling from a wire poked through the plaster. The TV is 20 years old and the free continental breakfast is not worth the price. The desk staff are polite but not usually friendly or engaging. There is a Bellman... somewhere.So why do we return? We go to New Orleans to be alone together and it is quiet at this place. We want to be ignored. We want privacy and, well, we like shabby sheik.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Afraid!”
Reviews.Author: evangeline57
Reviews.Content: I stayed with other family members in 2 rooms for a week at the end of January. We booked the Value Rate and I was in a King Jr Ste (Room 208) overlooking the pool. Our other party occupied a Courtyard Room (Double Queen) on the pool level. No problems with either of the rooms or with the billing. I don't understand why there are so many negative comments about noise, "musty" smells and "mildew" in the rooms. Both our rooms were very clean, although a bit dated with brass fixtures, a tiny bit of rust around the drain in the tub, that sort of minor stuff. This part of town is pretty insulated from the noise of Bourbon and Decatur Sts. I really wonder if any of these complaints were brought to the attention of Management, as they seem very eager to please. I witnessed the Front Desk Supervisor telling another departing guest (who was upset about internal noise the previous night), to contact her personally the next time they were coming to town, so that she could make it up to them. Everyone has addressed the location, which is great, but the main courtyard, the furnishings and the staff are just wonderful. We sat out almost every evening after dinner, hating to leave the beautiful setting; but when we did retire, the room itself was gorgeous. The In-room safe is large enough for a full-size laptop and the free Internet worked fine the entire stay. Breakfast is baked goods, juice & hot beverages, but it IS New Orleans! Aren't you still full from those Red Beans & Rice you ate last night? Won't you be chowing down on a BBQ Shrimp PoBoy for lunch in a couple of hours? Really, we didn't miss the "cooked breakfast" scene at all. St Louis Cathedral is less than a block away for church-goers. There is a (tiny) elevator in case you need one, the size of which can be a problem for those on low floors at check-out time. I finally gave up and carried my bags down 2 flights of stairs. Suggestions: I would like to see a towel bar by the vanity along with a magnifying mirror. They should also offer a couple of herbal teas for those who cannot tolerate caffeine (I had to go buy my own box at CVS). Fridge, microwave, hairdryer (good power) & coffeemaker all helpful. The channel selection on cable is really terrible if you're planning on watching any TV while here-- we just laughed about how bad it was. Didn't encounter anything of a paranormal nature, but given the surroundings, it wouldn't exactly surprise me either. If you're coming to NOLA to have fun on the town, and not to criticize your indoor surroundings, you really should consider staying here. In the end, there's nothing better than- day or night- being right in the middle of the French Qtr. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Our first experience with New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: katgav
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel. The beds are very uncomfortable. The bathroom had mildew. We were supposed to have a courtyard view but it was of a brick wall and we paid extra for the view. It is in a good location and the staff tried to be helpful. The breakfast is only coffee, fruit and sweet rolls.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Moonbaby728
Reviews.Content: 3 of stayed at this location at the end of January in a suite. Check in was easy and our bell man was very hospitable. The grounds and courtyard are gorgeous however the rooms are dated. Given the history and age of the hotel this wasn't a deal breaker and we did enjoy location. We requested a pad for the bed to make it a little bit easier to sleep at night. The complimentry coffee and muffins at breakfast are terrific! Should we return to NOLA I would most likely try another place due to the uncomfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: joncgif
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. You're steps away from Jackson Square and Cafe Du Monde in one direction and two blocks away from Bourbon Street in the other. I didn' have too much contact with the staff but they seemed friendly and helpful. The biggest issue was our interior room. This room has no windows so it's completely impossible to gauge what time it is by the sun coming in to your room. I knew about this in advance and I was prepared for it, but if you don't want to deal with this, be sure to confirm you have an exterior room. The bed was very lumpy and squeeked every time you moved so as someone that wiggles his feet in bed, this was so annoying! Wifi was spotty at best, which is always annoying to me in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Finally found a hotel I can recommend”
Reviews.Author: cleetus97
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days, 3 nights in NO. I have stayed in plenty of hotels in the Quarter and this is by far the most New Orleans, the prettiest and whatever else you want to say. Never have I just wanted to grab a few drinks and go back to the Hotel, we did this 3 different times. Everyone that worked there would bend over backwards to help. We had a few requests and they jumped at the chance to make us happy. We had a room that was in a far, far remote corner in the far back. We got in there, it was massive!!! The bathroom alone was bigger then apartments I have had(well, almost). It was first floor, and to be honest, on the street, it got loud with the street sweepers and some of the traffic. If you are a light sleeper, I would pack some earphones/plugs. Also, spend some extra money, we aren't the balcony types, but I would have loved and used one here. I really can't describe how awesome the different courtyards were. This is not a Ritz, this is not the Royal Sonesta, this is a beautiful older hotel. There are different types of 5 star. This is French Quarter 5 star that is affordable to normal people who want to experience something wonderful. This is not a 5 star for those who have to have everything pampered and perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: midnitemover
Reviews.Content: Great location within the French Quarter. Only 2 blocks from Bourbon St. The front desk staff was very personable and accommodating. Checkout was 11am and our flight was not till 4:30 pm and they held our bags till our return and called a taxi to take us to the airport. The hotel is set up in a typical French Quarter style with a courtyard in the middle and the rooms spread around. Our room was on the third floor with a window. There was no direct access to a balcony you had to go out into the hall and out another door to get there. Some of the rooms do have direct access to private balconies. My wife felt that the room was not clean enough. There was dust on our ceiling fan and dust on our curtains, television stand. Mattress was not the most comfortable in the world. The one major problem we did have was that on our third morning my wife woke up to a cockroach coming out of a clean washcloth on our tub. I killed the roach and my wife went down to the front desk to explain what we had awoke to. They did offer to immediately change our room. We declined as we were only staying one more night. We asked if they could please come and spray the room because we were going to be gone for the day on a all day tour. It is unknown if they did but they did clean our entire room and a manager did get in contact with my wife later that morning via telephone. They again offered to change our room, we declined but they did refund our money for that nights stay. In fairness to the hotel that is the only roach that we did see during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gloriebee
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is close to everything in the Vieux Carre. We could walk to the Acme Oyster House, stop at Pat O'Brien's piano bar on the way home and enjoy the lovely weather. There is nothing fancy about it but that is part of the charm...it is old and fits in the the neighborhood. I have stayed here three times and all three have been pleasant. I wouldn't recommend an interior room, but both the courtyard and balcony rooms are great. The bell boy is the best..always friendly and helpful. The room was clean and large enough to move around easily. Close to good restaurants, shopping, music...everything you go to NOLA to enjoy. $28 plus tax to use the garage but if you are driving in it is worth every penny because parking in the Quarter is impossible! You won't need your car unless you are venturing outside the Quarter. Check out the specials!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl219
Reviews.Content: Great location in the French Quarter. We walked to everything, didn't use our car the entire weekend. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a "balcony room" facing the street. When reserving a balcony room, I assume it will be a private balcony since it didn't say otherwise. Our balcony was at the end of a hallway that had 4 rooms in it, and only 2 chairs. One of the chairs looked broken. That wasn't what we had in mind when we imagined ourselves relaxing on our balcony! The walls are paper thin and we could hear EVERYTHING. As a few other reviewers said, you can not only hear if someone is outside in the hall but also the street noise including the trash pick up at 5:00 am! We didn't get good nights of sleep there. The free breakfast consisted of a few pastries, fruit, orange juice, and coffee. It was adequate. All that said, it was a charming hotel and what you would picture New Orleans to be like. We would likely stay here again just based on the location alone however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but Long in the Tooth”
Reviews.Author: tjshearer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice old hotel, just one and a half blocks from Bourbon St., and half a block to Jackson Square. They do have valet parking and it is reasonably priced. It is quiet on this block so it is a nice getaway from the noise of Bourbon St. Checking into the hotel, we were early so a room was not ready, no big deal. They were supposed to call us when it was ready but never heard from them. The front desk ladies were not particularly friendly, no smiles, no thank you for staying. When we came back and they figured out our room was ready, we asked for the bags to be brought up. We waited twenty minutes or so, never got them so just told the front desk clerk to put them in the room. They were there when we returned. The rooms are old but nice and generally clean. The bed was horrible. They need to be replaced asap! The bathroom was tiny with a narrow shower, about what you would expect in an older place. There was a fair amount of mildew in the shower. The hot water would come and go in the shower so one minute it was scalding, the next it was ice cold. TV was an old 19inch tube type but it worked fine. There was no wireless internet in the room but the front desk did give me a cable to plug in my pc. No Ipad use though. If you use the valet parking, leave PLENTY of time to get your car back. The valets are sometimes hard to find, or understaffed. I suggest at least 15 minutes but once ours was closer to 25. The continental breakfast looked nice, but hey, Cafe Du Monde is block and a half away! They do not seem to have a real concierge. When asking the front desk folks for suggestions, etc., they really did not have much to offer. The bellmen do a better job with info. They did introduce me to Diane Webre who offers private walking tours of NOLA. We did a little over two hours in the French Quarter and it was fabulous. Susan is engaging, knowledgeable and would be a great choice. Next time in NOLA, I will probably give some where else a try. Not a bad choice, but a little pricey for what you get and I would see if there is anything any better.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dustin H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go to New Orleans for my 30th birthday with our two best friends as well. Our friend found this one, and I was hesitant after reading some bad reviews. We flew in the Saturday after Thanksgiving, during Bayou Classic, and when we got to the hotel, they offered to keep our bags until our room was ready, so we went and had lunch and drinks at Pat OBriens. We didn't think we'd get our room until 4, however at 2;30 they called me and told me it was ready. We requested a room with a private balcony, and we had a great one over the hotel entrance. Our room was smaller, but very cozy..plenty of room for 2 beds and a rollaway. The bathroom was a closet, but it served our purposes. As for location, you can't beat it with this hotel. A block and a half off of Bourbon Street, and a block and a half from Cafe DuMonde equals perfection. The staff was very courteous to our needs, and after we checked out, they let us leave our bags there until we were ready for the airport. Next time we go to NOLA, we will be back there

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Melttu84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful place to stay! The location was perfect, walking distance to anything in the French Quarter. The rooms were average but adequate. We loved the hotel grounds, especially the central patio area with the pool and places to sit. We would like to return in the warmer months to enjoy that area. We very much enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Feel New Orleans charm”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: Great place, close to everything, really felt the Quarter charm. Beautiful courtyard, nice free breakfast. A slight issue was the bathroom floor was really old, looked dirty w/the old linoleum, it should be tiled or cleaned better as well as the carpet. And the walls are thin, you can hear someone talking if they're standing outside of the door. Overall we'd stay there again, people were nice and helpful, great location, affordable.

Reviews.Title: “General Andrew Jackson Would Approve”
Reviews.Author: MobileDrAl
Reviews.Content: Located on the corner of historic Jackson Square, you are at the very center of the French Quarter ! We loved the convenience of walking to New Orleans's Best Restaurants, Best Music, romantic Mississippi riverboats and free street entertainment.The staff were helpful, personable, and quick to respond to our requests. Quiet, charming rooms with a great classic Quarter courtyard. We have stayed here every year for the last 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TIC09
Reviews.Content: This older hotel is located in the quieter part of the French Quarter, just a block away from Jackson Square. You need to pay $28/night to park, but once you give them your car you can walk anywhere you want. The rooms are clean and in reasonable condition for an older hotel. Would suggest to get a room on the second floor because you can hear the people in the rooms above you walking around. There is a nice quiet courtyard where you can sit in the evening. Breakfast is adequate - delicious pastries and some fruit. Staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip for my wife.....”
Reviews.Author: Wyoben
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Location is ideal in the French Quarter and quiet. We had a king suite overlooking the courtyard and the room was spacious. The only complaint i have is that if someone is out in the hall way you can hear them talking like they are in the room. Must have something to do with the fact that the doors do not have seals on them. On a super busy wild weekend i can see where it would be difficult to sleep because of the noise. However, we were there Fri.-Mon. nights and only encountered loud talking in the hallway a couple of times. Breakfast was nice and just enough considering all the options throughout the day for dining in New Orleans. Both the local paper and USA Today are available in the dining room. The pool are is nice and is quiet. We would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: My freinds and myself stayed at Place d'Armes 4 days in January The staff of the hotel was freindly and outgoing it was like staying with freinds we were steps away from everything in the quarter If you or your freinds are looking for a safe clean hotel just footsteps away from everything is is the place for you Place d'Armes will be my hotel of choice when staying in New Orleans LA

Reviews.Title: “Love Place d Armes”
Reviews.Author: ivoryk
Reviews.Content: We love the Place d Armes hotel. The rooms are clean , and the Staff are always friendly and eager to help. The location can't be beat. Mario, one of the Bell Hops was always willing to go the extra mile to help with anything you ask of him. The Lady that works in the Breakfast area is very nice and keeps evrything going there. Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Place d'Armes December 26-29th, 2011. It is located in a perfect spot--close to everything you will want to do in the French Quarter. The Mississippi river is a block or so away, there is a park right down the street where artists set up their artwork everyday, and musicians play all day. The famous Cafe du Monde is a block away where people wait for the delicious beignets they make fresh everyday. It is a short walk to Bourbon street in one direction, the French market in the other direction. The room was so beautiful! It is worth it to get a room with a private balcony. The staff was wonderful--so friendly and helpful. We walked all over the quarter and saw other nice hotels, but I believe we stayed in the best one there. It is historic, beautiful, charming, safe and comfortable. I loved our room! It was very clean, and decorated in a warm, cozy way. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, and we had a perfect stay there. I would go back to New Orleans and stay at Place d'Armes in a heartbeat. We loved it. If you want to experience the French quarter with charm and beauty, stay here. I highly recommend this place and staff. The staff were always friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome. This is a great place to stay with a family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelby123_123
Reviews.Content: Our entire family loved the hotel. It was the first experience for our two kids to visit New Orleans, and this hotel was perfect for that. The hotel has a wonderful and friendly staff and the location was perfect and safe. Anyone traveling with kids I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Real flavor of New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: Charming boutique hotel just steps from Jackson Square; very clean and true flavor of New Orleans! Staff couldn't have been nicer. Could see Jackson Square from the balcony. Stay here if you want the true French Quarter experience; choose another hotel if you are looking for the Holiday Inn experience with modern and sterile rooms. Intimate courtyard. Would have given it an "excellent" rating, but the tv is kind of small and out of date. Otherwise, would DEFINITELY return!! Stayed in room 322 in a king bed room.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a cold few day in Dec, just ok”
Reviews.Author: Drej_Stu
Reviews.Content: It was hit or miss with winter Temps, was there for a short handfull of days. I didn't book throught the hotel direct and thus was not happy with my interior room(no windows). Rooms reminded me of school dorms, oh well. make sure you book withthem direct.. + you won' feel like a third class citizen then either and prob save a ton of $. At check-in they wouldn't help much, said to see the desk in the morning (ya-right, I want to un pack & pack again LoL) Breakfast was pleaseant, no protien, just sweets/some fruits and good cofee. Location was Awsome as it was right at the square and not far from all although I've stayed at a few placed in the vacinity within a block or two and I'd do more research next time and call hotels direct.PITA, oh well! Tiny Room seemed Clean ! had a digital lock in-room safe, that was good for my electronics etc.few quirks w/the room, otherwise just ok. The 1 elavator seemed to do the job. I won't stay again for the money, No-way!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chinamom_7
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We had a first floor suite, plenty large enough for me, my husband and our 13 yr old and7 yr old sons. There are two rooms. One with a very comfortable king bed, the other with a sitting area pull out couch. Both had TV's. The hotel is charming, old, original 1725 architecture. Located just 1/2 a block from Jackson Square and 2 blocks from Bourbon. Very quiet back in the courtyard area. Staff were very helpful and kind. Our room had a coffee maker, and fridge. The wall unit AC/heater was more than enough to heat or cool. Ceiling fans in each room were nice. The only thing to note was the musty smell....we just left the door open a few minutes to air out the room and flipped on the AC to circulate the air. It don't bother us, just be aware. Our boys loved the room, having a separate space and close to everything, easy.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed review”
Reviews.Author: jlr51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to New Orleans many times, but had never stayed at the Place dArmes until our most recent trip in December 2011. I love the location of PDA, I think it might be the best location of any hotel in New Orleans. I really wanted to love the hotel, so that makes it difficult to write this review. We got a fantastic room rate, probably because of December being off-season. When we arrived in New Orleans, we stayed our first three nights at the Hotel St. Marie, which is a sister hotel to the PDA. The HSM was extremely clean and well-maintained. When we went to the PDA, I expected the same as the HSM. The lobby of the PDA is very small and somewhat cluttered. Check in was easy. After checking in, we followed a young man to our room. The courtyard that we passed had a bit of a neglected look. Nothing terrible, it could just use some sprucing up. It was December, so I didn't expect the foliage to be blossoming, but at the Hotel St. Marie, the courtyard appeared to be very well maintained even during the cold months. Not so much for the PDA. We went past the courtyard and down another area to our room (I believe that there are either five or seven buildings at PDA). Now this was where I was particularly disappointed. The building we were in was having construction done, and there was scaffolding along side the building, plus a bunch of construction tools. I am a big supporter of maintaining older property, I know that maintenance is necessary. But my question is - the hotel did not appear to be completely occupied by any stretch of the imagination, so why were we put in a building that was having construction work done? I would have preferred a room where we didn't have to pass the scaffolding and construction tools each time we left/entered our room. However.....when we saw our room, I was completely enchanted and all negativity flew out the window. Our room was the only room in our hallway...when we went in the door, there were no other rooms, just ours. The room was huge, possibly the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in. There was a small entry area, and we had a four poster bed with a step stool to get into it, a huge closet, a bathroom the size of a small bedroom (with heat lamps and a huge tub big enough for two people). And best of all, our view out the window looked right out onto Chartres Street. We were on the ground floor so we could look right out at the people walking past, and we awoke to the sound of a carriage passing by our window. Absolutely magical! And, the room was spotlessly clean. It was an amazing room, and the location of PDA just can't be beat. Right across from St. Louis Cathedral, 1 block to Cafe duMonde, five minutes or less to Pat O'Brien's, etc. If we had visited in the spring months and the courtyard was in bloom and was having more care and attention, and if the construction was done, I would have given this a five star rating. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So many positives with this hotel, but so noisy!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff68
Reviews.Content: We loved ALMOST everything about this hotel. We had a room with a balcony for two nights. Lovely room, comfortable bed and pillows, very large bathroom (loved the decor in the shower!), nice staff, perfect location in the French Quarter and a wonderful, large balcony. The only negative: although the balcony was great to sit out on and watch people pass by, the balcony doors did not have a tight seal (you could see daylight between them), and even with the doors closed and heavy curtain drawn it was soooo noisy. Every sound on the street below, from people walking by talking in normal tones and cars driving by to the club's thumping music down the street and the trash pick-up (at 5:00am!) was heard clearly in our room. Even with earplugs we slept very little for two nights. If only it hadn't been so noisy we would rate the hotel a five and absolutely stay here again - BUT, we won't stay there again, since a reasonably quiet stay is important to us. If noise doesn't bother you or you are a very heavy sleeper, this hotel would be great for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristen750
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a really good experience at Place de Armes. We chose the hotel based on positive reviews we saw on TripAdvisor. I recommend that you get a hotel with a window. It opens up the room more. Our room was very cute, clean and had the Louisiana character that we were looking for. The location is PERFECT. Just a block or so away from Bourbon street, and walking distance to everything in the French Quarter, shops, restaurants, etc. The hotel staff were helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Customer Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RealDeal1951
Reviews.Content: Our visit was during the Xmas-NYE week, and we love the Place D'Armes. This time there was a bit of a hiccup as they were shampooing carpets and the carpet in our room was left sodden by the contractor. It was likely the last one of the day for him/her, and they wanted to get it in just before check-in time for billing purposes. The staff and management couldn't have handled it better, and as always, my wife and I are big fans of the Valentino family who own and manage this and other French Quarter Properties. "Bubby" Valentino, the GM of Place was/is a real stand-up guy. His staff were prompt, courteous, and thorough throughout the event, and for all of our stay. This is NOT unusual for this group...and it also speaks volumes about the quality and nature of this group's management principles and practices...as the old saying goes "If you want to know how a company is managed, look at how its front-line employees treat customers"...poop rolls downhill, after all...and the staff and management of Place d'Armes defined hospitality for our stay. Our best wishes to the Place d'Armes and all of the Valentino management and staff for a healthy, happy and prosperous 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here”
Reviews.Author: mstickler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed many different places in the Quarter over the years, but this is the first place we've returned to. A few places have been nicer, but what we really like about this hotel is the great combination of location, price, a pretty good room ad a great courtyard. The one thing we don't like is the tiny bathroom, but, for the price we were very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mego65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night as a little romantic getaway. We loved it! The location was perfect. It was really close to Jackson Square and many great restaurants and attractions. We were able to walk everywhere even though the weather was not the greatest. Service was wonderful, even when we forgot something in our car they immediately brought the car back down so we could get what we needed. The room was small and dated, which added to the charm. However, we were in the back courtyard, which was really just a pathway. We payed the extra money and were just facing a rock wall with a few little trees planted in the walkway. Next time, I will ask to be in the front courtyard which was gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: pasherry
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Christmas Papa Noel rate which was a good value. The location is great, near Jackson Square and easy walking distance to the French Market, Bourbon St and Cafe Du Monde. We were in room 201, with two double beds, near the street and the elevator which made for some noisy nights. We stayed midweek, so it was probably quieter than the weekend,so bring earplugs if staying over a weekend. The continental breakfast was coffee, fruit and pastries which was a nice touch. Parking is expensive at $28/night, but probably the same at other hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a plus I would rate it 3.5”
Reviews.Author: hawkedd
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Place d'Armes, we like to try different places and Place d'Armes was rated very highly. We like balcony rooms and the street noises had not bothered us at other hotels. Pros: Location. You can see Jackson Square from the St. Ann Street balconies so you know that you are really in the heart of the French Quarter. Anything in the French Quarter is within easy walking distance as is Frenchman Street, Canal Street, Louis Armstrong Park and many other attractions. The room was clean and was big enough, even with a king sized bed, to accommodate two adults. The wireless internet worked flawlessly, the TV was modern and the channels available were more than enough. The bathroom was huge, seven by seven plus the bathtub area. There is a hair dryer, iron and ironing board. They have a safe in the closet which is large enough to put your laptop as well as other valuables. The closet isn't the largest in the world but is adequate. Dresser space is okay but if you bring everything you own it will be tight. The doors to the balcony are french doors that are wide enough an adult can get through it without turning sideways. The balcony, at least on the second floor, has a roof so you can sit out there even when it rains. The courtyard is nice with lots of plants. There are actually two courtyards but it appeared that they were working on the part of the hotel where the second courtyard is. The plumbing, heating/cooling and electrical systems worked like they are supposed to work. The average: The breakfast isn't much. We are not big breakfast eaters so it was no big deal to us but the selection is limited to muffins, croissants, danish, some fruit, coffee and orange juice. The selection looks like what you would get at the local Wal-Mart's pastry aisle. The breakfast area did have food until 10:00 am. There is parking on-site and the one time we wanted our vehicle it was at the entrance in a few minutes. However like most places in New Orleans they charge an arm and a leg for parking privileges, $28.00/day plus taxes. The maid service did a good job when they cleaned the room. However one day we had to ask if they were going to clean the room that day. It was after 4:00 pm and we were going out for a while. When we got back at 5:30 they were "in process" of cleaning the room. The people who were checking in to the room next to us (there were only two rooms in that hallway) had to wait until their room was cleaned. As I mentioned there are only two rooms that have balconies facing St. Ann St. and there is no elevator going up to the second floor. The stairway is somewhat narrow and goes right over the lobby counter. The "door" to the bathroom is one of those louvered doors used in a lot of the French Quarter hotels. It is not sound proof!!!!! Staff: I must say that the lobby staff always say hello when you travel through the lobby. But it seems perfunctory at best. The garage staff were much more genuine and friendly. The other staff we met were friendly. One gripe I do have was that one night the staff appeared to be having a gab session among themselves with another person. Due to the fact that our room was just a few steps away from the lobby I could have recorded everything they said from the bed. We arrived early, about 1:00 pm and dropped by to let the lobby staff know that we were in town and to call us when the room was ready. Check in time is 4:00 pm. We called them about 3:15 to see if the room was ready and received the canned statement "Check in time is 4:00 pm." The person was different from the person I talked to earlier but I got the impression that she didn't even check. Not so good: We have stayed in other hotels with a balcony facing the street in the French Quarter and the street noise was not bad. It seems that the canyon effect of St. Ann Street keeps sound between the buildings. People talking in normal tones can be heard. The street sweepers are bad but the single worst sounds came from an employee of Muriel's whose job must require him to clean out the trash cans at 6:30 am every day. Not only does he clean them he drops, pounds on and in general makes lots of noise with those blasted trash cans. If we go back to this hotel we will NOT get a balcony room on St. Ann Street. I kind of expected a better situation here since I had talked to people who stay there often and it got good reviews on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: OjaiTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Me and my 21 year old daughter and her friend stayed at the hotel in the Quarter for her 21st birthday in December, 2011. A great time was had, the hotel is perfectly centrally located for seeing the Quarter. A very short walk to Cafe du Monde, a little more of a walk to canal street and a little further to the Superdome. It was a totally easy walk and lots to see along the way. Would definitely recomment hotel to others; clean, large room, really high ceiling, great little courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tommy8244
Reviews.Content: As in other reviews, this hotel has a great location and friendly front desk. However, if you are claustraphobic, ensure you are getting a room with a window. My room was nice and spacious, but like a lot of their rooms it did not have a window. I would stay there again.The free breakfast was muffins, juice, coffee, Danish, etc nothing hot. If you cant do caffeine and like tea, bring your own tea bags. Very minor complaint - their housekeeping staff would not leave soap and shampoo for us, and the water has to run a while to get shower level hot. No big deal, just so you know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gem in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: buddha
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located on St Anne about 1/2 block north of Decatur (and Cafe du Monde). It is really an excellent and very strategic location. It's close to Bourbon St, but far enough away that you don't hear the noise. You are 5-10 min away from Canal Street and Riverwalk Place. You are a few steps from Jackson's Square. Muriel's restaurant is at the corner of the street. Stanley is a few paces past. If you turn left at Chartres and go a several blocks, you will hit Irene's Cuisine and then Stella! Get to Decatur, turn left and walk past the Esplanade and yu will come to Frenchmen St. The hotel is an old building. Although the rooms are a bit small, they were clean. We had a room with one queen and a window overlooking the courtyard. It can be dark in the room. We saw a corner room that had no windows and it was larger. All the staff were friendly and the service was excellent. As I'm writing this, I'm waiting for my blazer to be returned to me, after having forgotten in it the room. They were very easy to deal with in implementing the process to get it back to me. They offered a continental breakfast and this was fine, except Stanley was so close and so good that we ate there a few times. The price was reasonable given the location. It's too bad it was too cold to use the pool. An exercise room would make this hotel almost perfect. The only think that was a bit goofy is that there is only one key to the storage room. If the person is not around (like the day we were getting our golf clubs to head out), they had to run around looking for him....but this was a minor issue. I've stayed here before and would stay again. I do suggest you leave the sign out to clean the room. One night, we went out and came back around 4pm for a nap before going to dinner and the room had not yet been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: roger-zh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this cosy hotel in the middle of New Orleans, LA. It is easy to find just off from I-10 and you can park your car in the hotel-owned garage for a charge (valet). After that you can leave your car there and walk, walk, walk.. because the hotel is located in the heart of the French Quarter just a few meters from Jackson Square. Checkin was good, we booked over hotels.com. Rooms are good but you have to keep in mind that some do NOT have any windows. If you want to have windows you probably have to pay some USD more. But in this city you don't have to stay in your room exept for sleeping because there is so much to see and explore. We had a problem with the toilet flush in the first night but even in the middle of the night the staff was available and very eager to help us out. Much appreciated and shows they do want to keep their high service standard. Bourbon street and a lot of restaurants are just around the corner, you are realy in the middle of historic downtown. I can also imagine this place is exiting in summer time when one could use the pool in the more than lovely backyard. Great. There is even a small breakfast you can enjoy, nothing big but keeps you happy for the day. I would recommend this hotel for sure, especially for people who want to be in the middle of Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “The New Orleans I envisioned”
Reviews.Author: nursedocstl4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so quaint and homey. It is exactly what I expected staying at the French Quarter to be. You can not beat the location. This is not a 4 star hotel, but it has loads of charm. My only complaint would be that the walls are very thin and we had some very loud neighbors. The Christmas decorations were also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in a prime location in the Old Quarter of New Orleans while avoiding the sleaziness of Bourbon Street then this is the place to stay. It is a small independently run hotel with lots of character. Our room was basic but clean and had a lovely large balcony to sit and watch the world go by. Everything is within walking distance. Couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Location's a 10 - the rest is not real great”
Reviews.Author: Coop64
Reviews.Content: Great location in the French Quarter. Just off of Jackson Square, two blocks from Bourbon St. Two blocks from the Mississippi river, etc... etc.. The hotel is in need of some serious maintenance and cleaning ( some new paint, and cleaning the cobwebs out of the corners would help). The room was large, and had a balcony we could go out to sit and "people watch". The room smelled musty, and the heat/air was very noisy. I guess this is what some would call "quaint" and "old world". I just know if this hotel were in Vegas it would get a rating of no higher than 2.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Content: I returned from a wonderful trip to NOLA visiting friends on 12/7/2011. I found the hotel to be a quaint New Orleans type in a great location. It is 1/2 block away from Jackson Square. It is located 1/2 block from Royal Street which has some of the best shopping. It is close to Muriel's & Stanley's Restaurant, if one is in need of good food. Cafe du Monde is a short walk toward the Mississippi. Best location! The hotel has a beautiful lobby with a very efficient & helpful staff. I wish I could select one staff member as exceptional but everyone I had contact with were of this standard. I couldn't ask for more. The room was large & beautiful, although the bedding could be updated, I still slept like a baby. This is my new home in NOLA & will be returning in May.

Reviews.Title: “Trading Luxury for Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Becky-in-Oakland
Reviews.Content: This is the third hotel we've stayed at in New Orleans and I'm somewhat conflicted about how to review it. The location is top notch, to be sure. The courtyard is beautiful, no questions. The actual hotel though could probably use some updating that would make a world of difference. Our plane touched down in New Orleans at 8 a.m. on the Wednesday morning before Thanksgiving. I had called prior to our trip and asked about early check in. I was told that I'd have to check for sure when we arrived. No problem. I understand. When we got there we were told there were no rooms available at all for early check in but that they'd keep our bags while we toured the city. Great. No problem. It's at this point that I wish they would have told us there would be nothing available until 4 p.m. because we would have just gone about our business, but every time we checked they kept telling us to check back in an hour or two. When we were able to check in the front desk attendant told us we were getting a great room and we would love it. Oh how I hoped that was true because I was ready for a nap! Our room, 223, is up a flight of stairs by itself facing Chartres Street. Outside the door is one of the great floor to ceiling windows that opens out onto a balcony. Little did we know that window was our entrance/exit to the balcony outside of our room because the windows in 223 are painted shut. Yes, you read that right. To access your room's balcony, you have to leave your room. Seems weird, no? The windows being painted shut also caused a lot of problems for my allergies. Our room was musty and reeked of a rather noxious air freshener every time we entered. We tried propping out door open while we were in the room so that fresh air could come in from the other window, but then you've got the whole, "I'm at a hotel leaving my door open for anyone to hear my conversations" situation and it's a bit awkward, to say the least. The room itself was very large and had a king size bed, which is great since that's what I have at home and I loathe sleeping on anything smaller. Unfortunately the comforter is scratchy and old and has frankly seen better days. The same goes for the wallpaper, which was peeling in sections, and the area around the giant air conditioning intake which had visible water damage. I can vouch that the cleaning staff DOES change your sheets during your stay as we returned on our last full day to find a bed with long, black, curly hair in it which very clearly was not there when we left earlier in the day. Note that I have short red hair. (At least it wasn't a toe nail which is what I found at the Maison Dupuy in 2004.) There are some reviews here that have mentioned the cleanliness of the bathroom. That wasn't really a problem for us, with one major exception. On our last day as we were packing to go home, I dropped a makeup brush on the floor. Kneeling down to pick it up I saw quite the horror at eye level: dried boogers on the vanity.
