I don't know how long they had been there, but it was pretty clear that at no point had anyone wiped that area down or tried to get the offending particle off. I don't know what kind of person does that in the first place, but I would hope that a well-trained cleaning staff would be doing more than wiping down the top of the sink, especially in a bathroom where the toilet is so close to the vanity. I can't imaging what other hidden germs were lurking in the room. All of this said, we really enjoyed our stay at the Place D'Armes. I don't know that I'd recommend it to a friend, but if we were coming back to Nola and got a phenomenal deal, I'd likely strongly consider it. The location absolutely cannot be beat, and the view of Jackson Square from the balcony rooms really is spectacular. I'm torn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Striker2106
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but what charm! Stayed last weekend and the service could not have been better. Everyone was friendly and made sure we were accommodated. We had two rooms in the back courtyard, since we wanted windows. The rooms had two full beds, a wet bar, a nice large bathroom with plenty of hot water, a coffee pot, and a safe in the room. It is located half a block from Jackson Square and St Louis Cathedral. It's all about location! This has become our favorite French Quarter hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: lakeladywi
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location at Jackson Square in the French Quarters. near those delicious beingets sp? and that good coffee for a break. A good and hearty breakfast was included at the hotel. Friendly staff with smart city knowledge always wanting to help. Nice city walks nearby. Numerous restaurants in all price ranges within walking distance. No car needed. Reasonable pricing.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Krystal L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything New Orleans is, in the best way. It is in the perfect location and the history of the hotel is amazing. This is the only place I will stay from now on! Now remember, this is not a new hotel. The floors will creek and crack, and the plumbing has need for improvements. But, you do not go to New Orleans because of its polished beauty, you go to New Orleans for its historic and cultural beauty. This hotel couldn't be any more creole if it tried.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ltuminello
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at chain hotels when we come to New Orleans, but decided to try somewhere different. We are so glad we did. Everyone from the valet to the front desk to the maids were so nice and accomodating. They gave great recommendations to restaurants. The courtyard area is so beautiful. This hotel is very close to Jackson Square, Bourbon St., etc... We won't stay anywhere else when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: maudiek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a brief trip in February 2011. We chose it based on the location in the French Quarter. Once we arrived, it proved to be a very charming hotel with friendly and helpful staff. It was muchmore quiet than being closer to Bourbon Street, yet was a short walk to get to great restaurants and shops. We would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend the Place D'Armes to anyone else!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: history_mystery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place d'Armes in April 2011 while in New Orleans for Jazz Fest. Our decision to stay here was based on two criteria: 1) French Quarter location without the 24-hour noise of Bourbon Street; 2) more charm and character than a large chain hotel; the hotel delivered on both. The lush central courtyard was a very nice touch. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old world charm”
Reviews.Author: skia
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the following reasons. It was right at Jackson Square in the heart of The French Quarter, it was in a beautiful set of old buildings, it had a pool in case it was really warm served continental breakfast and it had good reviews. My wife and I were not disappointed with our choice, but would add a few comments to help others with their choice. The service is first class. We booked a deluxe room with a queen/king bed through expedia and requested a balcony room over looking the court yard. Expedia did not give the same room options as the hotel website (balconies being extra and not called deluxe) and we were given a first floor deluxe room in a back court yard. I went back to the desk to be sure we were given the right room and the staff was very helpful in trying to find us other choices even though the place was mostly full. We could stay in our room and then move to a balcony with 2 beds at no extra charge. They also found a suite with a balcony and king bed as opposed to a queen and it had anice sitting area and microwave and mini refrigerator as well as a second flat screen TV. They agreed to waive the up charge for the first night and after viewing the suite we took them up as it was definitely worth the difference. I would opt for a balcony room or if you want more space a suite. The things you might object to are that the beds are quite older and very hard and a little lumpy, the paint, wallpaper and decor are quite dated and tired and overall the place needs a really good cleaning, but this seems true of most all of the buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Why hotels get bad reviews, and why this one did not!”
Reviews.Author: Krebsbach
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels in New Orleans, and so many reviews, my head was spinning when I chose this hotel as the place both I and my husband along with my Brother and his wife would all celebrate 30 years married and still in love. Sometime the reviews are so one-sided, 5 stars or 1 star all around the same time frame. The reader must take into account that some individual event or experience may have set the reviewer off or started them gushing. What to do? I went with my gut and was very very pleased with my choice. It was romantic and lived up to all of the accolades. The hotel is in an old school house and brings with it the charm of looking out the balcony for hundreds of years. We booked early and per the reviews asked (begged) for balconies. Ours overlooked Chartres street and my Brother opted to upgrade to a suite which overlooked the courtyard. Now why this hotel did NOT get a bad review . . . Our "incident" was a day when the maid failed to make up our room even though we had the sign out and were gone from the room from breakfast until 3:00. When we got back she was working next door, so we kept our sign out and went on the balcony to people watch and relax while our room got made up. Only 2 hours later and still no housekeeping, so we gave up and were going to take a belated siesta. No sooner did the Do not Disturb sign go up and we snuggled into bed when housekeeping knocked on the door and said oooooops, time for me to clean. We were not too happy at this point and told her to forget it. On second thought we needed clean towels and clean glasses, so I called down, explained what happened and asked for the items. Less than two minutes later, the Front Office staff was at our door, asking what happened and apologizing. She hauled the housekeeper up - who thought she got to go home early - and had her and two others make up our room on the spot. I am a real believer that everyone can have a bad day, even gracious old hotels. I was amazed at the attention and service we got. While we expected an apology, we did not expect an instant fix. So as you read through reviews, try to take the extreme ratings with a grain of salt, and realize that many people don't have the energy to come back and write reviews, unless something made them angry. Give this hotel a try, I think you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, our third time”
Reviews.Author: Glen T
Reviews.Content: The staff was great as all ways, the room was great, the breakfest was good , The bell man was great at giving us addresses for a place to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: naomiq
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Place d'Armes with girlfriends for my birthday for two nights. The first night was just 2 of us and we chose an interior room with no window. The room was fine, loved the exposed brick wall, very clean. We were looking forward to sleeping in since there was no window to let in natural light, however, they placed us next to the breakfast area and we started hearing noise very early on. Beware of room 104! The second night we had 2 more friends join us so we upgraded to a Jr. Suite. This was by far, worth the money. The room was on the 2nd floor in the courtyard. It was a great room, tons of space for 4 ladies to get ready. The bell/valet service was wonderful ($28/night parking). The front desk service was okay. I was definitely disappointed in the $20/extra person charge for the suite though. I paid extra for a 5 person occupancy room, I didn't expect to have to pay $40 extra also. The continental breakfast was nothing great, pastries, coffee, and juice. The absolute best part of this hotel is the location. Just to the right of St. John's Cathedral, on the corner of Royal St, 2 blocks from Bourbon and 2 blocks from Cafe' Du Monde. So in the end, the location was worth the extra $40 for my friends to join us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sunboy48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed six nights at the Places d'Armes Hotel and enjoyed it. The location was so much better than we could have imagined. The facility itself was wonderful. Each day we walked through the gorgeous courtyards and into the heart of the French Quarter. When our feet got weary, we took a little time in the courtyard to recharge or chat with some of the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: JenGunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after coming off a cruise to Cozumel. It was very easy to find and had wonderful valet service. It is conveniently located to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter shops and restaurants. We were able to walk to eat at Bubba Gumps and Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville- and various shops. That evening we enjoyed all that Bourbon Street had to offer and had a safe walk back to the hotel around 2:am. The room was spacious and we had a king size bed street side that was four postered and large bathroom. It was clean and used antique accents. The front desk service was very nice and efficient and check out was easy. I definitely would recommend the hotel for a NOLA visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kezz38
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Place d'Armes Hotel - the location is fantastic, rooms are comfortable and very quiet!. We stayed in a courtyard room which is lovely - walk out your door straight into the garden. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: While only a 3 star rating, this hotel offered our group of 4 exactly what we wanted - great location, friendly staff, beatiful courtyard, quiet rooms all at affordable prices. While in New Orleans, we are out exploring all day and evening and just want a quiet, central spot to sleep - this hotel provided that plus a nice central courtyard for morning coffee and evening refreshments. The staff were very helpful with local information and hotel services. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BACK HOME!”
Reviews.Author: waz26
Reviews.Content: That is exactly how I feel, 'like I am at home' from the minute Chris the bellman grabs my bag at the door, or even the shuttle door, I am in the COMFORT of my French Quarter home. I sleep like a log, breakfast with a friendly staff, while watching the quiet activity going by through windows over looking St. Ann Street. Within minutes I could be In Jackson Square at the corner, or on the river, just beyond.. I've been here so often, I just take 'my place' here at 'Place d', for granted!! Little words of advice, like when I planned going to 'New Orleans Jazz Fest' last May, Dionne at the desk got on the phone, then gave me directions for the simplest, fastest, not too expensive way to get out to the race track, just by walking up to the river!! that oft repeated word: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! is what you get at Place d' Armes... WAZ

Reviews.Title: “As close as you get to living in the French quarter”
Reviews.Author: Alana M
Reviews.Content: We loved place d'armes- it was right in the heart of the French quarter (but far enough from the madness bourbon street!) and the accommodation was clean, spacious, as well as really quaint, retaining a feel of old new Orleans in the decor and ambience. We woke up to live music in the street and went to bed to the same. It may be too close to the action for some but it was just the right balance for us. We loved new Orleans and when we go back we will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip as good as the First”
Reviews.Author: jojosgranny
Reviews.Content: Our group of 5 ladies returned to NOLA and this hotel for a long weekend. Staff was and is friendly and fantastic. Love the Courtyard for sharing experiences over wine with other guests, a quiet respite steps away from the heart of the French Quarter. Coffee, juice and rolls are a nice plus for breakfast. Rooms are basic but pleasant. We had a few repeats of the paranormal we experienced before but nothing really scary. Just pleasant "spirits" all around!

Reviews.Title: “Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: Crystal C
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. Very loud. Uncomfortable bed. No hot water to shower with the day we left and no apology offered. The room was clean and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: marlinchaser3
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Place d'Armes for 25 years. Situated just off Jackson Square, this is one of the most conveniently located hotels in the French Quarter. If you are looking for the cookie cutter convention hotel/one size fits all environment, well, this is not it. No two rooms are exactly alike. A new adventure awaits each time you visit. The hotel features balconies overlooking the street, or if you prefer, the courtyard. We have always found the rooms to be clean, neat and orderly. Bear in mind that the hotel is very old and modernization has occurred over the years on an "as-needed" basis. Continental breakfast is served each morning just off the courtyard. You can enjoy croissants, juice and coffee around the pool if you like, or take it back to your room. Breakfast staff along with the rest of the hotel staff is always helpful and friendly. An absolutely wonderful experience whether for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: frau
Reviews.Content: I called the Place d'Armes Hotel on October 25 to book a room for one week in May 2012.The woman was so rude and told me that there is a $200 booking fee for this room.We travel extensively in Europe and here and have never heard of this practice so we are staying at the Rosevelt Hotel .They were very helpful and have already sent brochures on their property. thanks bev de la Pena

Reviews.Title: “Hotel D'Armes windowless room”
Reviews.Author: FuntoTrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel D' Armes for the Colts/Saints game. The location is absolutely excellent and the breakfast was very nice. Just pastries, fruit, & coffee, but yet very good. Sat in the courtyard which was very nice. We stayed in a room for only $79, an amazing rate for the location which was only 2 block away from Bourban. The hotel itself was right next to the Cathedral and open park area. 1 block away from Cafe Du Monde. The only issue was that the room we were in was like being in a shoe box. No windows and very very uncomfortable. The shower did not work at all. The TV in the room was from the 1960's. A small 12" box. It was a very uncomforable feeling from the moment we stepped in the room. Felt like something was in the room with us. Couldn't sleep all night. Next morning asked if we could have a room with windows, but none were available. We decided to check out due to the uncomfortable feeling, and as we were gathering our belongings and about to leave, we were in the bathroom and right in front of us something or someone, sounded like a little boy went pee right in front of us. My husband and I got chills. It was unreal! We knew something was in there.. Come to find out we looked up the history of the hotel, and well, you can figure on your own what was going on. So we left...Have to say though the staff was very nice and as we walked by other rooms they looked nice, ones w/windows, but I will never stay in a room without windows ever again there.

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Armes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie B
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and another couple stayed at the Place d'Armes the w/o 10/17. My 4th trip to NOLA and the other couple's first. We loved the Hotel, would stay there again. At first I did not like the location of my room, so they changed it and we were next to our friend's room and each of us had the balcony overlooking Chartres St. and Jackson Square. Every AM, my husband would go get all of us coffee & brkfst and we would sit out there and see the sights, sounds of the French Qtr. It was AWESOME. The front desk clerks and bell boys were so very nice and accomodating. The courtyard was so warm, welcoming and secluded - we met a few people who have stayed there many times. Well, if we return to NOLA, that's where we will be. Also, across the street was Stanley's Rest. Delicious brkfst & food!!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StellaSoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to NOLA every June to celebrate our anniversary. We've stayed at the Place d'Armes twice, only because they have been booked the other years. We've arrived at the hotel around 10:30am both times and had a beautiful room ready for us by 12:30-1pm each time. When we arrived this year, the front desk woman was the same as the previous time. I commented to her about that fact and we started chatting, she was very friendly and very accommodating! The entire staff is! Our room this year was so amazing!! Totally different from the first time we stayed there. Each room is different, and charming in it's own way. Our room was very clean both times, as are the grounds. Every morning we would go down and get breakfast to bring up to our room where we would sit on the balcony and watch the vendors set up on the square. If you love what New Orleans is, you will love this hotel. It's not the Ritz, that's why we stay here. It has the charm and class of a historic hotel in the French Quarter. Thank you to the staff, we love the hotel, the location can't be beat, and we'll see you next June :)

Reviews.Title: “Place d'Arms Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazzoo
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. The room was very nice (balcony room overlooking Jackson Square) and big and it was so conveinient to everything. The continental breakfast was good but keep in mind if you like a big breakfast, you're going to want something more than pastries, croissants and fruit, so this is perfect for a starter or if you are someone who eats light in the morning. There is a restaraunt across from the hotel on the edge of Jackson Square named Harvey's--and they have a spectacular breakfast menu! Anyway, back to the hotel--the courtyard was very pleasant and so was the pool and the staff was very nice and accomodating. I also liked that there were vending machines for snacks/soda/water. Not alot of old hotels have them, and it was a nice convenience. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, fabulous/quiet location in Quarter, affordable rates!”
Reviews.Author: suemonty1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel due to its awesome location and affordable rates. Yes, it's a little worn around the edges but it still has a lot of charm, friendly and accommodating staff, (save for one surly housekeeping staff member) and a large, lush courtyard with small pool and fountains to sit and relax in the morning to plan your day while enjoying their Continental breakfast of coffee, tea, juice, Danishes or croissants. Our room was on the first floor behind the courtyard, which was not the second-floor room we were told we'd get when I reconfirmed our reservation. At first disappointed, especially since it was musty, we had no choice but to accept since the hotel was full. Room itself was easily accessible, large by most standards with windows, clean, with comfortable kind/queen-sized bed. Negatives: mustiness at times, very small bathroom, although sink/counter area is outside from actual bath and toilet, broken room safe on last day which was fixed quickly. You just can't beat the location: it's on the quieter side of the Quarter but so close to everything. A short walk to Cafe du Monde, Bourbon and Royal Streets, Jackson Square, etc. If you park your car it's $28/night. They will hold your luggage after check-out if you have a later flight. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, friendly staff, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: sailorwife23320
Reviews.Content: My mother in law, a friend, and myself decided to stay here again. I had been there a year before with my daughter and after a good stay then, I figured let's give it another go and we were not disappointed! The staff was super friendly especially when it came to finding late night dinner and giving us menus of who delivered. The rooms are older but in my opinion were very spacious. You can NOT beat the location! It is less than a block to Jackson Square, just over a block to the riverfront, and about two blocks off Bourbon St. Most important, Laissez les bons temps rouler!!!

Reviews.Title: “Toward the quiet side of the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: tuffy26l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little tucked away which I liked, but it is very close to all of the action of Bourbon Street. We had pretty good service in the lobby and there was someone to help us with the bags. I like the charm of the outside courtyard and all of the plants and trees. Our room was just average, but that's what I expected from other reviews. The bed was pretty bouncy which says old to me, but again, that was expected. I would probably stay here again, especially for the location. If you go in knowing what to expect, I think it's so easy to find the great things about the Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: cmh621
Reviews.Content: The Place d'Armes is a clean, nice hotel in a superb location. I loved the history, architecture, and courtyard of the hotel. The front desk was always friendly and helpful... on our last day, we checked out at 11 but had a later flight, so the front desk held our luggage so we could enjoy the day; they also had a cab waiting for us to take us to the airport. The room itself was okay - it had no windows, but we knew that going in and it was still well worth the price we booked for. The room was a little outdated and small, but clean, with maid service everyday. We were fine with the room b/c we spent little time in it, so keep that in mind when booking. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and you really cannot beat the location of the hotel. You are literally within walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want?”
Reviews.Author: Stefan V
Reviews.Content: I want time 'to slow' on my vacation. To be not shy, have no worries, and stay in place filled with mysterious experiences. My car drove 3200 miles on this road trip and a shocking elevator ride that places your car to your parking space on upper floor was fully and well deserved. Place d'Armes Hotel is unique and very expensive hotel. And I mean I paid the good price for a very expensive accommodations. The metal speared bed frames, antique writing tables, wall paper filled with incursive hand writing from circa '1700, furniture of all kind, old brick houses, alleys, walkways, and hallways, statues, lamps and lamps and all kinds of lamps all over the establishment filling it with light of 1000's shades. Absolutely stunning. Watch out for ghosts. They are very nice if you play nice. : ) Also one of many holding a forever light(lights that shine and stay on forever to grace the living spirits.) Besides I am a guitar player I also am a hotel manager. I have managed a Hyatt Beach House Resort in Key West and also Historic Key West Inns, just to state my qualifications. I will always remember Place d'Armes and its wonderful staff and inhabitans and I look forward and pray for my next stay with them. Stefan Vranovsky, Key West [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe location”
Reviews.Author: Revrmm
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful and surprising place that is hidden from the hustle of the French Quarter while being in the heart of it. Built around a wonderful courtyard, it is a pleasant place from which to retreat from the possibly wild. We enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Mitzi J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a cruise to do some extra shopping. This hotel is in the perfect location as it is centrally located and close to everything. It is also a beautiful hotel with several small courtyards. The only negative is that the bed we had was not all that comfortable. My husband had an interesting experience the night before we left. We came in early that night as we were tired from all the walking. My husband began to start coughing after we went to bed. He couldn't get comfortable and neither of us could sleep. He finally decided to take a shower and see if that would help. Several minutes after his shower began he abruptly came out of the bathroom and asked if I was ok. I said I was fine. He went back to his shower and soon after came to bed. After we left the next day he told me that during his shower he heard the door to our room open and slam shut and then me call his name and ask for help. I never heard anything.

Reviews.Title: “Real feel for New Orleans....”
Reviews.Author: BarleyHops
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here as the location was perfect (only a couple blocks from Bourbon street, cafe du monde, and Jackson Square), the staff super friendly, and their inside courtyard had a real NOLA feel. It was great to sit in the courtyard while drinking your morning coffee. The rooms are older, but large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: wahinisis
Reviews.Content: This is quite small, but great ambiance. I would stay away from the interior rooms that seemed smaller, but also darker if you want to sleep in. The corner rooms seemed larger. We did not run into any ghosts, but it was not for lack of trying :) (it is supposed to be haunted!).

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: JSibold
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes may not be the most hi-tech hotel, but it is a very affordable, convenient, clean stay. We loved the court yard - pool area and the room provided a old world feel. We did not have a window, but the brick walls and high ceilings made us feel we were in a European lodge - only upgrade I would like to see is to upgrade the TV and reception - but, who stays in the room anyway! It was all you would want for the great price we paid. Maid service was great and property was clean. Staff is excellent and eager to assist. One word of caution - if driving, the parking garage is very compact - our Durango was a tight fit. Great location - close to everything! Walk to Bourbon St, Jackson Square, Riverwalk, Market is just steps away. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Balcony in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Lenjane
Reviews.Content: Great location, room with large balcony great. Only downside was breakfast - poor croissants and some sweet pastries. Nice garden with pool.

Reviews.Title: “Room burglarized! No management contact!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick P
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Place D'Armes from 09/28/11 to 10/01/11. Our room (212) was up a staircase that led ONLY TO THAT ROOM! No other rooms were accessed via that staircase, and we never saw another guest or hotel employee other than housekeeping come up the stairs. On the morning of 09/30, we returned from breakfast and touring to find the room had already been cleaned. We hung out for a couple of hours, deciding where to eat lunch on the way to a riverboat cruise. We left at around 12:15, and returned at 6pm to find an $800 iPad had been taken from the room. All doors were locked (including those to the balcony). We went through the room (and our luggage) with a fine toothed comb before contacting the front desk. The front desk worked with us to contact the police, and we filed a report on the spot. We were told by the front desk that key logs for the electronic doors existed, but were accessible only to management, who would not be in until Monday (this was Friday night). We were assured MANY times that this had 'never happened here before!'. Needless to say, that evening was ruined. My wife didn't even want to leave the room to eat dinner, and we were very ready to check out the next morning. A week later, we have still heard nothing from the hotel management about the incident or what was found via the key logs. You'd think that if this was such a rare occurrence, management would be a little more concerned. This was not the first time we have stayed at the Place D'Armes, but it will be the last. We love the hotel, but this was atrocious customer service during an already painful incident.

Reviews.Title: “first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: turkeyroost3
Reviews.Content: we visited nola first time last wk sept 2011 and found it to be an excellent choice both as a hotel and a great location for for just about everything! the staff was excellent and thanks to Carlos for some tips and info on the city when we return this will be our hotel for sure! the building and courtyard are very nice also its close to jackson square my only advice is our room 129 was street level with lots of early morning truck noise other than that very private

Reviews.Title: “Love the 2nd floor balcony room....”
Reviews.Author: Deanna L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there this year for the first time but it will not be our last. When were first arrived we were given a 3rd floor balcony room that looked nothing like the pictures shown on the hotels website. It was a very small room with a very small balcony. I called the front desk and told them we were not pleased with the room and would like a 2nd floor room, they moved us and we could not have been happier. There was a world of difference in the size of the two rooms, even though they were the same rate. Loved the cozy feel of the hotel, the courtyard was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/service will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: lilpeaches
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NOLA with my husband so we nothing to compare it to but I believe we couldn't be much happier with our experience. Upon arrival to the parking ramp, they were very helpful and Mario took our luggage and we were greeted very warmly by front desk staff. We were brought to our room 124 facing the smaller courtyard area. Room very clean and comfortable. Yes its dated but its a historical hotel! That is what we were looking for and yes there was a very slight musty odor but it is to be expected when staying in a hot humid part of the country. We heard it was haunted but really had no experiences besides a few unexplained knocking sounds. The location couldn't be better because you are so close to Bourbon st. and Jackson square but its quiet enough to get needed sleep and relaxation! We parked our car the whole time and were able to walk to any place we wanted to go. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy refuge in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LaurenK315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here September 2011 for one week in an interior room (no windows) on the second floor. The hotel was in the perfect location where we could walk to museums, shops, bars, and restaurants during our stay. The amenities were very nice. We enjoyed our room; though it was small it was comfortable. Everything seemed updated but kept in a modern sort of the period style. The courtyard was beautiful and provided a nice, quiet refuge in the middle of the French Quarter. We were amazing that despite the partying up the street the courtyard was quiet and peaceful. My only criticisms would be the shower head that lacked any and all pressure and one of the front desk persons. The woman who checked us in was what I would refer to as less than friendly. While we were waiting in the lobby we witnessed her being much nicer to the older guests who were checking in and felt some-what put off. Also, just be aware if you plan to park a vehicle at the hotel the rate is around $23 per day but the valets were helpful, expedient, and careful (no damages) and it allowed for unlimited in-and-out service. All in all we greatly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: doctorlorra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot. Quiet but close enough to the action and the Cafe Du Monde. Beautiful Courtyard. My only complaint was the bed. They really need to upgrade the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my forever New Orleans hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaReynaBrogan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October 2010 for our honeymoon. We were looking for something a little more special since it was such a special occasion for our travel. Our room was fantastic; we stayed in a Junior Suite and it was worth every penny. It was beautifully decorated and nice and roomy. The hotel is much larger than it looks from the street and has an amazing courtyard and pool. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's perfectly situated in the French Quarter, just a block down from Cafe du Monde and Jackson Square, and two blocks from Bourbon Street. It made walking around much easier. The staff was exceptional. They even held our bags for us behind the front desk when we checked out so we could enjoy a little more time in the Quarter before our cab arrived to take us home. We'll never stay anywhere else in New Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a trip to NOLA to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Mamahen53
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the night at Place d'Armes Hotel before boarding the ship for our cruise. Honestly, I think I enjoyed this hotel more than I did the cruise! Our room #223 had a balcony overlooking Chartres Street, where we enjoyed watching the people and tourists of New Orleans pass by. Horse (or mule) drawn carriages often stopped just below and to the right of our balcony, where the drivers would tell the story of the ghost who lives in the hotel. They set a table for this ghost every night.... When inside the room, we heard no noise from the street. We walked a couple of blocks to Landrey's Seafood restaurant for dinner, which was awesome. Although they offer free continental breakfast at the hotel, we chose to walk one block to Cafe du Monde and have coffee and beignets. I can't think if a better way to start the day! We drive a (new) crew cab truck, which I worried would be too long for their parking garage. I was surprised to find that there is a car elevator, which takes the cars to their parking spots. Not to worry. Our truck rode the elevator and came back out without a scratch. Room 223 has its own narrow staircase, which only leads to this 2nd floor room and its balcony. We liked the privacy of it, but I admit that it was hard on our aging legs. We had to ask for help in taking our luggage up and down those steps. So we both liked and disliked the private stairs. The room is big, with a high ceiling and what was once a working fireplace that is covered now. It is furnished in beautiful antiques and has a ceiling fan. The only negatives would be that the room and balcony show their age and are not "sparkling clean" and in perfect repair. However, I can overlook the fact that it wasn't a pristine environment, because after all, this hotel is centuries old! Also, there is an air conditioning unit in the room, which makes noise when it cuts on and off. It did not bother me, but my husband noticed it. The courtyard is charming and is probably just as it was 2 centuries ago. However, the surface is very uneven and would not be suitable for anyone whose mobility is challenged. As far as I could tell, all guests must pass through the courtyard to enter and exit the hotel. I was impressed with the fact your hotel key was required to re-enter the hotel lobby at night, which made me feel safer. I should mention that our son had an inside room which was in another part of the hotel. He said it was very small and "nothing like our room". I will assume that the lower priced rooms are in the category of "You get what you pay for." Spring for a balcony. You won't regret it! Overall, I LOVE this hotel and can't wait to go back to Place d'Armes!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: cpeters220
Reviews.Content: This is not the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed in, but for the price it was quality. The location was fantastic, central to everything. The courtyard with pool was serene, and the rooms had everything you need, except wifi. My room didn't have a window, which is fine, because I sleep better without light shining in my face. I was disappointed that I could not connect to wifi in my room. The porters were more friendly and helpful than the front desk. If you don't need to park here, then it is worth the price. I parked in Farbourg Marigny on the street for free, after offloading my bags. Saved $60 in parking for my two-night stay, and gave me an excuse to do some extra walking. All in all I would stay here again if I didn't find something more fabulous first.

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay”
Reviews.Author: ReviTULize
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the 4th time this past weekend. we also brought friends and got 3 other rooms. The courtyards are probably my favorite. We also love that it's close to everything, but a little off the Bourbon St path. we didn't use any fitness facilities so we gave a 5-star so that no points were penalized.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking Lie”
Reviews.Author: C O
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NO on September 7th and went to the Vistor Centre looking for accomodation. A lovely lady there directed us to a touch screen booking system and advised us of the Place D'Armes hotel with free parking. On the screen the hotel was advertised as $ 59 per night with FREE PARKING. We contacted the booking office via the booking system and booked a room for $ 79 with free parking. (The $ 59 rooms have no window). When we arrived at the hotel we were told the parking was $ 28 + tax per night extra. When we queried this we were told parking was never free. With some haggling the desk person allowed us 1 night free parking. The next day we raised the issue with another staff member who told us the "free parking in the advert was subject to availability" - whatever that means. We found the staff very unfriendly and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: weavit
Reviews.Content: I so enjoyed my short stay at Place d'Armes. The physical setting is almost unbelievable: the lush, shady courtyard hidden back behind a fairly neutral reception room, the incredible location across the street from the Cathedral, a block from Cafe du Monde. I felt completely safe and protected back in my courtyard room, but could be out seeing the sights in seconds. People were friendly AND competent, air conditioning and ceiling fan did the job-- which was pretty important in August! The buildings are very old, and "updates" over the years seem to have been done respectfully so that the charm remains, but your basic 21st-century amenities are covered. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option off the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ashleye54
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed one night in the Place D'Arms hotel after having to stay an extra night in New Orleans due to hurricane Irene. We did some quick research and walked over to the hotel and easily booked a room for one night. The hotel seemed like a cute boutique style place and the location was prime. We booked the cheapest room at a rate of $69/night and didn't expect anything fancy. It turns out the rooms are HUGE suite style spaces. We were shocked at the size. Very clean and comfortable, great working A/C. Everyone that works at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. They also had a cute backyard with a small pool, but we did not use it. A hop, skip and a jump to Cafe Dumonde. They do have free continental breakfast--it's not much but still nice to have! You won't be disappointed if you stay here! Great staff and experience all around!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay when in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: MissinNola
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to NOLA for over 10 years now. We stayed here our 3rd trip down. I had intended that we stay at a different place each time we went to NOLA, but I loved it here so much that the only time we don't stay here is when I decide we are coming down to New Orleans and I can't get a room here because they're booked. The courtyards are gorgeous, the pool is very nicely kept, the rooms are very charming, and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. I suggest spending a few extra dollars to get an exterior courtyard room. To sit on the balcony at the end of the night and taking in the beautifully lit courtyard is heaven. I'm spoiled now; I won't do it any other way. And while you're there, talk to Nate, he's one of the valets; he can share a wealth of information about the city and give suggestions and directions on where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jasmich
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children teenage children in a junior suite. It had plenty of room. We took advantage of the courtyard and pool on the very hot days. It is hard to believe that you are a block from Jackson Square when you are in your room and in the courtyard. This place really has a lot of character.

Reviews.Title: “All we expectedâ€¦.and more”
Reviews.Author: Dawnana
Reviews.Content: When we return to NOLA, which we will do without a doubt, Place dâ€™Arms will be the hotel of our choice. For our first visit to this beautiful, bustling, historical city during the first weeks of August, we stayed for 4 nights in a junior suite facing the courtyard. The suite was perfect for my husband and myself, and consisted of a bedroom and an adjoining room with a sofa, mini-refrigerator, microwave, closet, desk and sink. Given the ample portions of the restaurant meals that we consumed during our visit, I made good use of both the mini-refrig and microwave for heating up leftovers for snacks. On the third night our 15-year-old granddaughter joined us and stayed on the fold down sofa bed, and given the suite configuration we all felt sufficient privacy and space. Just a few feet away from our door was the courtyard and swimming pool, and we made ample use of both. The rooms were clean and well maintained and it was easy to hook up to the free wi-fi. The only downer about this suite is that I love waking to natural light and because we were on the ground floor, next to the pool, we had to keep our drapes closed for privacy, making the rooms too dark for my comfort level. Others might not mind this so much as both rooms did have adequate lighting from lamps and light fixtures. Best of all about this hotel, is the incredibly convenient location, as it is just a few steps away from Jackson Square. We had no need for a car to get to all of the places we wanted to go, including a walking tour of the Garden District. Across the street is the â€œKatrina and beyondâ€� exhibit located in the Presbytere, which provides a sober analysis of the effects and aftermath of the 2005 hurricane on the city and population. I and my family were emotionally affected by this exhibit and found it well worthwhile to spend a couple of hours or so viewing the videos, artifacts and even the piano recovered from the flooded home of Fats Domino. Just a couple of blocks away from the hotel is CafÃ© du Monde, where you can treat yourself if you are brave to a plate of beignets, or on down another block or two, is the Central Grocery Company which serves the humongous Muffelettas. Thanks to the Place dâ€™Armes for the mini-refrig. I could go on and on about all of the activities and points of interests all within walking distance of this hotel: Bourbon Street, jazz/blues clubs, great restaurants, the Mississippi Riverwalk, the trolley that runs along the river to downtown and the Aquarium of the Americas, the 1850 House and so much more. At the center of all of this, is the Place dâ€™Armes, a wonderful hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: guidosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place d'Armes three years in a row for our anniversary. We had court rooms twice and an interior room once, the latter of which you want to avoid. There is a main court with a pool surrounded by lush tropical plantings and a side court with a small fountain and a pristine and quiet atmosphere. If you like your room quiet, try to get one in that smaller side court. Just staying in the courts with a good book is a good vacation already, but you also can reach all of the French Quarter within minutes of walking. Don't like the free breakfast selection? Just walk to any of the charming little cafÃ©s and do some people watching! When the midnight munchies hit, the Clover Grill is just a few blocks north on Bourbon. While there are plenty of tourist traps around, New Orleans still has what it takes for a great Southern stay with deeply rooted culture and flair. Just writing this makes me ache to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm the Jewel of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BuenProvecho61
Reviews.Content: While driving through New Orleans we had not planned on staying more than just the day, we were pleasantly surprised to find a hotel not only in New Orleans but right in the heart of the French Quarter and in short walking distance from Bourbon Street. The hotel itself was a beautiful old building with brick, glass oil lamps,court yards, fountains, and arches throughout which we discovered was the original site of an old school. It was like stepping into an old European country with all of its old world charm. The room itself was huge with extremely high ceilings, double doors, and arched entryway, super comfortable beds, A large flat screen t.v. a fireplace, plenty of storage in a big closet and dressers, and a huge bathroom. The pretty lavish room was clean with no hint of cigarette smoking. The hotel staff were extremely kind and helpful making their guests feel like they were royalty. The hotel was a block from Bourbon Street, close enough to walk to but far enough away that you didn't hear the residual noise. It was also right around the corner from the Cathedral, and down the street from the river walk, and Cafe du Monde, and you could walk to connect with any of the cities fine street cars going in various directions. Not to mention, their warm and soothing pool in the center courtyard. For these types of amenities you expect to pay exorbitant prices, but along with our free parking we were astounded at the reasonable prices for this "Jewel of the French Quarter".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordBecky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute as we were spending 4 weeks travelling across the USA. It is in a perfect location, minutes walk away from many attractions in the French Quarter. On arrival we were upgraded immediately to a junior suite without asking! The rooms are gorgeous. The courtyard and suite are also a little peaceful haven. The breakfast is included and I would have rated the hotel 5 if there had been a little more choice as there were mini muffins, danishes and croissants on offer. I would love to go back to this hotel and beautiful city. Parking was available right next to the hotel for a small daily charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convient location, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: eurotrip55
Reviews.Content: We are arrived for a long weekend. We left our bags at the front desk and proceeded to enjoy the day. They were unable to get our room ready any earlier , but that was the only complaint. The rooms were clean and spacious. Make sure you ask for a window or you could get stuck with no sunlight. The place is located just down the street from Jackson square, so it is very convient and far enough away from Bourbon st. It's court yard is charming and relaxing, with a small pool. In general I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a French Quarter stay; charm, comfort, service.”
Reviews.Author: PetePoodle
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Our double-queen room was decent sized, spotlessly clean, quiet, and elegantly decorated. The maze of lush courtyards, dotted with little tables and graced with a small but pristine pool, was gorgeous. The service was top-notch, and even though our room was right off the street, no noise to speak of. The location is great; steps from the square and all it has to offer, away from Bourbon street and (most of the) noisome drunks. Breakfast measly, but good enough. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience New Orleans! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Mcd8kids
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and will in the future! Location is PERFECT! Older, classic French Quarter Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but disapointing room and parking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: StevieBazoba
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in the French Quarter. The building has a lot of character and charm, but the room we were given was a windowless dungeon. It felt like a storage closet converted to to a room. The worst part of the experience is that our car was damaged in the parking garage. Parking is expensive ($25 per day). We noticed after leaving the hotel that the front bumber had been pulled off. It was clear that the attendant had manually put the bumper back in place to discguise the damage.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Fantastic, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Hexum2600
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes was one of the most enjoyable hotels I have ever stayed at! The people at the front counter were friendly when we checked in (although one of my friends said that she was brusque to them when they checked in, not rude but short) and the bellboy who took our stuff to the room was very nice and helpful. Our car was valeted immediately and when we received it back it was in perfect shape. They upgraded us to a Junior Suite (room 111) which was fantastic. The rooms weren't huge, but they were more than large enough for the two people staying in them. They were newly renovated and clean, and the decoration and bedspread was new and comfortable. The bed was good, nothing amazing but much better than I have had in many hotels. The courtyards were simply beautiful. Well maintained and clean, there was always someone sitting at a table reading or a person or two in the pool. The pool itself was sparkling clean and even though I decided to go for a late night swim the gentlemen taking out the trash told me that as long as I was quiet no one cared that I was swimming. Since I like swimming right before bed, this was a huge plus (and I never make any noise when doing so). Checkout was easy, the price was exactly what I was quoted. One of my friends that had been staying in another room could not get his car started and the hotel let him keep his car there a couple more hours to get it fixed. Excellent service. I did check out one of the interior rooms (no window or balcony) while I was here, and it was just as nice as the suite that I had, if a little smaller. The bathroom was especially nice in the smaller room, I would have been very happy there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BJHAdvanceMo_
Reviews.Content: We are from Mo. and have stayed here twice in the last two years and will always stay at the Place d' arms! Everything about it is beautiful and charming, the staff is always great and very helpful and it's the best location in town! We really love it and never want to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PeteL180
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in the French Quarter. Great staff. Very Helpful. Nice pool and courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: mikeywaz
Reviews.Content: OK, it was July, so it was hot and humid - definitely off-deason, but we had a nice room for under $100/night steps from Jackson Square. Place d'Armes is next to the St. Louis Cathedral and just 1 1/2 blocks to Bourbon Street. Nice courtyard with pool, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: PrivateEyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the french quarter. It is on a quiet street with lovely restaurants nearby. The rooms have bags of characters and are impeccable. The beds are huge and the decor is very pretty. The hotel has a quaint courtyard and pool which was lovely to use for breakfast or an evening coffee. The hotel is great value considering where it is situated. In another city it would probably be far more expensive considering how well run it is. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as a base to explore new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming!”
Reviews.Author: j l
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Place D'Arms. Great location, friendly service, interesting rooms. My 3-year old said it was her favorite part of New Orleans! It's a wonderful retreat in the middle of all the bustle. Very clean. Great for families or just couples. I'm one to try new places, but if I go back to New Orleans, I'd definitely go back to Place D'Arms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ok room”
Reviews.Author: livelaughlove42
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. We were able to walk EVERYWHERE from all the action surrounding Jackson Square, 1 block from Cafe Du Monde to walk for coffee in the am, to Bourbon Street, Frenchmans, and even to downtown for gambling, and spa action. You could hear the garbage trucks in the am but other than that, the noise from Bourbon was slim to none. The breaksfast they served complimentary was simple but excellent- croissants and coffee was great too, local and national newspapers to read. Our room didn't seem to be the cleanest to me....faint burnt smell in the bedroom almost like there was once a fire in the area? (luckily I had a travel candle with me and kept it lit at all times) I was wishing I had brought my own pillow and blanket. The decor definitely needs an update---comforters, scratches in our sink and tub porcelin in the bathroom and the carpet was skeevey. I wore flipflops the whole time. The old exposed brick is neat but with the decor can make it feel really dark and gloomy. Great balcony off our room where we could hear local jazz though. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, if I were to go back to New Orleans for a quicker trip (2-3 days) vs. 5-6 then I may stay here again. You are really not in the rooms much at all. The pool area is very charming as well.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, affordable gem in the heart of the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: BrokenBob
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel when looking for a good rate. What we found was not only an amazing bargain, but also a charming location rich with character right off Jackson Square in the heart of the French Quarter. From the time we were greeted at check-in to getting our car from the garage to leave, the staff was warm and welcoming. We loved the decor: gas lamps, tasteful furnishings, a lush pool area, traditional balconies and courtyard. The building was originally in the first school in Lousiana. Much of the earlier architecture is still beautifully evident. The rooms are perhaps a bit smaller than in more modern chain hotels, but were very comfortable and more than adequate for a great night's stay. We travelled with friends who have visited NOLA before, but they now say this is the "only place" they will stay in the future. The location truly could not be better! We can't wait to return and explore more of New Orleans with the Place d'Armes as our home.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ken0123
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed there last weekend. Another great experience. Love being in the middle of everything. Interior rooms are quiet at night, but no windows. Street rooms have windows/ balconies, but are louder at night. We had an exterior, street room this time. Great balcony. I slept fine. Girlfriend said she was awake half the night as she's a light sleeper. So that's a consideration. Staff is super friendly. This place is dripping with N'Orleans charm. Remember, this place is not new. I believe it's the oldest hotel in the french quarter. You can't have both a new 5 star and also 200 yr old brick construction & courtyards, etc. You gotta pick. We prefer the charm of an older, well maintained hotel, which this is. But it's not perfect. Girlfriend wants hooks in the bathroom and more hangers. Our sink strainer popped off. Neither bothered us, frankly. Everyone at the desk is great including Lyn, the owner Bubba who we met, and this other sweet girl whose name I can't recall. But I know she has a beautiful 3 yr old daughter because she showed us pictures. What more can I say? It feels like a family run hotel because everyone is so friendly. So, if you want to be in the middle of the action and meet people and are flexible about the details, stay here. But if you require 4-5 star everything, you'll be happier elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the charm”
Reviews.Author: lclark266
Reviews.Content: For the true French Quarter experience stay here. Beautiful courtyard!!! Right in the middle of all the fun!! You can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: Janic11
Reviews.Content: We weren't looking for PERFECT even though it was our honeymoon. Really, no expectations of perfect!! But it was! The locals were so friendly and the hotel was just perfect! It's exactly what I had hoped for. Historic yet updated with all the comforts of home! The view from the balcony was beautiful and the courtyard was fanstastic! I loved walking through it every morning on my way to grab some breakfast. I would rate the hotel as a 5 if they had room service - other than that I could ask for more! If anyone thinks this town is still sufferng from Katrina - you're right but the tourist areas are just perfect! We toured Jackson Square, Bourbon Steet, the entire French Quarter and the Garden District and you'd never know they had a natural disaster! No worries - please consider this as your next vaction spot, you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great for the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ktmccb
Reviews.Content: This place is just off Jackson Square in the French Quarter of New Orleans. 2 minute walk to Cafe du Monde or St. Louis Cathedral. Location is great. Now for the rooms, this place is older. Shabby chic comes to mind. First time my family stayed at Place d'Armes was 1975. The rooms are varying sizes and some of them have no windows at all. Best idea is to call hotel direct for info on rooms if you don't feel you have enough information from website. If you want quiet, be sure to ask for courtyard room. Anything on St. Ann side of building will hear everything on the street. The rooms are well appointed, but things are starting to show their age a little. She's a grand old lady but her slip is showing was a description a family member used. French quarter hotels are like this unless they have gone through a complete overhaul. This hotel is for people who want the convenience of being in the quarter and don't expect the Four Seasons. They have a breakfast available, but I always walked to Cafe du Monde for breakfast or one of the cafes on Jackson Square. Great restaurant right next door for dinner. Rooms are comfy and so are the beds. Bathrooms are clean as are the rooms and the staff is always courteous and the front desk folks are a font of information on the city. Prices are awesome off season.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NycLwl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Place d'Armes Hotel at the end of July. We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. For example, the bellman helped us get oriented with the hotel and how to get to our room. The concierge recommended restaurants to try around the hotel, and helped us book our tour. The lobby was very nice. The courtyard was also quite charming. We didn't take advantage of the pool or hang out in the courtyard during our stay, but it looked like a relaxing experience in a private garden. I envied the people who had rooms with the courtyard access. They can go for a dip in the pool and head back to their room easily. We stayed on the fifth floor in a junior suite. The room was great and much bigger than I expected. It had a king size bed, a couch, a microwave, and a refrigerator. The room was clean and quiet, and the air conditioning worked very well. The room had small windows that faced the courtyard. The bed was very comfortable. Only things that I wasn't crazy about was the carpeting in our room, the elevator, and the breakfast. I'm not sure if the carpet was old and worn or affected by the humidity, but it seemed sticky to me when I walked around barefoot. I just kept my socks on while we were in the room. The elevator was small and quite slow. It took a while for the elevator to get to the 5th floor. Luckily we didn't have to go up and down too much. Breakfast consisted of only croissants, muffins and danishes. There was coffee, tea, juice and apples/oranges too. It was okay, but I was looking for something more to sustain me until lunch. We didn't have a car during our stay, but I noticed that there is a parking garage next to the hotel with an entrance from the hotel. I saw that the parking rate was $28/night. The location of the hotel was amazing. It was center to everything. Just a block away was Cafe du Monde. Less than a block away was Jackson Square. In the opposite direction, Bourbon Street was a block away too. The blocks are not very long in the French Quarter, so getting to the east and west perimeters of the FQ from the hotel was so easy. My husband and I would definitely come back to Place d'Armes if we returned for another visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Fredstravelingfun
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 4 night stay At Place d' Armes Monday and I look forward to going back. The staff was more then welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was just ok, but we viewed it as a bonus anyways. We stayed in rm 223 and thought it was very large with a great view from the balcony. We could see Jackson Square and St. Louis Cathedral. The courtyard was lush and relaxing. I do have a couple haunted stories though. I woke up to something stepping over my feet while I slept. I woke up to hear "it" jump off the end of the bed and run away. Apparently , the hotel used to be one of the first schools in New Orleans. The 2nd floor is were the kids slept. 2nd story comes from my uncle and cousin stayed in Feb. of this year. My uncle woke up every night to the door being open. When he went to close it, it would already be shut. He also recalls hearing children playing all night. Just some cool stories about a couple visits. I don't think I would stay anywhere else in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: HOTEL011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dripping with New Orleans Charm. From the gas lamps outside, to the cute little quaint courtyard. There is a pool in the courtyard for those hot humid days. We stayed on the top floor and had a huge room. It had such charm including a brick wall. The hotel came with breakfast (coffee and croissants). Overall, it was a great place to stay in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...and Charm :)”
Reviews.Author: teacher523
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to NOLA so I did a lot of research in hotels and ended up booking the Place D Armes on a whim...it was not my first choice. What a wonderful and lucky whim it turned out to be! This hotel has all the charm of typical NOLA. The rooms are not fancy or huge but are beautifully quaint. The staff was amazing...they were always on top of whatever we needed and very willing to help and give directions and information about the area. And when i say LOCATION...I mean perfect location! Saint Louis Cathdral and Jackson square are steps from your door...Cafe Du Monde is less than a block...Bourbon is 2 blocks. The area is full of people and goings on! Place D Armes is my all time NOLA go to! AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Place d'Armes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdc0624
Reviews.Content: We stay several times a year at Place d'Armes Hotel. This time will be our last. I was traveling with my 75 year old mom who is handicapped. I had asked for a specific room as I knew it would meet our needs and was told "we cant guarantee requests" When we checked in, the room I requested was full. The room we had was terrible. It was a long walk for my mom from the elevator to her room, and the bathroom was too small for her walker and she nearly fell. My husband has a larger bathroom in his 27 ft. travel camper. The next morning my kids spotted folks checking out of the room I had requested so I called the front desk to ask to be moved to that room for our second night. I was told, someone is checking into that room today and they had specifically requested that room. HAHA. What about "we cant guarantee special requests"? So we made the best of it and spent our last night in the room way way away from the elevator with the bathroom so small I had to decide if i wanted to scrape my booty or my boobs going thru the tiny bathroom door everytime I needed to use the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel if you choose the right room”
Reviews.Author: TandJ_Hitchin
Reviews.Content: We were in Texas visiting family and decided to do a quick side trip to New Orleans, our first visit there. We wanted to stay in the French Quarter, and this hotel seemed one to choose. We called the hotel and they said that they didnâ€™t have any rooms. But they did through Expedia so we booked for four nights, stipulating a king or queen and an exterior room (as some have no windows!). The room we got was an exterior one, but was pretty pokey, and we looked with envy at the rooms with balconies overlooking the courtyard and pool, but couldnâ€™t switch. The hotel itself was very pleasant, a rambly mix of old brick houses linked together. The staff were great, and the food for the continental breakfasts rapidly replaced. Parking at the hotel isnâ€™t cheap but costs less than at the other nearby public lots. But New Orleans beckoned, and we had a great four days of food, music and more food, and then more music, so the room became less important. If you stay here make sure you get a room on the second level overlooking the rear courtyard which may mean calling the hotel direct to make the booking.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter charm inside and out”
Reviews.Author: tdchastain
Reviews.Content: We decided upon this hotel because it seemed to be the most convenient to the areas we expected to be exploring. And, boy did we get this one right. The Place d'Armes Hotel overlooks Jackson Square and St Louis Cathedral, which means that one of the most popular areas of the city is right outside the front door. In fact, it seemed to be convenient to most everything we had on our to-do list. Though we were in an interior room without windows, we had balcony access mere feet from our door, and from it we enjoyed a superb view of the vendors and performers that were scattered about the square. I was a bit hesitant about the interior room, due mostly to some scathing reviews, but when you consider that New Orleans' bars and their patrons do not observe the normal hours of revelry or raucous exuberance, the thick interior walls provide the peace and serenity needed for that deep rejuvenating slumber required after a day of walking the beautiful French Quarter, River walk, or having a few or more drinks along Bourbon Street, which is but two blocks away. The hotel itself is everything you would expect from a hotel in the French Quarter. From the wrought iron oil lamps flickering about the great hall, to the lush foliage and flowering trees overlooking the upper courtyard to the lovely ironwork of the balconies, the Place d'Armes exudes a charm that is unmistakably old New Orleans. This, coupled with a staff that was at all times pleasant, helpful and willing to attend to every question and request we had throughout our stay, has convinced us that we have found our lodging accommodations for any future visits to the New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Phillychris
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a historic hotel in a great location. However, they have some problems with cleanliness. The outdoor pool area was scuzy. There were many things floating in the pool and the dirt was caked onto the wall tiles so thick that someone had actually written into the dirt "clean this pool." Many of the rooms open into a courtyard which is cool, but the rooms are all full of mosquitoes. My legs were so bitten up after three nights that I looked like I had been wandering through the jungle. We complained about the bugs and the staff was accomodating, but we ended up in three different rooms--first room had lots of mosquitoes. The Second room had a really weird smell and the third room had mosquitoes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Historic Hotel near Jackson Square.”
Reviews.Author: libelou5
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The room was great, I just loved the courtyard. This hotel is located on Ste. Ann St., a half a block from Jackson Square. There are many great restaurants within walking distance, Muriel's and Stanley are both only half a block away, and Cafe Du Monde is only one and a half blocks. This is an ideal location to anywhere in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: ceegee58jxn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Place d' Armes several times over the past couple of years, and it's great. The rooms range from tiny and intimate to large and comfortable, but all are charming. Location is great, just steps away from Jackson Square. Breakfast is pretty basic, but I've rarely been up in time for it, anyway!! Really a wonderful place to get the old New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Georgians-in-Motion
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this quaint hotel in New Orleans. We were staying in New Orleans for just one night on our way across the country and wanted to be in the French Quarter but because we were traveling with our 8 year old, we wanted to stay away from the debauchery of Bourbon Street. This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. It was right near Jackson Square, and Cafe du Monde. We were able to enjoy walking around the French Quarter and the French Market, easy walk to many, many restaurants. We particularly enjoyed watching the street musicians at dusk and just after dark. We chose the interior room with no windows due to budgetary reasons. The room was spacious, but its proximity to the breakfast lobby and elevators made the room very noisy. I'm sure the balcony rooms were much nicer. For the price, however, we were not disappointed. The room was a great deal for the price. The courtyard and pool area were beautiful and parking was easy. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pellsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in July, and it was the most perfect hotel. A big, green garden with a nice pool in the middle. Our room had a big balcony facing the street, and it was super to sit there in the evenings looking at all the people passing by. The hotel is in the middle of the French Quarter and has friendly staff, quite good breakfast and a wonderful atmosphere. We'll be back. Pelle, Maria and Erik from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED PLACE D'ARMES”
Reviews.Author: Bunwim
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect!!! The hotel itself has old world New Orleans charm. We will never stay anywhere else. The staff was top notch. The courtyard is absolutely breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: dlbrownTuscaloosa_AL
Reviews.Content: Very middle of the French Quarter, good access to everythng. The continental breakfast was good, the room, courtyard, and lobby areas very clean. Great weekday price. What would I do different, get a room with a window, didn't think that would bother me but it did. The cleaning staff kept on knocking on the door to clean, even though we had put out the do not distrub sign. Check out time was 11 AM and we wanted to sleep to the last minute not be "rushed out" @ 9A.

Reviews.Title: “Location-Great....Building-Out Dated”
Reviews.Author: haliwa
Reviews.Content: Just remembered to post :-/ Hotel staff very professional, Location gives a REAL NOLA experience but I like the moderation of Hotels on canal street(ie: Marriott, Double Tree, Harrahs etc...) Speaking of Harrahs there buffet meals are delicious with a many selections. Overall though good way to start off.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Heaven-Would not even consider another place to stay in Mew Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Scaldismater
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here often. The first stay was based on value and location. It was our 1st visit to New Orleans. Expectations in each of these were exceeded. We were amazed at the beauty and charm of the hotel as a whole and our room specifically. We were doing mutual 'back-pat's and 'high-fives' at being surrounded by history at so little expense. These self-congratulatory actions were repeated each time we ventured out to explore this wonderful city. We were unbelievably close to each of our chosen destinations: Jackson Square, Antoinnes, Court of Two Sisters, Rodrigue Studio (blue dog), Cafe du Monde, Central Market, Flea Market, St. Louis Cemetery, Street Car stop. The list goes on and on. The front desk staff were excellent, helpful, friendly. No request was too small or too much. The courtyard is a pleasant area to rest, reflect, and/or eat one's complimentary breakfast. We were a bit surprised-in light of otherwise perfection-with the maid service. One day we returned to our room & the maid was just beginning to clean our room. We chose to have some pool time and she said she would let us know when she was finished-20 to 30 minutes. After an hour we returned to check. She was in an adjacent room & had forgotten to notify us. It was a rush for us to prepare & meet our dinner reservations. Another day we returned to a wonderfully clean room; however our consumed toiletries had not been replenished. We found this surprising especially because we had left her a tip. A call to the front desk & toiletries were promptly delivered. We cannot wait to return to this 'place' !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great location”
Reviews.Author: travel42257
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in April. We are a family of four, our kids 18 and 14 years old. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again if we were to visit New Orleans. The hotel's location is perfect, a few steps from Jackson Square and Cafe du Monde. The courtyard of this hotel is very lush and charming. We were in room 114 in the courtyard and thought it was perfect. We took our breakfast outside to eat in the courtyard. We thought the breakfast wasnâ€™t great, but it wouldnâ€™t keep us from here staying again. We didnâ€™t use the pool but it did look like it needed some cleaning. The staff was very nice and helpful whenever we asked a question. We didnâ€™t have a car so I canâ€™t comment on the garage. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: experiencecollector
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights before we hopped on a cruise ship to the Bahamas. The hotel's location is great, literally a few steps from Jackson Square and the world famous Cafe du Monde. It is also very close to Bourbon Street and it's unique nightlife. The courtyard of this hotel is very lush and charming. You would feel that you have been transported to a different era. Unfortunately the only room available for us to book was an interior, no windows!! I felt a bit claustrophobic since the room happens to be very small also. This is absolutely not a modern hotel with modern fixtures but I absolutely enjoyed it since I fancy original historical architecture. I just love New Orleans and her French Quarter and when we come back, I would not hesitate to stay in this place again, although I would choose a room with windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: rad243
Reviews.Content: We are down for a family wedding and stayed here because that was the place the family had blocked for the event. I would stay again if I come back. The interior rooms are small but the courtyard rooms are nice. We were in 114 and had a great view of the courtyard. Very pleasant spot for hanging out with family and friends, but some of the back courtyard rooms might be a little quieter when there's a lot of people drinking in the courtyard up front. The pool could have used a good cleaning when we were there. The parking fee was hefty, $28 + tax, but at least you have a spot there and it is secure in their garage. Since everything is in walking distance there is no need for a car while you are there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: manda_and_chris
Reviews.Content: When you look at this hotel, the first thing you must know is location, location, location! It is in the heart of the French Quarter, one block from Bourbon Street, half a block from St. Louis Cathedral, and one block from Cafe du Monde, all at the price you would pay for a chain motel or low end hotel outside the Quarter. The staff was very friendly, the hotel's buildings are historic and nice, and the accomodations quite comfortable. We stayed in the basic room with no window but have no complaints. The room was nice and clean with all of the amenities you would expect at any really good mid-range hotel. The continental breakfast was mostly fruit and pastries but they it was nice and tasty.
