The pastries were fresh from a bakery and not the from a warehouse store. My husband and I absolutely love this hotel and will not stay anywhere else on our return trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LQ4L
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quaint hotel with clean rooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good and the courtyard is beautiful. I booked this hotel without knowing anything about it, but I will definitely stay here every time! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!! No need to look anywhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ghoulies
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and myself have just returned home from New Orleans and another wonderful stay at the Place d'Armes Hotel. I have found my home away from home when visiting New Orleans, which is 2-3 times per year. Have already booked for my return trip in December. You cannot beat this hotel for quality, location, service or price anywhere in the French Quarter, and possibly the whole City of New Orleans. The breakfast was wonderful and some of the best coffee I have ever had. Our room was very clean and had one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kseis
Reviews.Content: We've been to New Orleans many times over the years, and this is by far the best place to stay in the French Quarter if you are looking for quiet and convenience. The door to the hotel is about 15 yards from Jackson Square, which is right across the street from Cafe Dumonde. It is also close to bourbon street, but far enough away to where you aren't disturbed by all the rowdiness. This is also close to the French Market and several amazing eateries.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: sherryfowlerhenson
Reviews.Content: We have been to New Orleans about five times and always stay here. We love this hotel because not only of the convenience to everything but some history. On one of our trips I was taking the ghost tour and it actually stopped by our hotel and stated it was known to be haunted. When I got back after the tour my husband and daughter said they heard children laughing and playing in the next room and the ceiling fan came on all by itself. There was no next room it was a brick wall outside!!!! I didn't believe it and my husband but he swears on our kids love it happened. Everytime we go back we always ask for this same room (#318) but have not been able to get it again. We are going July 12, 2011 and hopr to see or hear something. I need to see this for myself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: ses820313
Reviews.Content: The Place d'Armes Hotel is exactly what you would expect your New Orleans experience to be. It was so convenient to everything in the French Quarter such as Cafe du Monde, Antoines, Irenes, St. Louis Cathedral, etc. We were able to meet Mr. "Bubby" Valentino (manager) and he was so helpful and accomodating during our visit making several recommendations. The charm of the New Orleans style courtyard with the swimming pool was amazing and very private. Our room was very clean with a great view of the courtyard and swimming pool. This is one of our favorites and we will definitely be returning for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Siny718
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Place D' Armes for Mardi Gras this year and absolutely fell in love. The staff was very hospitable. The location was perfect! We were super close to Muriel's Jackson Sqare (a must go to restaurant), a block away from Cafe Du Monde, and literally almost across the street from Jackson Square. When we go back to New Orleans we will definitely stay at Place D'Armes again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...will stay again”
Reviews.Author: bklyn1056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at the Place d'Armes Hotel June 27 thru June 30th. We had a street view room which was lovely..next time however we will get the court yard view. Very nice experience...clean, pleasant, helpful staff. The only negative was that the bathroom was VERY small. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been More Perfect”
Reviews.Author: badlittlewashu
Reviews.Content: The website really does not do this place justice. Everything from the courtyard, the pool, the location and the staff, was awesome. Such a wonderful and amazing location. We stayed for three nights and it really was right in the middle of everything. This is the only place we are going to stay from now on. This hotel was better then the chain hotels, because this has more of the old school new orleans charm that we were looking for. Excellent service all around!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: JadeCorker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place d'armes hotel for our honeymoon on june 5-11th. We couldnt have imagined a better experience The location is absolutely perfect, right next to Jackson Square, a block away from cafe de monde and about two blocks from bourban street. It was also about a block to the mississippi river. and maybe two blocks to Jax Brewery (we loved the gumbo pot restaurant & the marie laveau bar) We also walked the 10 blocks or so to Frenchman st. but we didnt see what all the fuss was about. oh and I was a bit concerned being two blocks from bourban, but it was no big deal and was actually nice to be an extra block away from the craziness! It really is within walking distance to everything, just remember to wear comfy shoes bc your feet will hurt by the end of the week!! The courtyard was absolutely gorgeous and the pool was much bigger than it seemed in the photos!! It was so nice to be able to come back after a night of partying and jump in the pool. They had signs up saying the pool closed at a certain time, but we would be in it until all hours of the night with other people who had the same idea and not once did any of the staff comment. (but we werent being loud or obnoxious or anything, which probably helped) Oh and this isnt a hotel of a certain age (ie young people partying, older people, families) there really was a healthy mix of everyone. We are in our mid twenties and came across people to hang out with but there was a healthy mix of age groups and not too many kids or people partying. We had an interior room on the third floor, which was really nice. The only complaint is that we would sleep much later than normal due to not having windows and not realizing it was daytime lol normally i will wake up when it gets bright regardless of a hangover! I think next time we'll get a courtyard room, so we can have immediate access to the pool and can go out to smoke whenever, instead of going down the elevater and outside which was a pain. All in all, this was a great hotel and a great experience. We are already planning our next trip back and we will definately be coming back to the Place D'armes for all of our anniversaries and a Mardi Gras or two in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed”
Reviews.Author: frank141949
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the finest place by far to stay.The service and hospitallity were the best we have experienced. Dianne gave us such good advise on restaurants and excursions. Stewart and Chris were there to help you with anything you needed to make your stay fun and relaxing. The room was vey clean and confortable. You are in the heart of the French Quarter and walking distance to everythng. We will certainly stay there again. Frank from Fort Worth Texas

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: ShapD
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms booked for our party over 4 nights. Due to room complaints and booking conflicts we ended up seeing inside 5 different rooms, which gave us quite a good insight into this hotel. The major problem with this hotel I think is that the rooms are so variable. The first room we had was musty and dated in it's interiors. We didn't have a good impression. However, for our second night we were moved into the main building and had a great room i.e no mould smells, modern fit out, no noise etc. Same price, just luck of the draw. My brother ended up in a room withno windows that had a terrible odour from which we demanded he was moved from. Again, his room became better. This inconsistency is what really let's the hotel down as otherwise the hotel is satisfactory. Location is fantastic - you can roll out the door to Jackson Square. There is a good laundry service, no room service though. And our experience at the desk was variable - some staff were extremely hospitable, others were poor and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip and highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Amenson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Place dâ€™Armes Hotel on June 9-13. This was our first visit to New Orleans and we were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. Based on other reviews from TripAdvisor we selected the Place d'Armes Hotel. We were very pleased with the room (#229) selected for us with a balcony overlooking the street below. The staff was very cordial and helpful regarding suggestions for dining, ground transportation, etc. An especially nice touch was a knock on our door as we were unpacking and delivery of a bottle of iced champagne to help us celebrate our special occasion. I believe Lenny Labrousse was working behind the scenes to arrange the special room and champagne delivery. The courtyard with swimming pool and gardens was nice to return to in the evening. The central location to the French Quarter, Jackson Square and the Cajun Zydeco Festival was perfect. Looking forward to a second trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: RubberDuckyJJ
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of the action, this French Quarter location cannot be better. You are close to everything but far away enough from Bourbon to get decent sleep. Why decent sleep? Because the hotel is housed in historical buildings with old furnishings. Expect an old mattress and poor sheets and a floor that slants heavily. This means you will actually slide off the bed if you are not careful when rolling around! If you set your expectations properly, as in don't expect a "Heavenly Bed", you will have a grand time. Also, don't bring a car. It will cost you $25 a night to park it and you really don't need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful ambience, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: barooga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice. It's in a terrific position; close to everything, without your stay being spoiled by excess noise. The room we had was small but was furnished beautifully and was spotless. It overlooked the internal terraced garden and pool which were shaded by two really old and beautiful magnolia trees and was a great spot to just chill out while we planned our next days activities. The breakfast was fairly basic; danishes, croissants, tea coffee and cereal, but was pretty much on a par with other hotels we'd stayed in whilst in the US. (They don't have toast or raisin bread fellow aussies, or tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms, here or at most Americal hotels. We were fore-warned and took a one litre jug with us and our own tea-bags!) The lady who was managing the restaurant was very helpful and friendly too. I loved the ambience of the hotel. It's very old and has a great history and having somewhere to relax other than your room was a definite bonus. I reccommend the paddle steamer cruise. It was fantastic with a great jazz band on board, plenty of places to sit and listen to the tour guide provide the history of what we were passing and a magnificent sunset. A tour of the Oak Ave plantation, which is an hour and a half out of New Orleans by bus, is worth the effort. It's an amazing place and makes you feel your in the middle of Gone With The Wind! Bourbon street is brassy and bawdy with so many bars and restaurants to eat, drink and be entertained in, you'd need a month to visit them all. Frenchman Street, at the end of Bourbon had less people but the quality of the band and the sound was much better. The Katrina Museum, situated in the cathedral and opposite the hotel is definitely worth a visit, as is Cafe del Mar, about 100 metres from the hotel. (apparently you haven't really been to New Orleans if you haven't had icing sugar all over your face from the famous donuts!) The frozen yoghurt shop is also a definite must, 15 flavours and you serve as much of each or just one, as you like. Cheap way to keep cool and it's delicious. There are heaps of clothes stores but one of the best is 'Jackies' which is about two minutes walk from the hotel, in the same street. Beautiful clothing and wonderful fabrics at really cheap prices. We had an absolute ball and will go back again one day and would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location and Atmosphere Can't Be Beat!”
Reviews.Author: terrynok
Reviews.Content: Very nice historic hotel. It is a series of old buildings joined around a central courtyard. We arrived before check-in time but were able to park and check our bags. The staff was welcoming and pleasant. We walked literally across the street to Jackson Square to buy some street art from the vendors. Upon our return the room was ready and luggage was promptly brought up. Our room was as promised, 2 doubles with a streetside private balcony. Nice, very spacious, comfortable room although the bathrrom was a bit small compared to "new" standards. You have to expect this in an older and historic hotel. The same with thinner walls. We did have a very noisy neighbor who blared the TV very loudly until 2 AM. We called the front desk and the problem was taken care of immediately. I did look in the window of a few courtyard rooms and they were nice as well. I didn't peek in the windowless rooms, but if it clearly says no window, I'd believe them. Splurge for a room with a window. The bell captain and front desk ladies were quick to recommend "local" places to eat, off the normal tourist beat. All were fantastic (especially The Joint BBQ and Jack Dempsey's) and are now on my favorites list. The parking valet knew us by room number and car by the end of the 2nd day and we never waited more than a few minutes. Location is ideal, the hotel was very clean overall and all 6 of the staff we had direct contact with were very professional and polite. I subscribe to the "you get back what you put out there" theory and find that a little pleasantry and politeness on my part also goes a long way, so be nice to people in the service industry. The pool area we didn't use but the guests there seemed to enjoy it. Room service is not available but there are so many options within a few blocks of the lobby. There is a nice bistro, Muriel's, adjacent to the hotel that has a resident ghost that they set a table and light a candle for. This is the 7th different hotel I have stayed in here and there won't be an 8th. This is my hotel of choice from now on for our yearly trip to New Orleans. May try to squeeze in a long weekend around Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming place in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: rmare1013
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here for our very first trip to New Orleans.. I was a little worried because of some of the mixed reviews, but we found this place charming and right in style with the whole feel of the French Quarter. We had a suite and it overlooked the pool/courtyard. Our room was very pretty and clean. The bed was comfortable and the room temperature great (it was 97 in NOLA). The breakfast was just enough to get a start on the day and served very good coffee. The lady setting up breakfast was a beautiful, southern woman and added to the charm of the whole experience. The location of the hotel is the best in the City. I would certainly stay here again and will recommend it highly. Anyone who complains about this place should stay at a Sheraton or Hyatt because they don't know what charm is!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & NEAT rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LillyZackMom
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research before booking a hotel for our 15th anniversary trip. We wanted a hotel unique to NOLA. Not a hotel that could be in Manhattan, Chicago, or LA. We also wanted to be in walking distance from oh...EVERYTHING in the French Quarter. This hotel kept coming up, but a few negative reviews made me uneasy. In the end, I decided to take a chance and book it. I'm so glad I did. We stayed in room 110 which is right off the courtyard AND check-in hallway AND staircase. I was concerned about noise but was never awoken by any. The room had a single king bed and two very dark blue walls with two brick walls that were once on the exterior. There was one small window, and while the overall feel of the room was dark, plenty of lights made it brighter and it had that unique personality my husband and I wanted. The bed was fine, towels were plentiful and of reasonable quality. Hotel staff (both housekeeping, bellhop and front desk) were all helpful, friendly, and personable. The daily breakfast buffet was simple but perfectly adequate to keep us going until we were out and about, or until lunchtime when we could have some unique local food. Our room was clean and there were a few signs of age (nicks in the wallpaper, carpet didn't look particularly new), the uniqueness of it made up for that and again...everything was well kept. My two complaints are (1) we received fresh towels daily...which was nice but we easily could have reused the same set for our stay if we had been given the option, and (2) every day we received more complimentary soap, shampoo, and lotion even though the previous bottles we had received were unopened....silly waste of the hotel's money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: lovecharleston612
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. This hotel is perfect! Beautiful courtyard with pool, the location is perfect. You are literally next to Jackson square & can see cafe du monde at end of street. The service was good. Rooms were nice & clean. Bathrooms a little outdated but thats ok. We were on 5th floor with windows looking at street. Never noisy. Make sure u ask for rooms with windows! This place is supposedly haunted but we never saw anything ;) will come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lona_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the mid 90's, and we were very pleased with our stay. Our second visit, however, was disappointing. Our first room was swarming with mosquitoes, and although they were very accommodating and found us a different room, it really wasn't much better as far cleanliness was concerned. Yes, they suffered a lot from Katrina, but if most of the rooms on the first floor were affected by the water, they need a good bit more drying out and pest controlled. If you do stay here, ask for a room on the second floor in front of the hotel to avoid any nastiness caused by the hurricane.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mickmc
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at the Place D'Armes. Perfect location for the French Quarter Experience. Get up in the morning and one block to Jackson Square and Cafe Du Monde for Beignets for breakfast, then one block the other direction to Bourbon St and all of its madness of a night. I took a balcony room overlooking St Annes St, a little noisy but that didn't worry me (may do if you're a light sleeper, ask for a court yard room), but to be able to sit out on the balcony when I was in my room and watch the passing traffic, Priceless! I loved being able to wander out in random directions and discover the various streets and alleyways of the quarter. All in all, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlb88
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here in Dec 2010 for a Saints game. Some time during the night I was awakened by the sound of kids laughing outside our door. But every time I got up to look through the peephole, the hallway was empty...I asked my hubby the next morning if he'd heard the same thing but he hadn't. I didn't see any kids around the hotel when we were checking out either. But I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could keep this a secret”
Reviews.Author: kareng64
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s not a new and gleaming hotel but thatâ€™s not what I was looking for in my first stay in New Orleans. The hotel has an amazing beautiful courtyard with a small pool. I had a courtyard room with double French doors leading out onto the courtyard. I wasnâ€™t sure about having a courtyard room at first because I thought Iâ€™d be kept awake at night by those hanging out by the pool but it was really quiet. I could hear the Cathedral bells faintly thru the closed doors every morning and would open my doors to take in the sounds of the bells, the birds chirping, and water fountain splashing. Some of the staff members are extremely personable and were a delight in helping us figure out where to eat and how to get to places. One even called on our behalf and booked a swamp tour for us. Ryan, Jessica and Pat are extremely nice and always had a smile. But the major plus to this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION - Jackson Square is a literally a few steps away, with great restaurants galore nearby..my favorite was Muriel's which is right next door to the hotel and CafÃ© Du Monde is very close as well. At time you can hear the caliope from the Steamboat Natchez nearby.Frenchman St is only a $6 cab ride away but walkable. The A/C worked extremely well and I came back to a freezing room because Iâ€™d forget to change the temp. There was a coffee pot and FREE coffee in my room. Free WIFI was included and had no trouble connecting. The rooms are a bit dated but I think that adds character. I would definitely stay here again and canâ€™t wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Location”
Reviews.Author: Yambagal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well located, that fading decor, sloping floors, and breakfast that runs out can all be forgiven! The courtyard was relaxing and pleasant - making up for a tiny room that was far too small to spend time in. Car parking was handled well - although of course you pay for it! You don't need a car at all while here, so avoid bringing one, if possible. Staff were always pleasant and efficient. Moving large bags up/down the steep ramp in the courtyard was difficult. Toileteries were not replaced on our second day. However, I can't get past the fact this has to be the best location - handy for taking home shopping, running back for a jacket etc. We had a 'windowless room' at a very good rate, which turned out to have a small window onto the lift area, and was perfectly safe and comfortable. The building is old and interesting, with a charm of its own. This will be where I recommend friends should stay.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Storm886
Reviews.Content: i ordered a delux room with a window. we where given a room wih a small window in the door? this window was covered with cloth and had light pouring through it all night from the light in the hall. we also caught a large bug ( 2 inches) in the room. around 6am we where awoken by this loud, repetetive noise. after about an hour my son has water coming thru the ceiling and into his bed. then the room is filled with maintenance workers at 7 am....we were moved with an apology. the hotel pool never seemed really clean. pleasent staff. great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Bobbie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained and clean. The best part is that the staff are so friendly and helpful. They truley bend over backwards to make their guests feel welcome. We have stayed in several rooms over the years and always enjoyed seeing the variety of decor and room lay-outs. For Mardi Gras it is a great location, being very close to all the party action yet providing a quiet place to rest. Would highly recommend. Thanks Lyn!

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter atmosphere in a central location, with a wonderful courtyard and a great sense of history”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumCD
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to New Orleans and had previously stayed at the Place d'Armes for special events including Mardi Gras, Easter and French Quarter Fest. When my family and I started to plan a group trip to the French Quarter for this past Easter, the Place d'Armes was our first choice. Two of our party use wheelchairs, and the location and the features of the accessible guest room were ideal for their needs. Further, the staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. Dionne, who is often at the front desk day times, made some great suggestions for accessible tours. Everyone in our party liked their rooms, the atmosphere of the hotel, and the central location. When it came time to check out, we needed to request an oversize vehicle to accommodate the number in our party, wheelchairs, luggage and other needs. The front desk made the needed arrangements for us, the vehicle was on time, and the driver was great. Lynn, a member of the management staff, was very helpful while we were in the planning stages of our trip and made sure everything was ready for us on our arrival. My family and I had a great time, and they are already talking about planning another trip back to the Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “TA people got it wrong”
Reviews.Author: sunnski
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes/Better places Checked into this hotel which is centrally loaced in the French Quarter. It is a great location to explore the area. Front desk service is adequate. We received a room in the back of the hotel on the second floor with a view of the wall of the adjacent buildidng. It wasn't really that bad because it was quite. The room itself was a decent size but needed updating. The bed sagged in the middle. The bathroom sink was badly worn but worked. The toilet/tub-shower room was very small. The shower knozel should have been replaced. Our TV broke but was changed out quickly. How about a flat panal tv vs the tubes. They are so cheap now. Air conditing was great and the room had a fan. On our last day they forgot to clean the room. I realize the rate was 125 per night but this was a two star European hotel not a three/four star American hotel as it is represented in TA. Oh well lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “BREAKFAST, always GOOD, just got even BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: waz26
Reviews.Content: For years, I've enjoyed their 'coffee and' breakfasts of orange juice, coffee and croissants while watching the world go by outside on St. Ann, or overlooking the courtyard crowd a few steps in the other direction. But this year, in addition, I saw a fruit basket (assorted) setting next to the juice pitcher; a choice of coffees; and an array of sweet rolls along my ever favorite croissants!! I , of course, had my usual, but did nibble a bit at some of the new additions! While I'm at it, might I mention the new keys to the rooms? No longer the big old metal keys, or even the plastic ones that go in a slot, then out and hope it worked!; No these 'new card-keys' simply touch my door knob and i can let myself in! And there was still yet another welcome change.. No more need to ask for a 'safe deposit box' down in the lobby!! There was one built right into my closet!! My perfect little Place d'Armes hotel, just GOT BETTER WAZ26

Reviews.Title: “Get my room ready, I'm coming back!”
Reviews.Author: JantyK
Reviews.Content: My sister, my best friend and I stayed at the Place D'Armes the night before our cruise. It was just wonderful. We stayed in the junior suite that over looked the court yard. The room was beautiful, the service great. We wanted to have three beds so no one had to share. And this was just what we wanted. Couldn't have ask for anything better. We walked arount the outside balcony and could see Jackson square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLadybug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything! We had a room of the courtyard, we had paid for a delux room with window but when we got to our room found that the "window" was the one that was in the door overlooking the hallway,after I complained we we're given the one in the courtyard and it was so nice and quiet. The bed was nice as where the pillows, breakfeast is not much, just coffee, juice and danish.Parking is alot but worth it if you have a car to valet.I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Well-placed, convenient, great for families”
Reviews.Author: pamelapancakes
Reviews.Content: We booked a room back in January for a planned Easter break trip for ourselves and two children aged 11 and 7. The first room we were given was on the first floor down a long isolated hallway; it fronted Chartres Street and we therefore couldn't open the curtains lest we wanted tourists gawking at us. The room was quite spacious but carpeting was dingy and stained. It was like living in a cave! We had to spent a night there but requested a move ASAP. Our bags were transferred the next day while we were out to an equally spacious room on the 4th floor in the newest building of the complex, facing The Presbytere. Great, great room. Mattress was a little squashy but hey, it's not home. Front desk staff was consistently pleasant and friendly during our stay; housekeeping was super; the complimentary morning breakfast was enough to get us going. We didn't use the courtyard pool but it was consistent with others we'd seen in NOLA. We've lost count of the number of trips we've taken to NOLA, and have stayed at numerous B&Bs and hotels. While the quality of the rooms at Place d'Armes may be inconsistent, we found the staff to be very accommodating. Once we got a room that we liked, we were very pleased with the place and would definitely stay here again. The convenience of the location can't be beat; Jackson Square near the Cathedral means some occasional street noise at night but it's a far far cry from the wildness of Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “PLACE D'ARMES IS "THE" PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: RajunCajunFloirda
Reviews.Content: Being a native New Orleanean, when I come to town, I want to feel at home. We always do at the Place D'Armes. The ambiance is the true meaning of New Orleans - friendly and accommodating staff, the courtyard that makes you feel like you are in the Garden District and the location is perfect - minutes away from Jackson Square, French Market, Riverwalk, Art District, and food galore! We love staying here so much that we book a year in advance to insure that we have a place to stay when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to New Orleans 2011.”
Reviews.Author: yaz1946
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st post Katrina visit to New Orleans and our 3rd to this Hotel. We found everything pretty much back in order in New Orleans. Still a lot of homes that have not rebuilt, as we took the City-Katrina tour and would recommend this tour to everyone--takes about 2 hours and well worth the money ($about 45/person). Place d' Armes Hotel was great as usual. We reserved our rooms about 1 and 1/2 months prior to our visit and got the downstairs room we requested. It was located in a private courtyard with a fountain in it. The rooms were very clean and well kept. Our housekeeper, Fabiola, did an excellent job of keeping them clean daily. Lets not forget all of the desk staff especially Dionne who helped us (after a mix up) with the city tour. The bell captains of Bobby and Nicholas were very helpful and friendly. Lets not forget management--Mr. Bubby Valentino (owner/manager) was very friendly and helpful also. The hotel is located about 1/2 block from Jackson Square and is well located for all the tourist thingys. My last comment is on a personal note: there are VERY FEW public bathrooms in the area and the closeness of the hotel is very convient!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Subpar”
Reviews.Author: Esphilli1057
Reviews.Content: Lead by Bubby [-], a rude and grossly incompetent manager, the Place D'Armes hotel will not only destroy your property but they will vandalize it when you confront them about it. My car was wrecked by the hotels parking attendants. Â When I approached the attendant most likely responsible as well as Bubby, I not only was rudely patronized but my car fell victim to vandalism. They threw rusty metal on the rear window and dumped a full ashtray in my car. It is now three weeks later and the issues have yet to be addressed by management, despite my relentless efforts. Â Avoid a potential encounter with these inhospitable people and book your stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Beautiful Courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: JacksonGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days in April 2011. I travel regularly to New Orleans and have stayed all over New Orleans, but this was my first stay in the heart of Jackson Square. I really enjoyed this hotel and the location was magnificent. I will definitely return. I checked in on a Friday morning, got settled in my room and was literally on the corner of the Vieux Carre. Steps away from St Louis Cathedral, Cafe du Monde, and the French Market. The hotel is quite old, but very well maintained. The interior courtyard is spectacular, magnificent old live oaks, climbing ivy and ferns, a small but refreshing pool, and just the right amount of wrought iron furniture. The rooms are small, actually quite small, but offset by high ceilings. (remember this hotel is old!). It actually adds to the ambience. I also must give kudos to the staff, everyone one was friendly and personable ( even for New Orleans standards) and went out of their way to help in any way imaginable. The hotel is small, so I got to know the valets and front desk girls. Wonderful people! I give it a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MarcvsFood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to New Orleans. We stayed at the Place D'Armes for 5 nights and had a great time. Here is a breakdown of this Hotel: Pros: -LOCATION! This really is a great central area, next to Jackson Square and Decauter and is 2 blocks from the insanity of Bourbon Street, which I wouldn't recommend staying on if you value sleep. -Service-staff and bellhops are very friendly and accommodating -Price was reasonable, especially when compared to the other places we walked by on Bourbon that looked like a college frat -Overall cleanliness was good -WIFI Cons: -Not really a con, but you have to be mindful that when youre staying in the Quarter, that most of the buildings are very old, and the accommodations will be rustic and older (again, not a con, just an FYI), so do not expect Marriott style accommodations-if you do, you will be disappointed virtually anywhere you stay in the quarter (thats not astronomically priced) -We could hear some noise from the elevator and electric room while sleeping, not a huge deal -The continental breakfast (while most others didnt offer it), while adequate, could have made the stay more enjoyable by offering a little more, perhaps a little cereal or something with protein, it was essentially danish/croissant and coffee/juice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you are going to be doing a lot of sightseeing and will not be in your room much. I guess if you do want to relax in your room all day, you're in the wrong city!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ScurveyDog
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA the week before Mardi Gras for business and stayed at Place dâ€™ Arms the full week. This hotel probably has the best French Quarter location available. CafÃ© du Monde is at the end of the block and Jackson Square is directly across the street. Bourbon Street is 2 short blocks away. My business meeting was at the Convention Center which was about a 1 mile walk each way. I actually enjoyed the morning & afternoon walks so the distance to the convention center worked fine for me. I found the staff at the hotel to be very pleasant and efficient. On the first day of stay, my room had not been cleaned when I returned from work at 4:30pm. I spoke to the front desk and within minutes housekeeping was there. There were no other problems with housekeeping that week. The room and common areas were very clean & neat. I did notice a slight musty smell in the room. It seemed to get worse each day and I developed a bit of a cough that would stop when I left the room. The room was a bit oddly arranged (room 111). It was a ground level room directly in front of the pool. You walk into the bedroom area directly from the outside. There is a hallway & bathroom leading to a nice size sitting room. I think this was called a junior suite. The space was perfect for one person. I do think the hotel could invest in updated furnishings. The style was very â€˜old ladyâ€™. Perhaps that is the period look they are trying to accomplish. I personally donâ€™t care for it. Also, I agree with the other reviewers. An investment in new mattress is long over due. Also, it is time to rework the bathrooms. The fixtures are old and difficult to operate. Anyone staying in room 111 should be very sure the water temp is adjusted properly and consistent before hopping into the shower. This hotel has VERY hot water and no problem at all with water pressure. The shower was almost painful. Additionally, anyone staying in a hotel in the French Quarter should realize where they are. It is NOT going to be peaceful quiet. There were people out in the court yard talking all night, every night of my stay. This did not really bother me because I wanted to be in the thick of the action in NOLA. If you want quiet, you should pick a high rise, major chain hotel. The wireless internet works fairly well. AT&T wireless customers BEWARE!!! There are no bars to be found in this hotel. I had to step outside to make a call or text. In fact, that was the case in most of NOLA. The hotel offers a quick breakfast of coffee, juice and pastries. The pastries were the most tasteless I have ever had so I decided not to waste the calories on stuff that did not even taste good. The coffee was good and the area clean and well stocked. The breakfast room attendant was neither friendly nor unfriendlyâ€¦I really donâ€™t understand those reviewers who comment on the friendliness of the lady stocking the tasteless pastries. I will not likely stay at this hotel again but only because there are so many others I want to try. I would recommend this hotel to others with the understanding of the things I mentioned above. I give this hotel high marks in spite of the imperfections I have identified. To me the noise in the courtyard added character and with so many great coffee shops and cafes, I see no need to rely on the hotel breakfast. Please modernize the rooms and look into the musty smell. I donâ€™t think I could have stayed another day as the cough was getting worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: encal
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in this hotel with family and teenage nephews. The location is ideal for all the French Quarter activities, but quiet enough to get some rest too. The central courtyard and the pool area are lovely and an ideal spot for a quiet glass of wine away from all the frenetic activity around Bourbon Street. The staff were extraordinarily helpful when one of our party left a passport in the room safe and had it couriered to him in time to get him back home on schedule. A word of caution. The 'internal' rooms are literally that. They are on the inside of the property and do not have windows.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: jugglingelvis
Reviews.Content: Loved the balcony room overlooking Chartes with the view of the Cathedral square. The place was quaint and the staff were friendly and helpful. The courtyard was a great refuge for solace and tranquility. We will definitely go back for the ambiance and for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You For Your Help”
Reviews.Author: dwpjmoore
Reviews.Content: Along with 9 other couples that first met in 1960 when the husbands were 2nd Lts. in the USAF, my wife and I were part of a reunion group that made 3-night reservations at the subject hotel. We checked into the hotel at around 1 PM on 3/24/11. At around 2 PM, while walking along the Royal Street sidewalk, my wife tripped, fell and broke her foot. She was taken to Tulane Medical Center and told by the hospital staff that we should return home the next day to prepare for surgery. I spent the night at the hotel and, the following morning, contacted Bobby Valentino, the General Manager, and advised him of our problem. He immediately stated that he would try to resell our hotel room to eliminate the additional two days of room charges. By the time we returned to the hotel to await the cab to the airport, the rooms had been resold and Mr. Valentino advised us of this. He also gave verbal condolences to my wife and stated that we needed to return to New Orleans. Along with the hotel staff, Mr. Valentino extended us every courtesy possible and, when we return to New Orleans, will look to the Place d'Armes as our destination hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CruiseDirector22
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 14 of us staying at the Place d'Armes Hotel and everyone loved the accommodations. The rooms were spacious, clean and decorated with a French Quarter decor. The hotel was located on the corner of Jackson Square so it was easy to get around the French Quarter yet far enough away from Bourbon Street to get some sleep. The staff was wonderful and the nightly rate include a continental breakfast with much needed coffee. The rooms were all different sizes, shapes and uniquely decorated so we did a room crawl with drinks in each room to check them all out. I would highly recommend the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff, Lovely Accommodations and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tamara58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Place d'Armes for a long weekend and I would most certainly stay here again. The location is simply idea. Directly across the street from the St. Louis Cathedral in the heart of the French Quarter. Walk to all the restaurants, shops and Frenchmen Street jazz clubs. The hotel is comprised of a courtyard entrance and several old buildings around a center courtyard. Small reception area is lovely and quaint. Walk through the courtyard, past the in ground swimming pool and several fountains surrounded by lush foliage. My room was on the third floor, accessed by an elevator. Huge front porch, very spacious room which was nicely appointed. Not fancy, but clean and comfortable. It was also incredibly quiet. In fact, this entire section of the French Quarter is very quiet, which I was not expecting. The rooms could use a bit of updating as they are a bit tired, but I would not hesitate to stay here again. In fact, when one finds a hotel with a great hotel with a ideal ocation and more than fair pricing, why stay elsewhere? Really a lovely property and I thank the Place d'Armes for making my first trip to New Orleans a great success!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel,in fabulous location,great staff.”
Reviews.Author: KFMabry
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay in a Valentino hotel in NO and this is our favorite hotel. The staff from minute one was attentative, friendly and very helpful. Our room was the greatest with a great view of the swimming pool and courtyard and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom door was a little small for a person of size but that did not spoil our stay at all. he location is the best in the city for the price and we are making it our hotel of choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay at Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: LaserBevo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Spring Break Trip to New Orleans and had another wonderful stay this year again at Place D'Armes. We plan to go to New Orleans and stay at Place D'Armes again next year on Spring Break. The room was great, the staff was great and the location is perfect. You can't go wrong by staying at this hotel. Our parents went with us this year also and they enjoyed the visit and hotel very much also. Fun in NOLA! See you next March 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: norrisfam827
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to NOLA in a year. Previously we stayed in the CBD, although a nice hotel, was just too far from everything. Place D'Armes was recommended to us by a friend and it didn't disappoint. The location was ideal! On Jackson Square, close to Bourbon street but not in the thick of the madness. A very charming hotel, and the courtyard was beautiful. A plus that there was a pool. Served a light sweet breakfast, but with Cafe DuMonde a block away, who could pass that up??? The rooms were a little small, but we were rarely in the rooms at all. Staff was very helpful and recommended some great local restaurants we wouldn't have been able to find. We love the city and this won't be our last trip to NOLA or Place d'Armes!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Suites only hold two people with comfort”
Reviews.Author: Alpx5
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from 4 1/2 visit to New Orleans and stayed in Place d'armes hotel. I had booked a room there with the understanding that I could get two beds and a sleeper sofa in their suite and thereby accomodate my wife and I and are children ages 19, 16, 12. The friday before we left I got an email that said we would have one kind sized bed. I called and complained and showed them the email conversation I had with a member of their staff which spoke to the 2 beds and they offered to put a sleeper in the room at no charge. When I get there and see the room it is clear the sleeper won't fit. So I feel as though I was lied to about the room and it nearly ruined the vacation. Beyond that there are some good things to say about the hotel. It has a real New Orleans feel and the courtyard that our room opened up on was beautiful and marred only by a swimming pool that was in serious need of a cleaning. The king sized bed was comfortable but the sleeper was not so bottom line is that if you are planning to put more than two people in the "suite" prepare the one who sleeps on the sleeper sofa to be uncomfortable. The staff was responsive and the valet parking was a breeze and well worth the price. Your car goes up a lift to a higher floor so security for your vehicle is never an issue. The continental breakfast is pastries and crosants (spelling?) of the quality you would expect from a grocery store and the coffee was fine and it was convenient to have that option in the morning. The hotel has a real New Orleans feel to it and I can't imagine a better location to stay if most of your plans focus on the French Quarter. Half the places we were told were must visits were a short walk from the hotel. Room was quiet enough but then we went during lent and most of the other guests appeared to be senior citizens so no telling how it is during Mardi Grass. So bottom line is that for a couple if you can get a good rate give it a try. If you are family and you care about comfort for your kids try someplace that has real suites that can accomodate 4-5 or get two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: bcof
Reviews.Content: Went to N'awlins for Mardi Gras. Some guys @ work suggested the hotel, but I had read some reviews that complained of musty smelling rooms & sure enough our room smelled funky (it had poured rain that morning). I asked if there was a room to switch to, but it being busy they did not. A day or 2 later however we saw someone leaving & Lyn @ the front desk was absolutely wonderful in granting our request. I would definitely return there. Free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: erickolb
Reviews.Content: If you're wanting to stay in the French Quarter, but away from the stench of Burbon Street (let's be real -- it's a prolonged dive bar), you can't beat the Place d'Armes hotel. It's about as close as you can get to Jackson Square without passing out on a park bench. It's incredibly convenient to a number of fantastic restaurants (including Cafe du Monde), the shops of the French Quarter, and even a corner grocery. There's an attached parking garage, so you won't have to worry about your sweet ride while you're staying here either. It wasn't perfect, though. The rooms were a little small -- like, where-am-I-going-to-put-this-second-suitcase small. Also, we had a room with no windows. (Let's reflect upon that a moment: a vampire-ready hotel room in New Orleans. Giggle.) It wasn't too much of a hassle for my wife and I, but be advised. If you rely on the sun to help you wake up, you may not have it. On a repeat visit, we'll certainly keep these guys in mind. The only reason we wouldn't come back here is that it's not altogether convenient to the Garden District. It's a bit of a trek over to Canal Street, and if we want to focus on the Garden District next time, we might choose to stay out there. For the French Quarter, though, this place just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return, needs major renovations!”
Reviews.Author: juju571
Reviews.Content: Not sure what hotel the other good reviews on this place are talking about, the one and only good thing about this hotel was the location- if you want to be by Jackson square. Plenty of other nice hotels in the quarter that have a great location. We did opt for the cheaper room with no windows so maybe that was the reason that the room was so horrible??? Needed major renovations, was tiny, bathroom was horrible- didn't want to sit in the bathtub, carpet discusting. I really can't say anything good about the room, it was pretty bad- really old. The courtyard and pool area was ok, pretty but old and pool filled with drunk college kids. The front desk staff never did or said anything to us that was friendly-just checked us in and that was it. I was so disappointed after reading reviews that said great rooms and friendly staff- some even called this place a gem?? Sorry, far from it. You are better off staying somewhere else, we love the Moteleone on Royal- a little more expensive but you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and best value”
Reviews.Author: wampolch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in New Orleans, and the Place D'Armes is the one I will return to. The location is the best, bar none. The price is very reasonable. We had a balcony room and a courtyard room. The courtyard room was roomier, but it was very nice sitting on the generous balcony, with a drink and overlooking the hub-bub on Jackson Square. Of course, the Hotel does not have room service, but if you are of a mind to eat in your room, New Orleans is not the town for you. The number of fantastic restaurants within walking distance of the Hotel is mind-boggling.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BooBoos3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We had made reservations back in September but could not get a courtyard room like we wanted. The owner and the wonderful lady in reservations, Barbara put us on a list for an upgrade. 2 days before our arival and we got our courtyard room. It was very nice and had it's own private balcony. By the way that room is haunted. Keep hearing sounds in the night like walking but we loved it. It's our favorite room now. Location is the best in the Quarter. Close to Bourbon st. and the French Market. Staff is very friendly and the breakfast is perfect to get you going. I reconmend this hotel to all my friends and to you. Have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay in another French Quarter hotel again!!”
Reviews.Author: dylynn
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding was in New Orleans in Feb and we booked the PlaceD'Armes Hotel for family and friends!!! GREAT decision!! The location can't be beat!! Next to Jackson Square! Can't do better than that! It is very old New Orleans-so charming with beautiful courtyards and charming rooms!! Very clean, spacious. They serve a wonderful continental breakfast!! The staff is fantastic and helpful in everyway! It has it's own parking. A wonderful convenience!! All of our guests LOVED it!! When my 2cd daughter marries, I'll book Place D'Armes again!! It was the best decision I ever made! A trully great New Orleans Hotel!!! NO complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay.”
Reviews.Author: sukiro
Reviews.Content: Last week my husband and I stayed at Place D'Armes for 5 nights. This was my second visit and the first for my husband, he now understands why I speak so highly of this hotel. I had room 401, a deluxe double which was a good size, had comfortable beds and although some of the linens were a bit worn they were clean and abundant. Once again I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. I know they have received some poor reviews in the past but that was not my experience. I think if you treat them with respect you will get the same in return. Dionne, at the front desk, once again helped me with some questions I had about places I wanted to visit on my own. She told me how to get to different places as well as told me which areas I should not be going to by myself. I did use the beautiful courtyard more on this trip and can imagine using it much more as the weather keeps improving. We had hot and sunny weather and I did sit in the courtyard several times with a drink. Some guests ate their breakfasts out there as well as sat around the pool or at the tables to eat, drink, read and relax. One thing I would like to see in the future would be small fridges in the rooms. There are drink and snack vending machines and an ice machine on the ground floor but a fridge in your room would be handy. I won't bother listing all the places that are close by this hotel - they have been listed over and over again in other reviews. I will just repeat that this hotel is in a wonderful location. If/when I return to New Orleans this will definitely be my first choice in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: masstravelers48
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Place D'Armes, the location was perfect! The hotel has beautiful courtyards, and we had a private hallway to our room that was formerly the bridal suite. Our room was not cleaned our first day (we did not report to management) but there were no other problems. Very happy, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place”
Reviews.Author: Here2TellU
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place in the heart of the French Quarter, this is the place. If you want a good value with helpful staff and don't mind a bed that might be a tad too soft, this is the place. If you want a fast, reliable internet connection and a short walk to Cafe Du Monde and Burbon Street and don't mind a shower that could use stronger water presure, this is the place. The continental breakfast is just that, but the food is fresh and there is a decent variety. All in all, this a good value and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and courtyards”
Reviews.Author: LadeeRickard
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in the French Quarter. It is also near to the Mississippi River walk with access to the Natchez steamer and other touring options. It is about two blocks from Bourbon Street. The rooms were roomy and well maintained. The highlight of this hotel was the staff. They helped with everything that we asked and were very pleasant and warm. I paid a little more than I wanted to spend, but you just can't beat this location. You are a few steps from Jackson Square, and a block or so from Cafe Du Monde. The central location makes this ideal. We also enjoyed some store bought breads, cheeses, meats and wines in the courtyard. The pastries, juice and coffee are ample to get you started for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jfox625
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and great atmosphere. The staff was so, so nice! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient with very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: nancysalemi
Reviews.Content: We are repeat guests. You can't beat the location. It has charm, it has character and it has Ryan Walsh, the best bellman in the Quarter. The staff is gracious. The rooms are quaint.... the perfect retreat from the wonderful mayhem that is New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Place D' Armes .... Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DMSMaven2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple have been traveling to New Orleans the last 3 years and have stayed at Place D' Armes each time and have been loed it each and every time. I have been travelling to NO for the last 20 years for business and pleasure and have stayed at many different hotels, from the Sheraton, to the St. Pierre various places on and off Bourbon street and would not rate any of the other hotels over the Place D' Armes. My ONLY nitpick about the hotel is that the pool could be cleaner and WARMER, even in the dead of summer it is usually COOL to COLD .... The only amenity that would be nice would be that Bar area near the pool would be open ... All the staff, and housemen/housecleaners are very nice and friendly. The front desk has always been very nice to us. I can't say enough about the location of this hotel .... 1.5 blocks from Bourbon, 1/2 block from Royal Street, 1 block to Cafe' Dumonde', steps to Jackson Sq. .... Plenty of restaurants, shops, antique stores, art stores within a 5 minute or less walk ....

Reviews.Title: “The weather was wet and cold but the hotel was warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: thesinger131
Reviews.Content: When you receive a smile from the employees that doesn't feel forced, that is a good sign. The attention given and also the rooms were very nice. Simple but very nice. The front desk assisted with all requests and with a good attitude..That in itself is getting hard to find.... If you desire clean and also a great location in the french quarter, then this is the place. You can be away from home here and still feel comfortable......

Reviews.Title: “Something must be done about the musty odor in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: estrnmountain
Reviews.Content: I want to be fair in my review of this hotel so I will point out the good and the bad aspects. Let's start with the good: The location is very good as the hotel is in close proximity to a number of different points in the French Quarter like Cafe Dumonde, St. Lois Cathedral, Jackson Square, etc. The courtyard is very nice, and would be a nice place to relax during nice weather. Now, on to the bad. We arrived at the hotel in the evening of our first night of stay and the person checking us in was not very friendly at all. I only received one word answers to my questions and very limited information. I saw this same comment in a previous review, and thought it might have just been an off night, but sure enough, we encountered the same attitude. In reading previous reviews, I found out that the hotel has interior rooms with no windows, so when I booked my reservation, I specifically asked for a room with windows as I did not want to be in a room without any windows at all. When I made the reservation, the agent told me that she was going to put us in a junior sweet, which had a balcony and would either overlook the courtyard or the strstreet. After we checked in and got our keys, the woman behind the desk told us that the young man (I think his name was Paul) would show us to our room. Well, this man did not offer to take our luggage on a cart, all he did was proceed to walk in front of us, so we followed him. He didn't even hold the doors open for us as we pulled our luggage through the maze of hallways. Our room was on the fourth floor, so he showed us where the elevator was and pushed the button and then left us. We get to our room and open the door, and as soon as we opened it, the musty smell was overwhelming. As I walked in, I immediately noticed that there were no windows! I called down to the front desk to complain about the fact that my reservation was not right, and the woman said the only thing she could do was leave a note for the manager in the morning. She could not move me to another room. I gave her all the details of my complaint and tried to settle in for the night as we were exhausted from our travels. No matter how hard I tried, I could not get passed the strong musty odor. It was almost unbearable. Not getting very much sleep that night, I got up early and went downstairs to talk with the manager. Even walking in the halls to get to the front desk, there was a musty odor, but not nearly as bad as in our room. I spoke with the woman working the front desk in the morning and she was very nice. She said she did see the note left from the other agent and that she was going to move us to a different room. I did appreciate the effort to move us, however based upon our bad experience from the night before, and knowing that the rest of the hotel had a musty odor to it, I did not have confidence that our new room would be much better. We made the decision the previous night that we could no longet stay at this hotel because if we did, I would not have been able to sleep at all for the duration of our stay. I did explain all of my concerns to the manager and he was understanding. Even though the room they were putting us in had a 3 night minimum, he was willing to cancel the remainder of our reservation based upon all the circumstances. The rates for this hotel are typically very good, however the weekend rates for the room we were in did increase significantly each day, and there was no way I would stay in a room like that, under those circumstances for the money they were charging. I've seen similar comments in other recent reviews about the smell. Maybe I am more sensitive to the musty odors as others seemed to be able to deal with it, but unfortunately I could not. That's how strong it was. The smell seemed to be imbedded into the carpet and furniture in the room we were in. The management of this hotel should really take the time to inspect each room and do something about the musty odors. The carpets need to be steam cleaned and they should do something about the air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get room #104”
Reviews.Author: MustG0
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was nothing but perfection. I would even stay here again just not in room #104. In retrospect, we should have asked to change rooms. They may have accommodated us. We were on the ground level right next to.....the door, the vending and ice machines, and the breakfast area. You heard all the late nighters coming in and all the early risers getting breakfast. It was a windowless room that had the worst smell to it. Luckily, you did get used to it after a few minutes. Now, the hotel had a very courteous front desk and a gorgeous courtyard with pool. It is right by Jackson square, Cafe Du Monde, Bourbon street and the Mississippi.

Reviews.Title: “very well located and beautiful courtyards”
Reviews.Author: Grams98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Place d'Armes hotel pre-cruise and really enjoyed its French Quarter location. The bed was a king and was very comfortable and the room was nice size, with a safe for our passports, etc. We felt like we were staying in a little bit of Paris, as the atmosphere at the hotel was European, and very French Quarter in a nice way. My only disappointment was that there was only a shower, but a nice one, and no tub. but we were only there 2 nights and that was a small price to pay for the great location and other pluses of the hotel. We had a deluxe room with a window but no balcony. (some rooms don't have windows, so if you are claustrophobic, be careful when booking to choose a room with a window) the room was quality priced, as well and it was the deluxe category. I did book it well in advance, probably 3 months out, The front desk people were so very nice and hepful; they really made you feel welcomed. Cafe du Monde was 2 short blocks away and Broubon st. was about 3 or 4 blocks away. We toured the Garden district by walking to the St. Charles St. Trolley. (About a 15-20 minute leisurely walk) The hotel was also well located for getting to the pier for our western caribbean cruise. We walked the next orning along the river walk and were at our ship in about 30 minutes. One very imortatnt point about the hotel is the beauty of it in a very quaint way. The outdoor areas were lovely and you could bring your breakfast out there or just relax. There was also a lovely pool but being January and 60 degrees, it was just a litte too chilly to use it, but nice to look at it. Breakfast was on the simple side, rolls and bagels with juice and great coffee; but who needs more to get started with so many great restaurants right outside your door? The taxi in from the airport was around $30 and for 2 people, that was the most economical way to go. We really enjoyed our stay and if we were to go to New Orleans again, we would look forward to staying at Place d'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - quiet refuge from the busy city.”
Reviews.Author: PunkinPeaks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights Jan. 24-27. We stayed in a junior suite - on the second floor with a great walk-out balcony that overlooked the courtyard. Everything was fine with the only thing that needed tweaking was maybe a softer mattress. It was fine for me, but tough on the hubs back. The suite had a full sized comfy sofa, desk, chairs, fridge microwave, bar sink and counter. Lots of room for us to move around and not be on top of each other, which works well if one is awake and the other is still sleeping. Staff was friendly and helpful, offering tips for places to go, making dinner and tour reservations and securing cabs. Free Wifi worked everytime we tried to connect. The continental breakfast was not much, pastries, apples, oranges, coffee, orange juice, but we wanted to get out and get a "real breakfast" anyway. We had a busy stay in NOLA, and look forward to other trip there before too long. I will definately try to stay at Place d'Armes again.

Reviews.Title: “got a pool which is essential in the summer”
Reviews.Author: feedthougoat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us on arrival. Great location in the French Quarter. Nice hotel with a little pool. I would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location, nice patio and garden, basic room”
Reviews.Author: 81hoosier
Reviews.Content: The location could not be any better - a few doors from Jackson Square, a block from the French Market, no more than a ten-minute walk from anywhere in the French Quarter. Yet far enough away from Bourbon Street that the drunken idiot factor is nonexistent. Our room opened onto the courtyard which was a great place to enjoy our morning coffee. We didn't try the "house" breakfast - I'm not sure what would cause someone to eat a free "continental" breakfast in a town with virtually wall-to-wall cafes and coffee houses. The room itself was nothing to get excited about, or to complain about. A little on the small side, with no fridge or microwave (you always have leftovers in New Orleans - they were one mini-frige away from getting 5 stars from me) . But clean, well-appointed with comfortable beds and a good tv. We didnt have a car - again why in the world would you try to drive in this compact and "walkable" city' - but I did overhear someone getting charged a rather high price for parking. Finally, I have no idea what could have happened to the lady who had the unpleasant experience with the staff - we found everyone to be typical New Orleanians - friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: johndt41
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the last 4 years and had no incidents. I like the location and have found the staff pleasant. However this year the woman who checked me out was so abusive towards me I will not return. We did not exchange more than 10 words the entire time I was there. I have no idea why she treated me this way but taking my 2600.00 while treating me with such abuse is degrading. I can only assume this woman thinks she can judge people then treat them as she pleases. I will not let this woman abuse me again. What she did was painfully traumatic.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel - good location and ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in January 2011 and were delighted when we pulled up outside - a very authentic and traditional looking hotel. Our room wasn't ready (we arrived about an hour before the hotel's check in time) so we were asked to come back in an hour and stored our bags in the meantime. The hotel's grounds are very pretty - tables and chairs around fountains and little courtyards. Our room was on the ground floor and was large and quite quirky - a bit like staying an elderly Aunt's house. Nice enough room in character with the rest of the hotel. Tiny bathroom and slightly dated fittings but this lends 'authenticity' to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: 60827Worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over MLK with 3 friends. Rooms were spacious and clean. Perfect location, right off Bourbon but nice and quiet inside the courtyard and 1/2 block from Jackson Sq. Close to restaurants, bars, music and shopping. Staff was more or less friendly, but weren't that helpful when it came to directions or recommendations of restaurants. Check out the Southern City tours while you are in town, great tour of the city and Katrina rebuilding sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a return trip”
Reviews.Author: aball1844
Reviews.Content: The Place d'Armes is a very nice hotel for everyone from honeymooners to a couple celebrating 5o years. The whole staff that I came in contact with in my four days there were all very friendly and helpful. The location is great, the room is cozy, and the grounds are very peaceful in the garden area. Now I must say a few of the bad things. The mattress was very hard and uncomfortable. Our room was balcony was on St. Anne and there was a lot of street noise at night. I could here people talking as they walked by and the garbage pick up first thing in the morning. Not a great idea for someone who is going to have some late nights on Bourbon Street. The only other thing is that they could get a little more variety in the breakfast. All in all I had a good time and the good things this place has to offer out weighs the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and in the center of it all.”
Reviews.Author: dmacica
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes is a terrific value in the heart of the French Quarter. Jackson Square was half a block away, Bourbon St. two blocks. Pretty much anything else you might want to visit is close as well: the riverfront, the Frenchman St. music clubs, Preservation Hall, the CBD, Royal St. galleries, upscale dining, cheap eats (red beans & rice!). My room was quiet, clean, comfortable, and even a touch elegant in a French farmhouse sort of way (exposed brick, wrought iron headboard). I don't think the TV worked, but I was, you know, in New Orleans, and I wasn't there to watch TV, so I never asked the staff to address it. An OK continental breakfast is included, but the one and only Cafe Du Monde was a block away and you simply have not lived until you have enjoyed hot beignets and cafe au lait there. WiFi was sketchy, but the front desk supplied an ethernet cable with a deposit that they refunded at checkout. The staff was friendly and the hotel had a lovely and peaceful courtyard. I'll surely return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place and wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: einat59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place d'Armes for 6 nights while enjoying New Orleans and vicinity. This is not a luxury hotel, more like a boutique hotel with a special atmosphere. Location is great, center of the French Quarter, 2 blocks from Bourbon St and one block from Jackson Square, but the street is not on the major routes so it is quiet. The place is beautiful with a wonderful courtyard, a place to sit and relax with a cup of coffee (or any other drink). The rooms are nice, with an old fashion aura, clean and comfortable. Most of all, the staff are really nice and helpful and whatever requests and needs we had they were always more than happy to do their best to assist us. We greatly recommend the Place dâ€™Arms and we will certainly want to visit there again next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected...and More!”
Reviews.Author: steamco
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my 72 yr old mother to NOLA for her Christmas gift and wanted to stay in the quarter - close to everything. Following the ratings and reviews here, we were not disappointed. We booked the reservation in August for the week before Christmas and requested a lower level courtyard room. I understand from the reviews that there are a variety of rooms and we were apprehensive about what to expect - ours was room #126 located off of the secondary courtyard. We were pleasantly surprised to find the room to be spacious and quite lovely with 2 double beds. Keep in mind the building is old, so thin walls in this particular room made it somewhat noisy @ night as this is near a stairwell. We must have had an recently refurbished room and the lock was a card-entry system. Our big suggestion would be to invest in some upgraded mattresses - ours were mediocre, thin and older. Location, with everything within walking distance, and charm are the hotel's best features as well as the historical setting. Continental breakfast was available with newspapers, but we chose Cafe Du Monde an beingets! We would definitely return and enjoy this hotel again. Not the most luxurious and high-end amenities - but that's not what we came to New Orleans for. We truly enjoyed our immersion in the local culture and this hotel painted the perfect backdrop!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our first visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: DixieMoxie
Reviews.Content: I found the Place d'Armes by searching and reading reviews online and was able to get a good rate just before Christmas. My children and I stayed in their very spacious junior suite overlooking the courtyard. What a wonderful experience! The room had a separate kitchen and sitting area, a (non-working) fireplace and a crystal chandelier. So much atmosphere! The staff here really made this place fantastic. They were so friendly and helpful and made our trip a success. The location couldn't have been better for us. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great courtyard , location and staff, but lousy bed”
Reviews.Author: trinitymills
Reviews.Content: We often take weekend trips to New Orleans and usually stay at the Bourbon Orleans. However, we wanted to try new place this time. The location was great, the staff helpful. There is on-site parking so there is not as long a wait as at some hotels. The courtyard is absolutely charming -- even on this sprinkly, chilly December weekend. The room, (219) though supposedly a deluxe room, is a little on the small side because it is built at an angle with the bathroom jutting into the main space, but it was adequate and offered what was needed. Unlike the interior rooms, it at least does have a window overlooking the courtyard and is just a few steps away from a balcony with table and chairs. Now for the downside. The room decor is a little tired looking. They definitely need to update that 1980s wallpaper border and bedding. Most of all they need to replace the mattress set. Today most hotels, even of the budget variety, offer sleep perfect mattresses. This is a cheap motel grade bed, low to the ground, with squeaky springs. I felt very coil in that mattress. The walls were also a little on the thin side although there was absolutely no "Quarter noise" or bright lights to keep you up, just the bad mattress quality. Overall all, it was a good experience, but I really, really urge them to replace those beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nursenancy_57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here twice, once just the two of us, and once with our 11 year old granddaughter. She loved it so much, she wants to move to New Orleans. The hotel is in a great area. Close to all the things you love about the city. I wasn't even afraid to walk to and from the hotel alone. Doesn't have a lot of amenities, but the atmosphere is great. Cozy and quaint. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get a better Location”
Reviews.Author: Ronwilltravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel at least seven times, and will be back again next year. It has a super location, behind Jackson Square--in the heart of the French Quarters. The Rooms are very nice and the court yard is the Best. All the staff from the Front Desk to House keeping are very friendly and helpful. The Lady at the front desk has been with this hotel group for 20 years. Have no fear, stay here and you can't go wrong. You won't find a better Hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A charming spot just off Jackson Square”
Reviews.Author: Pharmgirltn
Reviews.Content: We love returning to this hotel! The courtyards are amazingly relaxing and the location is so close to a lot of the things we love about this city. This is not a posh, luxury, amenity laden accomodation- so don't book it if that is what you want. This is a cozy, friendly, charming spot that is close to shopping, dining, and great music joints. The staff is always helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Once Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LSUgreat
Reviews.Content: Once again, we had another awesome stay! We got our usual room (#122) and it was once again, lovely! ( Mr. Bubby Valentino saves that room for us every year, during the first week of December!) The staff was simply out of this world again....and always there to help, answer any question, or there to just say a simple "Good Morning!" The free breakfast was once again, a great way to fill up one's belly....and start the day off right! The rooms were even being updated from the old lock & key system to the new card entry system...so, the hotel in trying to stay new & improving....without taking away the old charm! And as everyone says....the hotel is close to everything!!!!! Jackson Square and St Louis Cathedral is across the street....Bourbon Street is 2 blocks North, Cafe Du Monde is one block South, Pat O'Brien's is 2 blocks Northwest.....and all the food & shopping of the French Quarter establishments all around you!!!! Now, once again, with any review I make, I can always provide a little something to improve on....I would still like to see the coffee (in the rooms) improved....because my wife & I do enjoy a nice hot cup of coffee sometimes before we geaux to bed....and this time I did notice a little wear & tear in the mattress we had this time....I do hope it gets changed out before our 2011 stay!...other than that, everything is still 100% great!!!!!!
