So, if a person is looking to stay in a hotel, were the building has been up since the 1700's....one is looking for the old world charm and a historical place to stay in, The Place d'Armes is the place for you! (just imagin if those walls could talk!!!!!) I just sit back, in my room & court yard, and just imagin all the history of the place (which I provided on my first review back in 2009). So, if stepping back in time, and enjoying a little bit of old New Orleans history is not your cup of tea, please do not stay at this hotel...because it is not for you! But, if you enjoy staying in something that was once a slave trading building, to the first all-boys school of Louisiana, then made into a warehouse, and then the Place d' Armes (as I said TONS of history) is the place for you! Just imagin you are being given the chance to stay in a place that you have just paid to tour! The best thing I can say is...SEE YOU NEXT YEAR!!!!!!!...and remember, change the mattress in room #122...LOL :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Weefy0816
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 15 month old, spent five nights at the Place d'Arms in early November. We could not have been happier with our accomodations or the convenient location. The hotel is a block from the river and Cafe Dumonde as well as within easy walking distance of Bourbon St and many great restaurants. Our room, which was a king suite on the courtyard side, was very spacious and quiet. The hotel even provided us with a crib for our little one. The entire staff from the cleaning people to the front desk was very friendly. I could not recommend this hotel more

Reviews.Title: “Less expensive, quiet spot in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Suhawk
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night following a cruise. Quaint historic hotel that is clean and in a perfect location to enjoy the French Quarter yet be able to sleep when you want to. Much less expensive than the chain hotels. Quiet relaxing interior courtyard. Room was large, bathroom was tiny and not soundproof. Queen size bed was comfortable. Internet was always up and good speed. Only problem was hauling luggage up and down to second floor via narrow stairway, but the poor bellman obliged. We arrived early and they happily stored our luggage until check-in time, even called us when our room was ready. Partner was suffering from a spider bite incurred on the cruise, and they happily allowed us to stay two hours beyond check-out since he was unable to walk around the quarter as we had intended. A+ customer service on every count.

Reviews.Title: “Charming historic stay in heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DoubleTrouble_in_May
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I started planning our trip to New Orleans we found a good deal for the Place d'Armes. The great location in the heart of the French Quarter helped to make our first visit much more fun. Overall our experience with the staff was positive and our room was clean. The hotel is charming with its outdoor courtyard and lovely street view, but it is an historic building and comes with some minor imperfections. But that also provides for some of the charm. We reserved the interior room, but if you want natural light to wake you up in the morning I suggest checking out the courtyard or deluxe rooms. Unfortunately the car elevator in the parking garage broke the morning we were leaving. This prevented us from taking off to explore other areas of the city before heading home. It was disappointing that we were not offered a discount on our valet parking because of the inconvenience. All in all I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “musty and poor service”
Reviews.Author: kokokelowna
Reviews.Content: Initially I thought this hotel had so much charm, with the inner courtyard and the balconies. Lovely. However, for the first two mornings machinery in the garden woke us early and continued all day. fine. Old hotels must be kept up, but I think that the management could have made some accommodation for paying customers. The kicker, though, was today when a water advisory for the entire city was released: I asked the receptionist for bottled water and she pointed me to the machine. The water purification plant "broke down," I said and I asked if they wouldn't provide bottled water under the circumstances--the tap water will make you ill as I found out this a.m.--but no, no water provided. I find the service here sorely lacking and I regret that, as the hotel has potential despite the musty musty smell of our room. I think we will look for another hotel next time we visit. It is reasonable and has character, but there are other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: SarahET
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we go to our beloved Nola. This hotel is not the best or ritziest in the city, and it's an older hotel, so if you are looking for something bright and shiny go elsewhere. You CANNOT beat the location (off of Jackson Square, a 5 minute walk to Cafe Du Monde and right by our favorite bar in the world Pirate Alley Bar), it's clean, the decent continental breakfast comes with the room, the staff is nice and the hotel parking is cheaper than a lot of the other hotels. If you don't mind the hassle of stopping by to pay every day and your car not being watching there is cheaper 24 hour parking right behind Cafe Du Monde. It's far enough away from Bourbon to escape from the noise and drunkards but close enough in case you want to join them. All in all it's a great hotel for what you pay in a city where all you will probably do in your room is sleep and drop off things you didn't need to buy, hence the great location for when your arms get tired.

Reviews.Title: “NOLA Charm”
Reviews.Author: ShantyIrishGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! We were a little nervous with some of the mixed reviews, but the location sold us originally. Things only got better! Almost all of the staff were friendly and very helpful (minus our night check-in lady who was a bit nondescript) and they even watched our bags on our last day so we could get in every last bit of New Orleans before we were picked up by the shuttle. We particularly liked the private courtyard (even better with beignets and cafe au lait from Cafe du Monde) and we relaxed in it each day. You can see some signs of disrepair as you can see all over the French Quarter, but it was hardly noticeable and the prime location (we walked throughout the entire French Quarter) couldn't be beat. We'll return as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “True New Orleans Tradition.”
Reviews.Author: patriciann1
Reviews.Content: Have to admit that we were skeptical with mixed reviews we have read. We were pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed our stay. Room 423 had access to a balcony only feet away with a great view looking down on Jackson Square, and perched directly over the Muriels balcony directly below us. Had an experience with a faint knock on our door each night around 10:00 pm. Wife called out " Who's there " and there was no response. We opened the door and no one was in the hallway, or on the balcony. Third night I ran over and pulled the door open, again no one there. Only other room in our hallway was vacant. We ran across one of the Ghost Tours coming back from dinner one evening in front of the entrance and heard them mention that the place is frequented by several young boys who perished in a fire when this was a boys school back in the 1800's. Continental breakfast is lacking but O.J. and 2 news papers got us started. Cafe DuMonde is a block away, and Stanleys on the corner are both a great breakfast stop. Courtyards are the best in the Quarter, and we brought back Coffee AuLait and Beignets from DuMonde to enjoy in this scenic setting. A great deal for the cost. We booked months in advance and got a great rate of $ 116.00 a night for a Balcony King. If you wait until the last minute it will be considerably more especially with a convention in town as there was this past week. We will stay here again on next visit to New Orleans, and highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: caius_xavier
Reviews.Content: Even in October, the courtyard was still lush with foliage, including regal magnolias. Place dâ€™Armes offers 84 guest rooms in eight historic townhouses which surround the courtyard and swimming pool. Youâ€™ll find that â€œhotspots,â€� such as Pirate Alley, Jackson Square, and CafÃ© du Monde are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable!”
Reviews.Author: KMA1234567
Reviews.Content: We were placed in a room directly behind ice machine and vendin g machines, We didn't sleep all night. requested a 2nd room and this was as horrible! Rooms dark,few lamps, no hair conditioner and bug bites on my ankles on morning. Beds hard, pillows flat, breakfast choice was 2 stale pastries to choose from. very expensesive. $200.00/night! Would never recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this unique hotel - great staff, location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: leahkap
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel! Its location right next to Muriel's on Jackson Square really can't be beat - it's convenient to everything you want to get to - bars, restaurants, the French Market, the river, cafe du monde (esp for those 3am runs), the aquarium. It's a bit of a walk to Canal Street for the streetcar, but nothing too bad. We had a street room and the noise was a problem for me, but not my husband - we will be bringing earplugs next time! It's not the noise at night that's so bad, but they start with the street cleaners, garbage trucks, and jackhammers pretty early in NOLA - sometimes at 5:00am! My husband slept right through it all but it woke me up. We loved the street room for the private balcony over the street though - the people-watching and views can't be beat! If you are a light sleeper, I'd definitey recommend a courtyard room though.Our room had been upgraded with a flat-screen TV and even had some HD channels in the cable lineup. It also looked like some of the linens (curtains, etc.) had recently been replaced. The staff at this hotel was great- everyone was very polite and extremely helpful. We got to NOLA early and had to wait for our room, but were still able to check in before official check-in time at 4:00. We gave them our cell phone number and went out to lunch - they called us when the room was ready. They were happy to watch our bags for us. The bottom line is - this is a boutique hotel. If you require a hotel with lightning-fast internet, a business center, 24-hour housekeeping and room service, a couple of restaurants and bars, etc., etc., etc, stay in a large chain hotel. If you want a charming, unique hotel right where the action is, stay at Place d'Armes. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, 2 days in an interior room and 5 days in a room with a balcony. Nice hotel with great service located right off Jackson Square. If you like being in the middle of all New Orleans has to offfer, stay in the balcony room. Like things a little more quiet? Stay inside off the beautiful coutyard with a pool. This was our second stay here, we really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dirtguy55
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. This was our second time staying at the Place D Armes, and we loved it again. The location is very convienent for walking around the Quarter, only being about 1.5 blocks from Bourbon St. and 1.5 blocks from Cafe Du Monde. The staff was friendly and helpful in fielding questions that I asked. The breakfast wasn't spectacular but adequate with mostly breads, pastries, cereals and fruits. Our room (204, I believe) was an inside room with no windows, (not any musty smell) medium sized and very quiet overall. We didn't use the pool which is small. The courtyard is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Damien. South carolina”
Reviews.Author: bellytoy
Reviews.Content: I was very impress with a gentlem that work the front desk. He was excellent he seem to know his history and gave each guests a tour of the hotel. We were all excited. Just a great guy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, first NOLA experience!”
Reviews.Author: leinie61
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a streetside, balcony room. Awesome! It's not a busy enough street to bother you. The staff was very helpful. It's not a luxury hotel, but htey make up for it with a beautiful courtyard and great location. Next to Muriels Jackson Square restaurant and near Cafe Du Monde.

Reviews.Title: “Great first New Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: mokota
Reviews.Content: It was our first time traveling to New Orleans and we wanted to find accommodations that were affordable, clean and centrally located but not to close to the noise since we were traveling with a 2 yr old. This little precious gem of a hotel fit the bill. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was big and clean. It was facing the street side yet we slept soundly every night. The hotel has great courtyards and a cute little pool which was great for our two year old. We had considered renting a car but its so close to everything. We were able to walk to Bourbon or hop on a trolley or bus and head to the garden district any time. This hotel is charming and embodies old New Orleans charm. Thanks for a great experience. We hope to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RMarshall2
Reviews.Content: We studied Hotels in the French Quarter and finally decided on Place d'Armes. It was everything we wanted and more. The location could not have been better. The location was perfect because it was close to everything. We did not rent a car - and the hotel was within walking distance of either our destination or of the public transist system or a cab was available within a couple of minutes. The staff was friendly and eager to meet our needs. When we asked for hot tea or more coffee they were at our door in under 5 minutes. The desk clerk during the day was an amazing multi-tasker who could check out 2 guests while answering your questions at the same time. The court-yard is a beautiful place to relax and unwind before heading out to the Quarter for another fun fill day. The room, bed ... were comfortable. They did not have flat screen HD TV's but who goes to New Orleans to watch TV? I highly recommend this place and plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm and great location, but................”
Reviews.Author: c0c0d
Reviews.Content: Wanted to introduce some New Orleans charm and culture to my children 10 and 13, so I booked this hotel based on the reviews on TA. I think we got the "party room", the place looked very tired and well used! Wallpaper peeling off wall, lamps that were old and rusted, holes in the wall that the cable TV cord came out of and TV only got fuzzy pictures. Our bellman Nate was very friendly and helpful and the lady at the front desk was cool as best. The room was in the father building from the front of the hotel on the second floor and had a balcony. My biggest problem was that the only lock on the door was the one on the knob. No deadbolt or chain lock. It may have been secured, but I did not feel safe! Needless to say we did not stay and left to find another hotel. On the positive they did refund my deposit on the room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: jen91
Reviews.Content: Loved th hotel-our room was big, with a balcony that looked out on St. Ann; we heard church bells as well as garbarge trucks. Best bed I've slept in for years. The hotel personnel were great, with directions, bandaids when I fell in a pothole, and friendly greetings. The breakfast was just continental. The hote. is half a block from Jackson Square and near Royal, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: woodstock5
Reviews.Content: On arriving I was a bit disappointed. The place looked like it could do with a lick of paint. The room was a decent size with 2 double beds and a bathroom. The room was cleaned every day. There is a beautiful courtyard with swimming pool. A free breakfast of croissants, pastries, fruit, orange juice and coffee was served in a small breakfast room. the hotel is ideally situated right next to Jackson Square. It is dead centre of the French Quarter with Bourbon Street 2 minutes away. The Mississippi is 5 minutes walk (just the other side of the square) Buses and streetcars are within easy reach and very cheap. If I went back I would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Who thought you could have peace & quiet in the middle of the French Quarter?”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHillbillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place d'Armes for four nights Sept 29th-Oct 3rd. I booked this hotel based on our tastes and reviews on this site. We were not dissappointed! There are a number of buildings that make up the hotel that range in construction from 18th - 19th century. If you are expecting a super clean, spartan, modern hotel, this is not the place for you. If you want a period experience to compliment your trip, then this is right up your alley. Due to noise concerns, I requested a courtyard room instead of a balcony room. Our most difficult time at the hotel had to do with finding our room. The front desk did walk us into the courtyard and pointed out where to go around and to the left. It still took us a while since we didn't realize that there was another courtyard off the big courtyard that was accessed through a walkway through the first building. This made for great privacy as there was rarely anyone else sitting in that courtyard. The fountains were soothing and you could hear the cathedral bells when in the courtyard, but not from the room. The only other noise factor for our stay was a group of people who had attended a wedding took over the "bar area" in the courtyard and partied on Saturday night. However, it wasn't that loud in the room and they were finished by midnight. My husband is a very light sleeper and he never had a problem the entire trip. We stayed in room 227 which was obviously one of the two oldest buildings on the property. There were only 4 rooms in that building on our side, maybe in the whole building? There are so many interesting nooks and crannies to the hotel that I couldn't say for sure. One wall was the original brick and the rest was outdated wallpaper but who cares about that! The room was very large with two comfortable double beds and it had a long wet bar. The TV was the older analog version and didn't have hookups for our portable DVD player. We also had the cable problem mentioned earlier, but I jiggled the cable at the wall outlet and it corrected itself. We also had to plug the power cord into the back of the TV as it had somehow become unplugged. There was a very large closet with sliding doors and a vanity with chair in the nice sized dressing room. The bathroom was also surprisingly roomy as I expected cramped conditions in such an old place. There was a location in the bathroom where the wallpaper had come apart and I could see some mold, but that is not surprising in the south. I have a mold allergy and was not bothered the entire time. The room did not have any odors as can be expected in such an old place. While we were there, they were putting new carpet in the room next to ours, so they are updating these rooms at this time. The Wi-Fi was intermittent. I think I figured out that, even though they have five hookups for you to choose from, they are limited in the number of users. I had an extremely difficult time getting full connectivity in the mornings and around dinner time only, so I think it was just overloaded with users. The breakfast was very disappointing. There were some Entemann type pastries and some very dry croissants. There was also some fruit that did not look very appealing. It would be nice if they at least offered cereals, muffins, toast with peanut butter or the like. But begneits a few steps away at Cafe du Monde and a full breakfast with "debris" at Mothers in the CBD took care of that need. I did like the security and felt very safe. The passageway from the street has a locked gate so everyone must go through the small lobby with a security guard to gain entrance. The lobby staff never failed to greet us coming or going. The maid did an excellent job. The groundsman, when appearing in our little courtyard to sweep and clean up, would immediately start saying "excuse me please" as though he felt guilty invading our territory. He was very nice and smiled constantly. Now that I have found Place d'Armes, I doubt that I will ever stay anywhere else in New Orleans. The ambience of the hotel added to the historic experience that we enjoy. The location cannot be beat and the serenity of our courtyard was amazing in a town known for crazy partying.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and in a good location...but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: MoverandaShaker
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt the location is good, close enough to all of the French Quarter to have a good time without paying taxi fare and far enough away from Bourbon Street to not have a racket going on. The price is nice too. Now for the negatives: The front desk staff was completely apathetic to anything/everything from the moment we walked in the door. After trying for an hour to connect to the Wi-Fi I went downstairs and politely asked if there was anything special I should know about connecting as I was having trouble with it. The attendant (who was slouched over texting) looked up from her phone and just said "no". I eventually was able to connect to the (weak) wi-fi but found that it dropped frequently throughout the night. We decided it was nice enough though and decided to stay another night and went down to ask if there were any other balcony rooms available for the next night - she told us no but that we could have an interior room with no windows for around the same price. We decided against it and when we went back upstairs and looked around the website we found that they did have balcony rooms available to reserve on the website - I'm not sure why she only offered a windowless interior. So we went downstairs and said we'd like to have one of the balcony rooms available on the website. She took care of everything (while mumbling on the phone with someone) and told us to just come by the next day and pick up our keys to the new room shortly after checking out of the old room. When we went to pick up the keys the new woman at the front handed us the keys from a room in the 100's which we found a bit strange as all the balcony rooms are 200-300 - but we went and checked it out anyway. Sure enough, we're in a courtyard room - not what we wanted, not what we asked for, and definitely not what we were told we were buying. So we went back to the front desk and told her and she magically pulls out two keys from a balcony room and says "we thought that one might be more convenient for you". Again, not sure what gave them that impression. She points through the door and tells us "it's out there". After wandering for a while (there aren't a whole lot of signs with what room numbers are down what corridor) we finally ran into a worker in the courtyard and had to ask him how to get to our room. Now is when we started noticing a lot of differences for two rooms that are the same rate/category. Our first room had a large private balcony with a table set and chairs that overhung the street - the new room had a two foot wooden "balcony" that's really just a thin porch connecting the rooms in this building and overlooking the courtyard. Our new room has an air conditioning unit and a ceiling fan - the old room only had a ceiling fan and was incredibly hot throughout the night. The old room had very high ceilings and two large windows - the new room is what you'd expect from any Super 8. The old room had a large working tv - the new room has a small boxy 90's model that won't even turn on. The new room has hot water - the old room never got cold and never got hot no matter how much you messed with it, it was permanently luke-warm. Lastly, both rooms are full of cracks and tears, doors that you have to lift up to shut or tug around, holes in the carpet, and scratched up headboards. Our new room even had a giant sheet of wallpaper peeling off, Could definitely use a little bit of work. All in all, it's cheap and in a good location...but it's far from perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - this is a must in New Orleans !!!”
Reviews.Author: icemonster
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for three nights in September and it was just the best, the room we stayed in was Room 110 and it was amazing - it has all the old fashioned brick work in the room with the old wood timbers and as you walked out of the room you was in the court yard which is also where the swimming pool is. The hotel staff were just so friendly and very honest about the best places to eat. The good thing about this hotel is that although its in the heart of New Orleans you don't hear any of the noise coming from Bourban Street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: PVDGA
Reviews.Content: If you want a charming hotel with loads of atmosphere in the heart of the French Quarter, this is your spot! It is literally steps from Jackson Square and a short walk to the many fabulous restaurants! The staff is very pleasant and helpful, there is a great continental breakfast in the morning and the courtyard just says old New Orleans! Our room, number 214, had a balcony overlooking the courtyard and pool. You know you are in the French Quarter when you open the French doors and hear the cathedral bells ring! We flew in, took a cab to the hotel and never needed a car during the four days we were there. And...the price was right, too! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for the price”
Reviews.Author: jeffAustinTx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this Hotel. For the price ( $59 for each of the first two and a bit more for the third ), I was expecting a dirty dump of a place.....NOT AT ALL. The entire experience was amazing. The staff was pleasant, helpful and professional. The courtyards with the small pool was clean and well kept. The room was clean and the A/C worked like a champ. The location of the place was perfect....close to everything in the French Quarter, yet quiet from the street noise. We stayed in room 220 which was a windowless interior room with no balcony ( there was balcony access just a few steps down the hall and the other two rooms in our part of the building had their own balconies, so in reality, we did have a private balcony to use). Next time I think I will pay a bit more and get a courtyard room but we were satisfied with room 220......NOW for the "negatives"........( actually just a few things you need to realize before you book).....This is a converted set of connected buildings that are VERY old, so even though they have been remodeled, the sound barriers you find in new construction are just not there. You get a lot of noise from the other guests as they leave their rooms, hang out in the courtyard talking and laughing ect. We found it a bit hard to sleep late in the mornings due to the noise. The other thing we noticed was the condition of the furnishings. Most of the items in the room were well-worn and could use replacing. The mattress was comfortable but the head board was pretty beat up. The TV was an old model with reception you would expect to find without cable, although it WAS cable TV. We didnt spend much time in the room anyway but the lack of clear reception and the lack of a flat screen were noticable. All in all, we LOVED this place, the ambiance was amazing, the location was perfect, the room was serviceable and clean, the continental breakfast was spartan but fresh ( enough to hold you over till lunch). We will book our rooms here again the next time we visit New Orleans. Thanks for the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....loved the room!!! LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katlynn59
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 222 and it was very nice and spacious!! The courtyard is just wonderful....certainly gives a tropical feel. As for location.....CAN NOT be beat........steps away from Jackson Square, Cafe Du Monde, River front, Bourbon St, etc......WOW!!! Staff was pleasant and courteous...we were greeted with smiles and was given good recommendations concerning restaurants and sights to see....A VERY PLEASANT STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and near everything!”
Reviews.Author: WIN84
Reviews.Content: Ok..check in went went iffy..the woman at the front desk told us we would have to wait 1/2 hour..it was 3:45. The lobby was full of people waiting to check in..not ok. Good: The room was lovely. The courtyard was wonderful and romantic. The coffee in the morning is what the doctor ordered. The AC in the room rocked! The location was perfect! The housekeeping very very attentive. The only things I would change are 1) what is with the jerks (guests) that drink bucket loads of beer by the pool all night making other guests uncomfortable and leaving a mess to boot? 2) Afternoon coffee..after walking all over the FQ..you need a pick me up for dinner. We are going back again here..hopefully these bad points are looked into by management.

Reviews.Title: “Thin-walled beauty”
Reviews.Author: VisitingRN
Reviews.Content: The hotel and courtyard are beautiful, staff was courteous, friendly, and accommodating. The location is great, steps from Jackson Square in the French Quarter. I have two complaints however, one of which will prevent me from staying here again. The hotel does have an elevator but I prefer the stairs. The stairwell had a very unpleasant odor and the carpet had multiple stains. It just gave me an uneasy feeling that nobody cleans that area. My other complaint is that the walls are very thin. I know it's not uncommon to hear other visitors in a hotel, but I could hear people in the hallway clear as day while I was in bed. A conversation even woke me up one night and then I heard the guy next door (with whom I shared a wall) snoring! Sadly, that's a deal-breaker for me, or else I would be inclined to stay here on my next visit. If you do choose to book here, a word of advice: if at all possible, book an exterior room. I had an interior (no windows). You have no idea of the time of day! Plus the rooms are very dark, even with all lights on. On vacation I often wake naturally as the sun rises but here I slept until almost 10am not even realizing it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here! Great Price and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LKTTX
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel is amazing. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They had a great courtyard with a pool. Breakfast left a bit to be desired but the coffee was good. Very quaint. It was in the French Quarter and within walking distance of great shopping and restaurants. Also, within walking distance of Bourbon Street. I plan to stay here every time we return to New Orleans. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: bigb77
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in New Orleans and stayed at the Place D'Armes based on the reviews on this site. The hotel did not disappoint. We stayed in a balcony room and the room itself was very spacious. The balcony was exactly what one would expect in New Orleans. The bathroom was a bit cramped but not more so than in any hotel. One thing that was missing was a fridge although there is a free ice machine close to the lobby. The courtyard is spectacular and the staff very knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel is old but very well maintained and clean. Breakfast consists of a variety of pastries and fruit with coffee/fruit juice. The choice is not wide but it is fresh and fill you up until lunch. The reviews do not exaggerate about the location, it cannot be beat. It is steps away from Jackson Square and the Cathederal and a short walk to Cafe du Monde and the Dumaine street car stop. It is the perfect location to wander off and explore the streets of New Orleans or to do your thing on Bourbon street and also one can get to the cbd relatively quickly. If i ever have the pleasure of returning to New Orleans i will without a doubt stay at the Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: tvorpe
Reviews.Content: First time in New Orleans. Absolutely the best choice of hotel in the French Quarter. ONe block from Jackson Square. 2 blocks from Cafe Dumon. The hotel is old but it is very clean and has modern bathrooms and amenities. If you book a balcony room make sure you specify a Private Balcony, otherwise they may put you in a room that has a common access balcony that everyone gets to enjoy. Front Desk staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Charming!”
Reviews.Author: DogmomDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights pre cruise in April, 2010. All I can say is Charming! We had a delightful room very reminiscent of old time New Orleans, very comfy and yet modern in amenities. The grounds are beautiful, the staff friendly and helpful. Just steps from Jackson Square and the French Quarter. Very nice complimentary continental breakfast daily in their breakfast room. We would definitely stay here again and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Steps away from everything”
Reviews.Author: cog480
Reviews.Content: I am originally from NOLA and stay in the French Quarter every time I go home. So I have stayed in over 20 different hotels in the quarter. I will now always stay at place d'armes. The hotel was comfortable, clean, friendly and helpful staff, we stayed in a room with a courtyard view, and what a view it was!! The courtyard made staying there feel like you had your own private apartment in the Quarter. The only drawback I can think of was the amount of time it took to get my car each day. While they have onsite drop off of your car, it is stored far away - somewhere on the other side of the St. Louis cathedral. It takes the valet sometimes thirty minutes to retrieve your car. As my trip progressed, I just allowed more time for them to fetch it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location!! What a Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nbk2
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Orleans for years - and this is my first time to stay at this hotel. It is by far the most typically New Orleans room I have ever stayed. We had a courtyard room - which was very large and comfortable. Excellent AC - and it's hot in NOLA in August! Friendly staff - PERFECT location for wandering aimlessly around The Quarter. This hotel has personality -- lots of it -- and it's all good. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “what an absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: mozzee
Reviews.Content: myself and my 20 year old son stayed here. we didn't arrive until after 1am and the reception staff were very polite and welcoming. our room didn't have a window which at first was strange, but it ended up being okay. the only drawback was that we could hear every single thing from the people in the room next to ours. the room had 2 QS beds and a small desk and tv cabinet and chair. plenty of space without being too big or too small. the decor of the whole hotel was so quaint the very annoying thing was no fridge in the room - considering the outside temps and the humidity it would have been very welcome to be able to keep some food and drinks cold. the location was amazing. a 5 min walk to boubon street one way and a 5 min walk the other way to restaurants and shops. at each change of shift on the reception staff, all were as pleasant and polite as each other. always smiling and always a friendly greeting. the complimentary breakfast was fine. tea and coffee and juice. fresh fruit, croissants and pastries it was fresh, free and did the trick until lunchtime. the swimming pool was in a beautiful setting and was very inviting and clean there was free wifi in the room although sometimes the signal was a bit weak i would stay there again without question due to the location and staff

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Charm!”
Reviews.Author: westtexaslady
Reviews.Content: We stay at Place d'Armes each time we visit New Orleans. I would imagine we always will. Location can't be beat. This hotel just has the New Orleans feel. The court yard is relaxing, the pool a definate plus, especially during the hot, steamy afternoons of August. I have to say though, hoping the management will read this, that I saw a couple of things that caused some concern. We always stay in room 302, with a balcony overlooking St. Ann's. Usually, the potted ferns on these street balconies are beautiful, full and green - this trip, though, they were brown and dying - like they hadn't been watered in weeks. So, I just felt like there was some neglect. Also, we always take the stairs to our room instead of the elevator, and this trip the carpet in the stairway was terriibly dirty - again an appearance of neglect. Sometimes the little things impact the ambiance tremendously. I was happy to see that on the morning we were leaving, crews were there to do some maintenance and painting on the exterior. The staff were all cordial, the bell man very helpful - overall a very good stay once again at Place d'armes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: out4goodtimes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Place d'Armes. There was one problem we encountered and that was that our initial room we were given didn't have any windows. My wife is claustrophobic and we couldn't stay in that room. When we went to front desk, the lady told us that we didn't specify a room with a window when we booked. In all our years of travel, we have never had to specify that. They did find us another room for that night and then we had to move 2 more times for our 6 day stay.These rooms came at an extra cost The staff was very accomodating and took care of moving our bags etc without incident. We found the rooms clean and quiet, nice courtyard, not an exciting breakfast but overall and enjoyable stay. I'd go back again with specifying a room with a window of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: the_steeles
Reviews.Content: Watch your wallet on the way out. This is a GREAT place to stay. We've been costomers here for almost twenty-five years, and will be for as long as we visit New Orleans. The problem is that they need updated confirmation software. We pay for parking in advance everytime; however, as we leave, the desk personnal try to snag us for MORE money for parking. We have to go through the "We've already paid for this service" and the minor angst of getting it all straightened out before we leave. Trust me...getting verbal confirmation as you make a reservation isn't enough. There is always the breakdown in communication as you check out. This hotel (as I said before) is one of the really great New Orleans gems. Just make sure you get it in writing (if you can) that your car is paid for, if you decide to pay for everything in advance. I've reccommended this place for years to friends, and no one has challenged me, yet. In fact, I'm ready to go back, anytime. However, I think I'll just take some extra cash along, and pay for parking, that way. I just think it'll be easier.

Reviews.Title: “The only Hotel we would stay at in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: FatherTom
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a hotel review, however, due to the outstanding quality of Place D'Armes, I felt that I had to speak up. My wife and I have stayed at Place D'Armes several times, normally on our anniversary. We have never had a bad stay; - only outstanding service, top-notch location, and without a doubt a feeling of quality and relaxation. We spent 4 days at Place D'Armes this time for our anniversary again, and after arriving by train, (another tradition of ours), we showed up a bit earlier that normal and were able to drop off our bags with the staff until the room was ready. We came back a couple hours later, and found our luggage safe and sound in our room. We were given a 2nd floor courtyard room, but was easily able to change to a ground floor courtyard room. I guess the Hotel did their homework because when we returned to our room after our first day on the town, we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. I cannot say more about the staff, especially the wonderful counter staff. She was always friendly, always courteous, and was looking out for us. Our room opened directly into the courtyard, so we could sit outside and enjoy the greenery and the tranquility without the hubbub of the streets. The location cannot be beat in the French Quarter. Located right next to Jackson Square and the Cathedral, we were steps away from the best that the French Quarter has to offer. We will not stay anywhere other than Place D'Armes, and look forward to returning again and again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Rooms - awful smell”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1808
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of people for a graduation party. The location of the hotel is great - right off of Jackson's Square, walking distance to Cafe du Monde, Pat O'Brien's, Arnaud's, K Paul's. The hotel itself has a lot of character - made up of several different buildings with brick exterior walls and a middle, courtyard area - apparently the hotel used to be one of the first boys schools in Louisiana. Robert, the bellman when we arrived was fabulous - helped with our luggage, helped again with luggage when we changed rooms, gave us directions - he was super friendly. The bellman who helped us when we left was also great but I can't remember his name. THE BAD: We stayed in a Courtyard Room (Rm. 115) - it was a very small, dark room with an awful moldy smell. There was no overhead light, just two lamps. After the first night we asked to be moved - we moved to Rm. 112, which was a little bigger with an overhead light, but still smelled like mold. I didn't feel comfortable walking on the carpet in bare feet or sitting on the bedspreads (the old motel kind of bedspreads). The television was a small CRT (not flatscreen) that worked well enough. We had other friends who had the same experience with their courtyard room (dark, moldy smelling room) - they also asked to change rooms after the first night and had the same experience with their second courtyard room. They were NOT pleased with their room either. Our other friends had a balcony room off of the second floor and it was better - didn't have as much of a smell and was more recently renovated. They had a large "walk out" window you could step through and sit at small table and enjoy the balcony. We have other friends who I believe were on the fifth floor and they said their room was okay. When I returned home and unpacked, all of our clothes had the same moldy smell that was in the rooms. If the owners spent the money to renovate the rooms and get rid of the smell it could become a fabulous boutique hotel - which now it is no where near!! Bottom line, the price was good (about $115 per night) compared to other chain hotels, but if you dare to stay, I would ask for a balcony room and NOT a courtyard room. Otherwise beware of the moldy smell that goes home with you.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Faresco
Reviews.Content: I am loathe to write a positive review, simply because it may make it more difficult to book a room again! when I return to New Orleans I will not stay anyplace else if at all possible. The rooms, while older, are well kept and very comfortable. 17 foot ceiling and very comfortable bed. Good high speed free WiFi. The courtyards are amazing and great islands of peace and beauty in the midst of a hustling bustling city. The service was superb and the price made this hotel a great value. The paring is strictly Valet and a bit high but worth the security and there is no "in and out" charge. I REALLY like this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel experience ever. Must be the ghost of Place d'Armes”
Reviews.Author: chasingamytwo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location; Service for towels are adequate. Cons: All the front desk receptionists and the owner/manager are rude, ungrateful, and unhelpful. The pool is nasty. Couples have sex every night in the pool. Cockroach in the rooms. Walls are thin. We could hear people having sex every night. Breakfast is lame. Our conversation to the Owner/Manger: Us: Sir, we paid in full months in advance. The receptionist last night said we would have to pay an extra cost of 20/night for the cot in the room. Why are you telling us we now need to pay extra for each persons allotted in the room? Manager: You will be charged 80/night on your credit card. The price you advanced paid is only for 2 people in the room. Each extra person will be an extra 20/night and the cot will be 20/night. 20*3(extra people) + cot = 80/night. It is not my problem. I am a busy man. Us: Sir we are here for a bachelorette party and have already budgeted the cost. When we reserved the room we told them we would have 5 people in the room. The hotel stated that was fine and we would be taken care of. The extra cost is news to us. Is there anyway you can help. There is a total of 10 of us and we have booked 2 largest room here. Manager: Do not bring the rowdy and craziness into this place. Our computer said you booked 2 people and a child. Us: We have already been here one night and we did not cause any rowdiness so how dare you say that to us? Your hotel made the mistake because we don't have a child with us. And would never have booked with a child. This is a mistake on your hotel. Manager: It's not anyone's fault. You owe us 80/night. I am a busy man. Us: Why are you raising your voice with us and not willing to help us. Don't you want us to come back and leave positives reviews. Manger: Yes, I do and I am a busy man. Fine. I will charge you only $40/night and knock off the 3rd person and the cot. As long as you promise to write a good review on TripAdvisor. ------------- We took it and left upset. There was nothing we could do. It was horrible hotel and I do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location to all of downtown new orleans and romanctic!”
Reviews.Author: mk9600
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here prior to going on a cruise. He had stayed here many years back and talked so fondly of it, so i made a reservation and surprised him with the trip to NOLA as well as the cruise. The hotel was as charming as he had described and the location cannot be beat. It was close to the action but didnt have the noise of being on Bourbon Street. The hotel offers charming balcony rooms, cont'l breakfast, parking for a charge, and a staff that are very accomodating. We arrived early and they stored our bags and then upgraded us to a junior suite; we paid for a balcony. I wish I had not given up the balcony but the Jr Suite does have a microwave and refrigerator which came in handy. The hotel has charming brick courtyards within its property and one can dine in the courtyard or inside for breakfast. I found the hotel to be clean and neat but it is not for those seeking luxury. If you want quiet, romance, charm, and great location then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Pretty much agree with majority of reviews. Fantastic location, lots of charater with several old buildings surrounded by charming courtyard. Had a ground floor Deluxe double/double which was clean, quiet and off on its own a bit. Had an opportunity to get a peek at other rooms and also feel that room quality is a bit hit and miss, some nicer than others. We arrived at 2.30am after a flight delay, and got the room type we requested and a very pleasant welcome by the lady at the night desk, so we did not experience any difficulties as several people have reported. Overall we had a great stay. The hotel had character, location and was excellent value for money. Rooms can be a bit hit and miss though, so those who prefer consistent standards associated with more expensive chain and boutique hotels may not find Place dArmes all that wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Charm & Ambience In a "Perfect Location"”
Reviews.Author: Absaqt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our last visit to N.O. Our first stay we had a room that was a double/double....but actually it was a queen/queen which was a big plus. The woman at the front desk who seems to work weekday mornings was not particularly friendly or accomodating, in fact, I felt like she hated me. The day of our check in we arrived at about 10:30 am to be told that the room would be ready in a little while. It was a very stormy day. We left, had breakfast and saw an IMAX show. We tried to stay away as long as possible in hopes that the room would be available upon our return. We returned at about 1:00pm to be told the room wasn't ready. We had given our car to the parking attendant already and were in the lobby with our belongings. With no options left, exhausted from our 3:00am departue from our house in NJ, wew alked in the rain over to St. Louis cathedral and sat (like homeless people) in the church for about an hour. We returned to the hotel and sat in the lobby till about 3:30pm & was finally given a room. This room was OK. It was a courtyard room. We left the hotel for 3 days to visit family and upon returning, we stayed in a King Jr. Suite. "WHAT A DIFFERENCE!" Spend the extra money it is well worth it. we met people with a balcony room and when they saw ours, they said ours was so much better then theirs. We had a courtyard room that was sparkling clean, beautiful and in the best spot. Our doors opened right to the pool area. My teen daughter and cousin had a different queen/queen directly across from the one we stayed in during our first visit. This room seemed a little bit newer and nicer, but there was this horrible stench that was covered up by a very strong perfume smell. I couldn't bear it for more then a minute or two, but the girls said they didn't mind it at all. Being that we had 3 room during our visit 6/29-7/09/10 I noticed a huge difference in the rooms. OK so the bottom line is: If you get a great room your gonna be happy. The breakfast is just the same old cherry, blueberry, apple or cheese danish every single day. Croissants, apples and oranges, coffee, tea or OJ. If you get there later then 9:00, you probably wont get danish or there may be one or 2 left. They need to order more then they do. The pool is cleaned almost everyday. the trees surrounding it tend to drop petals in the pool, but it isn't dirty by any means. I think it may be a salt water pool, water seemed slightly salty to me. There are alot of mosquitos in the court yard....so bring bug spray or better yet yard gaurd! The courtyard is nice enough to just hang out in or entertain friends. There was a wedding performed in the courtyard one afternoon. The guys who get the cars do an amazing job. Just call them when getting ready to leave your room and there is really no wait. My husband did tip them well, so maybe that was why :) The entire staff (except the one woman in the morning) was great and went out of their way. At night, the woman who watches the desk, locks the door, and only buzzes in people staying at the hotel. The location is as good as it gets. Even though its right in the heart of the french quarter, its quiet. My husband is from New Orleans and we visit alot. This was by far my favorite hotel we have stayed in. If you wanna feel like you are in N.O. and love being able to access everything with ease, this is the place for you. If you want a modern chain hotel, I do like the Sherraton on Canal St., because it has a pool on the roof...........but it's just an ordinary chain hotel. Not as convienient, on an awful street that has no charm whatsoever, and without a car, you are gonna be doing alot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and service”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a stones throw from Jackson square and Cafe Du Monde. We paid for a room with a balcony and when we got here there was a balcony but it was not accessible through our room. The hotel was very accommodating and gave us a junior suite instead with a balcony- a great upgrade for a family. We chose not to have made service because there was no in room safe and we were pleasantly surprised finding a bag of fresh towels on our door when we returned in the afternoon from exploring. The breakfast was okay, some good coffee and cheap pastries. We were also happy to find that they had free wi-fi. The worst part of the hotel was the bed. It was very hard. All things considered though, we would forgo the bad bed for all that this hotel offers at the very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy attitude; poor customer service skills and disfunctional leadership”
Reviews.Author: Jesuit_1980
Reviews.Content: Out the gate I was not happy with the staff at Place D'Armes because of the poor attitude I was getting from the the lady taking reservation. She made me feel as though I was putting her out. I other words don't bother me. But becasue the location was so great and the pricing reasonable I made the my reservations; 2 months in advance. The customer service rep (I use that term loosely with her) never verified any of my information. Hey, maybe she's better than I thought. Noooott. Nearly a month later I had to call them for my confirmation email. They didn't get my email information correct. I have to say the second lady I spoke to was much better. She sounnded professional and educated. They got the email address corrct this time ans I recieved and email. The problem is that they then got the dates wrong. The confirmation showed 8 Jun to 11 Jun. I was due for the Jul. Well as you can see the abriviation look pretty similar, I missed itm butr they charged me. I recieved the confirmation on the 28 or so of May so a few days came and by the time I realized what happened... they charged me. So not only did I not have a room for my visit they charged me for it. I tried to work this out wtih the GM and it was at that point I realized why this place operates the way it does. I was to recieve a call back from Bobby Valentio; it never happened. I'm from New Orleans, I was trying to help the local economy by patronizing some of the local businesses. Let's just say Marriot was grateful to see me. Katrina, BP oil spill. you guys need to think before you .......

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: nationalparkslover
Reviews.Content: Place D'Armes is located a half-block from Jackson Square in a great area of the French Quarter. It's clean, comfy and charming - with a small but nice pool and a lovely courtyard area. Breakfasts are basic but good. They have valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Ciaobeau
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Place d'Armes for several years. Amazing location, helpful and friendly staff, perfect beds, and charm by the buckets!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint in perfect location - overlook a few things and enjoy the charm”
Reviews.Author: OKSoloLady
Reviews.Content: Solo lady traveler who travels to New Orleans ever so often - I had always wanted to stay in a balcony room at Place d'Armes. Finally did for four nights. The staff service was above excellent. My check in room was a balcony room - but wasn't exactly what I wanted, as I had explained when I made my reservation months in advance - I wanted a private balcony, so after two nights they moved me to my private balcony room. I was in heaven sitting on my balcony overlooking Jackson Square - a dream come true. I just breathed in all the smells, sights, sounds, and charm of the city. The courtyard was beautiful. Cont breakfast room very quaint and sufficient. Only complaint - there are things you have to overlook, carpet is worn, could use some renovation, the beds (mattress in both rooms not comfortable and worst thing to deal with - the pillows are absolutely not acceptable, flat - no fluff at all-must have purchased at a discount store for $3 - I can't understand how a three star hotel that carries the Valentino name of pride couldn't have better pillows!) That said, all in all I had a wonderful stay, again the staff deserves an A+ for customer service and making you feel like a wanted guest. Location is everything - right in the heart of it all. I would recommend to friends if they could overlook what I listed as complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!”
Reviews.Author: europetraveler7
Reviews.Content: The good news. It's in a great location to the best restaurants, bourbon st., and Cafe du Monde. It's right on Jackson Square. It has a lovely courtyard and the rooms have some charm to them with the exposed brick. The staff was nice and the price seemed reasonable. The bad news.....it is in some major need of an upgrade. The bedding is old, the tv's aren't great, the decor is about 15-20 years old, rugs need to be replaced. We had 2 rooms since we had teens with us. We had 3 teens (2 were 19yrs and 1 was 13 yrs). Since 3 were in a room, they charged us an extra $20 per day for the extra person . (The room had 2 queen beds so I assumed that it was for accomadating up to 4 people. I was wrong.) The parking was $25 per night....though that didn''t surprise me. We skipped the free breakfast since is was just crossiants and sweet rolls with some fruit. I didn't care too much for the haunted tour they recommended. But what really bothered me was the really bad smell in my room. A very musty smell. It may have been from the exposed wall, but they should really try to figure out something about that. The beds were not so great and the bathrooms were just worn out and old. This hotel has so many possibilities and could be great with a little more work. I just don't get why there isn't an extra effort. That said, unless it is renovated, I probably won't be back. But I did love New Orleans. I will definitely be back to that city. If you are looking for a terrific tour, try The Original Cocktail Tour by Grayline. We did it on our 1st day and learned where the best places to eat and where the fun and historical bars are. We also had some great tours of Private rooms not open to the public. Lots of fun!!! It made my trip.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: islandmann
Reviews.Content: Wanted old world charm as we usually go priceline and get the generic business hotels on canal. Sorry I just dont find dark rooms with bad beds and no services charming. The Mosquitoes were everywhere in the room and outside in the garden area even 1st thing in the morning! We got eaten alive as we slept. We asked why they didnt spray the garden area or the rooms and they said they did once a week or so!! I have stayed many times in New Orleans and never had a problem. Kinda made the trip miserable as we spent all night and day scratching!!! It is a charming looking place and many people will love the old world charm, but for me I think I want the 4 star luxury without bites... The location is number one and that did make us happy! right on Jackson Square! We did however eat enough seafood to make up for the bites and overall loved our trip! Next time I will go generic and leave old World to the younger crowds

Reviews.Title: “This place needs major renovations; it's a dump.”
Reviews.Author: jmdMobile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to spend the night in New Orleans. We live about 2 hours from there and have been hundreds of times before. I always check these things out on Tripadvisor and have never been let down, until now. The reviews said this was a "charming" place but it was a dump. I will begin by saying this: If you're going to New Orleans to party and get drunk this place is perfect. The location is prime. The price is right. If you'll be sober and want to enjoy your time there, this is not the hotel for you. The staff was great, I will say that. Very helpful, very friendly. My husband and I got the king room with a balcony. Sounds nice right? Not really. The balcony faced what I assume is the runoff street from Bourbon and it was so stinky you couldn't sit out there. The bedding was in very bad need of updating, which I could overlook, but the mattress was inexcusable. When I awoke I felt like I had fought with this thing and it beat my bum. I felt like I had slept on stones. The bathroom was roomy but was in desperate need of a cleaning. On the surface (toilet, bath) it was clean, but there were dingy fingerprints all over the door. It had not been cleaned in a long time and looked as if a mechanic had been living in there. The floor, tiled, was the dirtiest floor I have ever seen in a hotel. True, hotel floors are dirty, but they didn't even try to hide this. The TV, which was a large flat screen, went out while we were winding down for bed and it took them a good hour to deal with that, but the man who came to take care of it was very nice and friendly. It was very hot, the ice machine was broken for the entire stay. Very noisy room, as it faced the street and I had expected that. But it was VERY noisy. Motorcycles, garbage trucks, fighting couples, screaming kids. You name it we heard it. The one good thing, at least in our room, was that it was a good cold room. All that said, if we were drunk and there to party, we wouldn't have been in our room as much as we were and we would have been too drunk to notice these things. Last time we stayed at La Quinta Downtown and will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend more than 50/night for 99 you can stay at the Hotel Monteleone!”
Reviews.Author: JovanV
Reviews.Content: Imagine my surprise when I thought I was getting a bargain rate of 98 per night + tax and parking and then we walk down the street and see the FABULOUS 5 star Hotel Monteleone on Rue Royale and they are having a "summer sizzler" special for only 99 per night!!! I was sick to my stomach and wanted to check out of the Place d'Armes immediately. Let's compare the two properties: Place d'Armes has small double beds that remind me of an old horse, the beds are sunken in the middle and very uncomfortable. The tub takes 30 minutes to drain, the tv is this tiny thing across the room that you need a pair of binoculars to see the tv screen! The rooms are accessed via stairs, NO elevators...so forget it if you have luggage to lug up two flights of stairs, the pool has all types of debris and leaves in it so you are not going to be swimming in it unless you are not bothered by this sort of thing! Hotel Monteleone has a large flat screen tv, new King size mattresses, marble bath rooms, elevators and a door man, gourmet restaurant on site, wireless access (I forgot to mention that hell will freeze over before you can get an Internet connection at the Place d'Armes) I could go on and on, but I think you get the gist, both of these hotels are the same price and so it is like comparing a "Motel 6" to a Ritz Carlton. THERE IS NO COMPARISON! So save your sanity and book a room at the Hotel Monteleone. I am counting the hours until I can check in as I am stuck here at the Place d'Armes tonite since they already charged my credit card and I cannot get a refund. On a positive note, the clerk kindly offered to refund my parking fee as she felt bad that we were not happy with the room. If you are short, you may not mind the small double beds, but anyone over 5'10" will not be comfortable. Back to those who reviewed this hotel and termed it old world charm, yes, I guess you could use those words...emphasis on the word OLD. This is the first time trip advisor has let me down, as normally I am extremely pleased with trip advisor reviews but this one was a real dog. Bow-wow. You have been officially warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with romantic vibe with my new husband”
Reviews.Author: Ldavidson
Reviews.Content: I just got married two days before we left to New Orleans and this is the first time I have been out of state and all I can say is it was one of the best experiences of my life. The employees were courteous and helpful when you needed them to be. The hotel is in a great location where pretty much everything is walking distance. Unfortunately, the walls are a bit thin and you could hear the conversations next door pretty clearly. We actually stayed in a room with no windows, but it really didn't matter since we only used the room to sleep. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A excellent location with good accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: jgadkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend and really enjoyed the location. Although I have stayed in New Orleans many times the location next to Jackson Square added to my experiences. The courtyard was very nice and relaxing by the pool. The breakfast was limited to coffee and danish, but it was fresh. I had a large back courtyard room that was quiet but it was a little old, needed some updates and had a very small bath.

Reviews.Title: “The Place d'Armes is an absolute gem.”
Reviews.Author: Bundugal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Place d'Armes several times since discovering it about 3 years ago. The location in the heart of the French Quarter, just off Jackson Square, is absolutely ideal. Several different buildings surround a beautiful tropical courtyard and swimming pool, and all the rooms in this historic boutique hotel, from interior to balcony, are comfortable and clean. The service is outstanding, and Mitch, Robert, and all the girls at the front desk will ensure a warm welcome and a wonderful stay. Because this is an historic hotel, the size and location of the rooms does vary. If you want a courtyard or a balcony room, you will need to book early!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Michelle
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a business trip, and since I prefer to choose hotels with character, I decided on Place d'Armes. All the staff I encountered was wonderful, the room was beautiful, and the courtyard couldn't have been more perfect. I noticed my shower did drain slowly as well, but in the overall scheme of things, I didn't think it was that big of a deal. I did follow advice from past travelers and got a room with a window. It was great, but I think I'll go for a courtyard room next time, just so I can really get the most of that. This hotel has a fantastic location!!! Some of my coworkers that live in the city, couldn't help but remark about the location. It feels very safe, even when coming in around midnight. Right by Jackson square and a little pedestrian walk which is oh so charming. I even got to walk to Cafe Du'Monde for breakfast! Yes, the hotel has a continental breakfast, but there are so many places nearby that offer a more substantial breakfast if you've got the time. I've already told my boyfriend we'll be visiting this hotel again. it's definitely got a romantic vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Looking back”
Reviews.Author: Jimnonow
Reviews.Content: I have been to the "Place" several times and am looking forward to going back this July. The facility, location, and most of all the staff are great. Whevever I go to New Orleans I just book the "Place". Right in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but rooms are in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: mate0517
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place D'Armes for a weekend after our cruise. First of all, the staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and accomodating. The grounds are very nice. The courtyard area was attractive and peaceful. We had two rooms which faced the street. Unfortunately we were on the first floor so even though we had windows the drapes remained closed all the time since people were always walking by . The location is wonderful. It is right by Jackson Square and close to everything. The rooms, however, are in need of some serious updating. The carpeting was worn and there were spots on it . Bathroom also needed work. Yet overall, it is a very charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Jane00
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here because of reviews from Trip Advisor. They were right! This hotel is located one block from Jackson Square and about two blocks from Bourbon Street-close enough to walk wherever you want to go but far enough off of the thoroughfare to be able to sleep at night. We booked an inside room and it was nice, quiet and dark enough to sleep late. All of the staff were friendly, helpful & knowledgeable. I called ahead to ask questions & book tours & the staff answered all of the questions I had & advised me on what to book. The room was small but perfect for two people, nicely redone and clean. The only drawbacks I can think of were 1. The shower drained slow and 2. There were not a lot of plug Ins for cell phone, laptop, etc. These are minor inconveniences and are easy to work around. I would stay here again without hesitation. HINT: Muriel's Bistro is next door. You definitely want to eat here for elegant dining, impeccable service and gourmet creole cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 Nights excellent location and very helpful staff , As previous postings the breakfast is very god and you can sit by the pool and courtyard and take in the sun !!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place to stay in the Quarter with your Family!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NAN1001
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with this hotel....we will certainly be returning soon. We live only 40 miles outside of New Orleans in Mandeville but wanted to take the kids to the Big Easy for the weekend to soak in all the culture and the life that this wonderful city has to offer. The Location of Place D Arms is PERFECT for the family!!! You are just steps from Jackson square. We felt very safe in this area at all times, even when getting a bite to eat late at night with the kids. The staff are extremely accommodating and customer focused. The kids enjoyed the pool and we enjoyed the ambience of it all! It is such a charming hotel. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Poe_10
Reviews.Content: I don't think I could've picked a better hotel for my trip. The courtyard was so pretty and peaceful and the location could not have been better. The front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. The only thing I would do different next time would be to choose a courtyard room. My room was clean and comfortable but did not have any windows (!) and was very dark.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel We Have Booked for Stay Since 1996”
Reviews.Author: ouideux2
Reviews.Content: Like our home away from home! We always get the room we request because we need lots of space and we have a view of the beautiful courtyard ( especially helpful when we decorate).. From the owner - front desk - concierge - house keeping to grounds keeper ... everyone is pleasant & helpful! We like this location beause it is centrally located - we are close to our favorite local bar, restaurants and shopping - we make lots of trips to put bags in the room. Most of all we never feel like strangers.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: nyr11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend celebrating 1st Anniversary. I can't say enough about the location of the hotel. It is located close to everything you need to be near. Only 1 block walk to Bourbon St., St.Pauls Cathedral , Jackson Square and so much more. The hotel itself is very quaint and the staff are very helpful. The rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. Loved the courtyard, you would never realize you are so close to Bourbon St.. It was our first time to New Orleans and we fell in love with the city, already trying to plan when we can make it back.

Reviews.Title: “QUAINT HOTEL IN PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: longislandgirls
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four nights at this lovely hotel in May 2010. I have been in New Orleans several times before and I always enjoyed my my stay and this hotel was also a pleasant experience. We had a beautiful upper level courtyard room with our own private balcony. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for all the activities that we had planned. The only complaints I have was the free breakfast, which was disappointing and the upkeep of the pool, which should have been cleaned on a daily basis. Other than those minor things, I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: garpts
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights pre-cruise at the Place d'Armes, which is located right at Jackson Square in NOLA. We had a 3rd floor shared balcony room overlooking the square. The pluses: LOCATION - right in the middle of everything, but outside noise is not bad at night. Service - we had great front desk staff, bellman, and housekeeping. Price - we felt it was very reasonable for the location. Character - great courtyard, nice enough pool, building is very old but well maintained, gas lights, etc. Elevator - it did have one to get to the upper floors (whew). The minuses We could hear our neighbors talking in normal volumes - clearly. Since the facility is made up of several buildings, this probably isn't a generalization, but if you get a 3rd floor balcony, bring ear plugs. Very limited TV (we had a 15 year old that complained about this so thought I'd mention but not a big deal to us) Shared balcony - we thought we paid for a private one, and on the 3rd floor the balconies are too narrow for a table. OVERALL - not much to complain about, we would definitely stay there again. If you're looking for the Hilton, stay at the Hilton. This is a boutique hotel, and character is the biggest draw to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gr8lakeswanderer1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Place d'Armes many times, and it's a wonderful hotel. Great location near Jackson Square, great staff, beautiful courtyards, lovely pool, and a variety of rooms. Pastries, juice, tea, coffee and newspapers are available every morning in the breakfast room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location...for cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Killer60864
Reviews.Content: Out of the bathroom going to bed, I was sure I saw something moving on the carpet. Switched the light on: nothing. Switch it back off. And waited. Waited there in the dark. Then I saw it again. Gosh it was quick. I got one shoe slowly without breathing. And, yes, eventually I managed to smash it. Nice specimen I captured (see picture). Overall it's a nice place to be if you're into entomology and/or like hunting rather than sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hidtoric hotel in a excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: GarryUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a excellent location of the French Quarter, just of Jackson square. It is far enough from Bourbon street to give you a quiet nights sleep but central enough so you can walk every where. The staff were great, especially Dionne who manned the front desk, she gave us invaluable advice and helped us book some local tours. The breakfasts were nice, with fresh croissants and pastries. Our only disappointment was that we booked a deluxe room about 5 months ago and requested a balcony, but none were available. I wonder just how far in advance you have to book one to get a balcony?

Reviews.Title: “Get a room with a window”
Reviews.Author: Emm781
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to New Orleans every year for JazzFest. This was our first time staying at the Place d"Armes Hotel. We selected it because our usual hotel was fully booked, and the Place d'Armes had availability. The lobby has old New Orleans character and charm. Our room was okay.. nothing special, kind of old, but clean and functional. The hotel is in a very good location in the French Quarter, very close to Jackson Square. We could easily walk everywhere we wanted to go. Our room was an interior room, which means that it had no windows. It got dark. Very dark. It was the same dark at 9am that it was at 3am. We had set an alarm on one of our phones to wake us, but if we hadn't done that. we might have just slept all day. At 9am, with my eyes wide open, I waved my hand in front of my face, and I could not see my hand. I could just see pitch black. Did I mention it was dark? So my recommendation would be to request an exterior room or risk missing the day entirely! A couple of reviewers mentioned that the rate at this hotel was $69 per night. Unfortunately, when there is a major event such as JazzFest, hotels tend to triple their rates, and the Place d"Armes is no exception. For $69, it is an absolutely fine hotel. For what we paid, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SMH71
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint, cozy hotel - not new by any definition, but that's the charm of New Orleans. We spent 4 nights here in April 2010 coinciding with the French Quarter Festival. We had a small room with a window and access to a beautiful balcony overlooking Chartres Street, which was surprisingly quiet & peaceful in the evening. The hotel has the old bricks, the balconies, the courtyard, the gas lanterns - just like you envision when you think of New Orleans. The courtyard is beautiful & quiet (the pool could be cleaner....) which is a nice break from the hectic Quarter, and there is a pleasant breakfast room where coffee & pastries were offered in the morning. The staff were more than friendly & helpful. We were early for check-in and the front desk clerk & porter stored our bags so we could go for lunch and a bit of sightseeing until our room was ready. They assisted us with lunch recommendations, directions, calling a cab, etc. - all with a smile. I did find some of the darker corners of the courtyard had a dank odor about them.... but so did the rest of the French Quarter. Funky New Orleans smell. My only suggestion would be a bit of updating in the rooms - I understand the buildings are old, but the linens, carpet, etc. don't have to be. Maybe some of the other rooms are better than the one we stayed in. Ours was clean & comfortable, but dated. To top it all off - the location cannot be beat - - hands down the best in the Quarter.... mere steps away from Jackson Square, Cafe du Monde, restaurants, shops, etc. I would definitely recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: ddabh
Reviews.Content: A great place for the money! Don't let the price fool you. A nice courtyard, pleasant staff, and clean hotel, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: BevCQ
Reviews.Content: Traveled with women friends for leisure. Hotel staff were great and the location could not be better. Older hotel with lovely courtyard! Would recommend to anyone traveling to visit New Orleans and stay here. Only negative is breakfast could have a little more to offer such as fruit, pastries were let down, however everything else wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Choice in N'awlins”
Reviews.Author: GaryfromDelaware
