Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Place d'Armes -- this time for French Quarter Festival. Again, the atmosphere was charming, the staff excellent, and the room perect. Our balcony overlooked Jackson Square, yet the room was quiet. Housekeeping were in and out early and almost as though they were invisible. Unlike many hotels, the temperature was steady (and individually controlled by room), the beds comfortable, and the continental breakfast just right. Kudos to the manager, Lynn, who is always out and about -- talking with guests to make sure everything is just right, checking on rooms, greeting new guests. Her cheerfulness and sincerity is clearly reflected in the rest of the staff. If a hotel can have a 'personality" -- it is hers. This hotel has rooms tucked way in nooks and crannies, all centered around a wonderful shady courtyard. Guests are outgoing and quick to share their experiences and make recomendations. The hotel certainly has the best location in the quarter, just a few steps from Jackson Square. From the warm arrival greeting at the door to reserving you a cab and giving you a warm send-off, this place can't be beat. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: porelly
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to New Orleans, and my 2nd stay at the Place D'Armes hotel. This is a great boutique style hotel with much charm, and the location cannot be matched anywhere's in the FQ. And the courtyard is just gorgeous! Pictures do not do it justice. I had a king size balcony room over St Ann street, same as last year, and it was just as enjoyable. There's nothing like having coffee 1st thing in the am out on your balcony, watching the Quarter awaken. If you can splurge, I highly suggest you do so. You do hear a bit of street noise (trucks and what not), but certainly nothing to keep you up all night. The Place D'Armes is not a high class, cookie cutter hotel. If this is your thing, you won't like this hotel. But if you want to add to your New Orleans vacation by staying in a place with character, this hotel will accomplish that. Another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Laissez les bon temps rouler!”
Reviews.Author: RajunCajunFloirda
Reviews.Content: The Place D'Armes offers the true spirit of New Orleans. The warmth of the staff, beauty of the courtyard, and ambiance of the hotel as a whole has us coming back, year after year. I am from New Orleans, and can tell you that I feel at home at the Place D'Armes. We can't wait to book for next year! Sandra Florida via NO

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tattoomommy666
Reviews.Content: I'm not understanding all of the bad reviews, I stayed here for 2 nights. We had an interior room #106, the room didn't have any windows, but hence the word interior. The room had a strange smell to it, but it has old brick walls so what do you really expect? I was loving staying here, I will go back again and back again. The staff was not rude at all, actually very friendly and helpful. Plus with the bad reviews maybe the hotel remodeled recently, because it wasn't at all what others put in their bad reviews. The beds were comfy, clean, and did not smell weird.

Reviews.Title: “One of the 3 most charming places I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: YdnarMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: The other 2 were the Coco Palms, Kauai and the Brown Palace, Denver. We had a wonderful courtyard room, quiet cozy and as everyone has said, the location is outstanding.! How many times have you felt that you wanted to just hang out at the hotel and didn't feel like you were wasting time not seeing the sites? Sitting in the courtyard you could feel the charm of the French Quarter just seeping into you. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ALGleek
Reviews.Content: The hotel was adorable and in a perfect location in the FQ. We never heard any street noise but we had an interior room with no window (cheaper option). It was a rather small room, but you're not spending much time in the room if you're in New Orleans anyway. There was a very nice breakfast with coffee and croissants in the morning. Above all, the staff was super nice and always helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM!!!”
Reviews.Author: litebox
Reviews.Content: This hotel contains old world simplicity reminiscent of European Hotels. The location captures the essence of old New Orleans, and is right off Jackson Square. The staff is very friendly and personable in their services. I have stayed here before and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rgwilliams69
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in this hotel with my wife and children (14 and 6) after returning from a cruise. The location is absolutely outstanding for anyone wanting to explore the French Quarter. Located just off Jackson Square, easy access to Royal, Bourbon, Jackson Square, French Market, etc. Tons of great restaurants to visit nearby. The courtyard is absolutely amazing, a nice quiet place in the Quarter to sit, rest, relax, and reflect. At the urging of the front desk we booked the "junior suite" to have more room for the kids. Once we got to the room I was amazed by the size of it - a huge room that was perhaps the largest I have ever stayed at in New Orleans. Beautifully decorated, 12 foot ceilings, and period furniture that completed the ambiance. The staff was friendly and recommended several places to eat nearby, all good recommendations. Parking was convenient (right beside the hotel) and at the standard price of about $25/night for valet in the French Quarter. The room was $209 which was probably a little high - but the beautiful room, sitting room attached, and extra space was likely worth it. I heard someone else checking in with an interior (no windows) king bed at $139, so our price seemed right in line). Overall an excellent experience - we will definintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: RandBTravel
Reviews.Content: We have visited New Orleans at least ten or more times, and this was our first stay at the Place d'Armes Hotel. Our room was small and very average. However, the courtyard and beautiful surrounding area more then made up for it. The front desk/bell staff was just fine, except for one very stuffy lady. They had a nice little continental breakfast with the price of the room, which was only $75 for us. The location was perfect. We enjoy doing Bourbon Street and then getting away to a quieter place to sleep. Very short walking distance to everything the French Quarter has to offer. Yes, we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest - happy every time”
Reviews.Author: MplsTheGoodLife
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel at least 4 times over the last 10 years. We have always been very satisfied and will continue to go back - we have stayed there each and every time we have been to the city. We have traveled with friends to this hotel and have recommended it to others when they were visiting New Orleans. It is in the perfect location - 2 blocks off of Bourbon Street, near Jackson Square and the outdoor market Close to all of the action but removed enough that it is quiet at night. Haven't been there during Mardi Gras, but at that point all bets are off! You can walk anywhere in the French Quarter easily, is near to Frenchmans Street (the place to go if you like good live music) and you can catch the trolley on Canal to get to the Garden District. The rooms are all different and some of the interior rooms do not have windows. However, this is made clear on the website and it is extremely reasonably priced compared to some of the other hotels in the area. And honestly you should not be spending much time in the room except to sleep, so no windows is not a big deal. For the most part it is an adorable hotel, though some of the fixtures and facilities are a bit outdated. Though I feel this only adds to its charm! My experience has been that they assign the rooms as people arrive - so it does pay to get there at a reasonable time to assure that you get a decent room. On our most recent trip, we reserved one of the suites, we were there during the week, and pre-paid at the time we made the reservation - so it was a very good price. Got exactly the room that was advertised and had no concerns at all. This was the first time that we had been back to New Orleans since the big storm. Could not tell any difference to the greater French Quarter area. Though I know this was not the area that was hard-hit. The Place d'Armes hotel had been remodeling the last 2 times we were there. It was finally done - with the front room for breakfast all completed. It looked very nice and was good to finally see it done. Would highly recommend this hotel - have never been disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fantastic staff, close to everything and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: NicSiSi
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere close to the action yet affordable. The pictures on Place d'Armes website does not do it any justice. The courtyard and rooms were beautiful and we felt as if we were a part of a beautiful romantic movie. The breakfast of juice pastries was just perfect as we were always on the go! Its in an ideal spot for both Bourbon St. and the water front. So close to Cafe Du Monde, Jackson Square too! We paid around the $90 mark for our room. I had initially booked an internal room with no window but decided to upgrade and I'm glad we did. The room was on the 3rd floor and it was quite large. We couldn't fault the room and the bed (the most important thing) was comfier than our bed at home! We'd have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: IrshIs
Reviews.Content: We just returned - very reluctantly I may add - from a wonderful week long stay at this awesome hotel! This was my third visit to New Orleans and the best place I've stayed so far. The hotel building itself has a character and history that could never be found at a chain hotel. We had a double room with a private balcony overlooking St. Anne's Street. It could be noisy at times, but I enjoyed listening to the sounds of the Quarter and it never interupted my sleep. The room was good sized and spacious enough that four of us were able to share it comfortably ( I should say however that the only time we were in it was to sleep, get ready for the day or rest prior to heading out again for the night). Had the weather been warmer, I would have spent more time lounging in the fabulous courtyard. I was able to enjoy pastries and coffee (provided by the hotel) on the balcony daily with the added bonus of getting to watch the Quarter come alive. All the hotel staff - hi Lynn, Nate and everyone! - were very friendly and helpful. Lynn went above and beyond to assist us with a transportation issue. We already miss greeting them and visiting with them every day. Housekeeping kept us in towels (and soap, shampoo, lotion) and the room clean which was not an easy task since the room was shared by 4 women! The location of the hotel is also perfect, in the heart of the quarter and close to everything! I can't imagine now staying anywhere else and can't wait until I can return for another visit!! It is truely an authentic New Orleans experience!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was part of the family.”
Reviews.Author: TuristaConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, and the beautiful courtyard was like our private outdoor livingroom where we gathered in the afternoon. Having breakfast in the room overlooking St. Ann Street is an opportunity to see the neighborhood wake up, with the artists setting up in front of the cathedral and Jackson Square. It feels intimate and warm and a real step back in time.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It For The Location Alone”
Reviews.Author: kjosker
Reviews.Content: Located on St. Ann near Chartres, it puts you in an excellent location for all the French Quarter has to offer. A block and a half from Bourbon, a block to Cafe Du Monde, a few steps from Jackson Square. Our fifth floor Deluxe Room was clean, spacious and inviting, overlooking the French Quarter. A great room. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and efficient, always willing to answer questions. In short, the Place d'Armes is a quality hotel, providing a great stay; which we would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, good location, but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: mxm971
Reviews.Content: This place was the epitome of the french quarter, cute courtyard, unique rooms good location, etc. However, the place is old and you can hear EVERYTHING coming from the rooms next to you and above you. My friends and I heard clear conversations from other guests as if they were in our room. Additonally, the room was not cleaned on a daily basis (i swear they only had one housekeeper), they do not have safes in the rooms, and they did not refill things like the coffee or the shampoo/conditioners, etc. It is definitely not like staying at a chain hotel. Also, continental breakfast consisted of croissants and coffee only, not many options. The worst of all were the two woman who waited on us at the front desk. They were rude and unaccomodating, short with us, and just mean. The bell hop nathaniel was awesome though so make sure you tip him well. Would not recommend for a group of girls or guys on bachelorett/bachelor party...more for a couple if anything at all.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint European style hotel with New Orleans ambience and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: TexasNana5
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, its courtyard, its accommodating staff, its privacy - yet access to Jackson Square and Cafe duMonde and wonderful eating places all within easy walking distance. Only tip I would give is to have available a brochure on the history of the Place d"Armes and information on the services it offers ,to share with friends for future visits..

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans is totally back and running”
Reviews.Author: MagHoustonTx
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have been guests at Place d Armes for many years. The hotel is in the French Quarters close to all great restaurants and Jackson Square. The hotel is absolutely the BEST and every one is friendly. I am an early bird, therefore the 6:30 a.m. Continental breakfast is a plus, I must have coffee to function. Mr. Valentino runs a tight ship to ensure the guests are top priority. I enjoy leisure time in the courtyard and visiting with guests from around the world. Houston Tx guest

Reviews.Title: “Just so so and parking policy is a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: rockyrikoko
Reviews.Content: Here is my bottom line up front review. The hotel is in a great location, the courtyard is incredible, and the staff is courteous. BUT, the room is exactly what I would expect from a 20-30 year old interstate Econolodge in the middle of nowhere. It was nothing special, neither decorated nor bare, not incredibly clean nor horribly dirtyâ€¦just blah. What really soured me about this place is when you pay for parking it isnâ€™t for 24 hours. For $28 in addition to your room rate (of course) you receive a parking spot from 3pm-noon the following day. In my case I arrived at 7pm and wanted to leave NOLA around the same time the next day. For this I had to pay $56 just for 24 hours of parking (owners policy). I understand this area is built up and parking is at a premium but $56 for 24 hours of parking is ridiculous. Not even the Ritz Carlton charges that. Due to this policy and their unwillingness to accommodate my special request for parking I cannot recommend this hotel and will not give them my business in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MsMouse10
Reviews.Content: My new husband recently surprised me w/ a trip to my hometown of New Orleans for Valentine's Day - and the Mardi Gras! I had never in my life stayed in the French Quarter, and always said "one of these days".... Somehow, he had the great fortune to book our stay at the Place d'Armes, and we were both pleasantly pleased with the service, quality of the room, and the location! Because there were only a few rooms left when he decided in January to plan this surprise trip, we had a small interior room - which met our needs but was not in any way "luxurious". Next time (and there WILL be a next time !), we hope to have a room with a balcony or view of the courtyard. But the staff was GREAT - helpful & friendly. The coffee and danish/croissants every morning were a nice way to start the day (we wanted to save our real appetite for all the great food in town !), and the LOCATION is unbeatable - steps away from Jackson Square, 2 blocks to Bourbon St, and 3-4 blocks to the French Market. Harrah's and the Warehouse District (another great area for food and bars) are 5-6 blocks away at the foot of Canal St., where you can walk onto the FREE Algier ferry as a passenger and ride across the Miss River for a good view of the Quarter and downtown. Nice photo opp, esp if the Natchez steamboat is docked. I love to hear the calliope ! Because it was Mardi Gras, many of the famous places like Pat O'Briens and Acme Oyster Bar were packed, but we spent much of our time going back and forth to the parades on Canal St. Some of the places that we did eat at w/ little to no wait were: Felix's (across street from Acme) had good poboys; Frank's on Decateur St by the Joan of Arc statue had good gumbo and muffelettas and a GREAT upstairs dining balcony that overlooks the street; and Pere Antoines' on the corner of Royal and St Ann (1/2 block from the hotel), had a good bkfst and decent dinners - crawfish pasta, blackened catfish, fried crawfish poboy w/ sweet potatoe fries. It's hard to get a BAD meal in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Like Coming Home!”
Reviews.Author: Misread
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Place D' Armes and will stay in NO other Hotel in New Orleans. The Hotel itself is BEAUTIFUL and historical. The staff are all corteous, freindly and helpful. We have become particularly attached to Miss Lyn Castenada! She has been so helpful in planning our stays and helping us get our favorite rooms. We met "Bubby" Valentino this trip and fell in love with him as well. If you want to stay somewhere that you feel at home and that the staff sincerely appreciates you being there and actually looks forward to you return visit... then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Caroling by Candlelight”
Reviews.Author: jimandrobinIllinois
Reviews.Content: Such a great city! We enjoyed our stay at Place d'Armes and such a great location to walk about and enjoy all the wonderful things New Orleans has to offer. There was a woman in the front office that was so helpful with our questions, thank you! About a block away we had a great breakfast at Stanley, great food, great service! It was our second time to New Orleans and it was a fabulous one!

Reviews.Title: “Location hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: cdun74
Reviews.Content: Location is hard to beat, right on Jackson Square. Nice courtyard and small pool. Free breakfast (danishes and the like with coffee). Most rooms have a courtyard view. I do NOT recommend the interior rooms as it's just four brick walls but the courtyard views are very nice. The hotel also has public balcony's that guests can use which overlook the square. The beds are average though and the TV is just a 25" box TV. No LCD but for the price I wouldn't expect that. Overall a pretty nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine's Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: corvette151
Reviews.Content: First off, I wanted to say that we live less than 60 miles from downtown New Orleans and we visit often just to get away for the weekend, and we try to visit different places each visit. Well, this was our first stay that the Place dâ€™Armes but it will not be our last. The hotel itself is a beautiful historic building, and the rooms are quiet and cozy. It is located in a perfect part of the French Quarter. Whether you are wanting a nice romantic weekend like we had, or a few days to cut loose and party, everything is within easy walking distanceâ€¦Royal St, less than 1 block awayâ€¦Jackson Square is adjacent to the hotelâ€¦Decatur St, only 1 blockâ€¦.CafÃ© Du Monde, you got to have coffee and Beignets in the morning, only 1 blockâ€¦.French Market, less than 4 blocksâ€¦and of course Bourbon St, less than 2 blocks away. Donâ€™t let being that close to Bourbon scare you away; once we were ready to call it a night, the hotel was very quiet and comfortable. Now remember, we were in New Orleans for Mardi Gras/Valentineâ€™s Day weekend and our hotel room which had a balcony was still quiet!! The entire staff was extremely friendly and willing to assist in any way possible. We forgot some items in our room, and all I made was one phone call to the front desk and she took care of the rest. She checked with housekeeping to verify they had them, and then sent my information to the Lost and Found Department. Lost and Found called me, and set up everything. It makes your stay much more enjoyable when you know the people around you will go out of their way to insure you have a pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT QUARTER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jazztrumpeter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Place d'Armes over thanksgiving for seven days total and again one night in January. Wonderful location. Right at Jackson Square. Close to the action of Burbon, but far enough away to be real quiet. The courtyard in the middle of the buildings is a wonderful place to relax. We stayed in Jr. Suite (upstairs) and balcony room. Other in our trip stayed in interior room. All three were excellent with exposed brick walls, comfotable beds, and nice light breakfast. Staff was very friendly. Plus you are one block from Cafe d'Monde which is open 24 hours. Please note that ALL hotels in the quarter are old buildings and some are run down. WE DID NOT FIND THIS HOTEL TO BE RUN DOWN. It was well kept. Only complaint is the $25.00 parking, but every hotel we looked at had about the same fee. Highly, highly recommend this place. And be sure to try the Alpine Restaruant just one block away on Chartres St. just across Jackson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: delewis
Reviews.Content: We have been to New Orleans on many occasions, but had never stayed at Place d'Armes. A friend recommended we stay there after they had a pleasurable experience there. We only stayed one night, but we will definitely stay again when we go back to New Orleans. It was by far the best hotel we've ever stayed at in New Orleans. We walked down to Pat O'Brien's and Bourbon street that night and walked to Cafe du Monde and shops in the quarter the next morning. It was so nice to be so close to everything. The room was quaint and the staff was very friendly. A must stay if you go to New Orleans, especially if you want the full experience of being in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Marykw
Reviews.Content: We were directed to stay at this hotel by a gal at the Louisiana Visitor Welcome Center, and although we had said we would never stay downtown in the French Quarters, this is where we ended up. It was relatively easy to find, has it's own parking with drive-in right next to the main entrance, and is everything one would expect to find in this area. The room we had opened onto Chartles and St. Anne Street, was delightfully decorated with old antique style furnishings, had a garden tub with gold fixtures in our two-room bathroom, and was at the end of a walkway through a couple different interior courtyards. Even though the weather was not the best this year for Mardi Gras, the stay was great. It is an easy walk past shops and pubs to the Cafe du Monde, a couple blocks to walk to Pat O'Briens pub, and right in the middle of the history and sights of the district. We loved our stay, and recommend everyone give this hotel a try if you want to really get a New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “if you look for French / European atmospheare”
Reviews.Author: AgnieszkaN
Reviews.Content: If you look for French / European atmospheare in the continental U.S. then stay in Place d'Armes Hotel in French Quarter. The best croissants for breakfast I've ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ghoulies
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several historic hotels in the French Quarter, but the Place D Arms is by far the best one we have stayed in. We flew in on 2/4 from Dallas and arrived around 9:45 a.m. it was cool and raining and we were not supposed to be able to check in until 4:00 p.m., but they took our cell phone number and called us at 12:00 noon and said that our room was ready. The front desk staff and the bellman are very friendly and helpful.....just excellent staff members. Our room was very very charming, clean and comfortable. I think we have found our "home away from home" from now one when we visit New Orleans. Could not have had a better experience!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm”
Reviews.Author: timfullen
Reviews.Content: When you think of New Orleans you think of tropical courtyards, old buildings, the French Quarter, and good food. This place is all of that or within walking distance of whatever you could possible need or want. The place is a combination of like 5 buildings, but all rooms seem to be charming. The front desk is helpful but its best if you make your own choices about fun and food considering there are like 200 within a mile. Make sure you try the local Abita beer, very good and fairly cheap. Also go to Johnny's for lunch, kind of cheap and has every sandwich you could ever desire. If this is your first time to NOLA please understand it smells and everything is not perfect but has more culture and history than almost any place in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character, excellent location, great value, but not exactly luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: Interdisciplinary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in authentic townhouses just off Jackson square, one block from Cafe du Monde. A generic hotel building just wouldn't have been the same in such a rich architectural place as the French Quarter. The continental breakfast was a nice touch. The room could have used a good scrubbing and carpet cleaning, but the cleaning staff did a good job of day-to-day cleaning service. It definitely was not luxurious, but we stayed in the cheapest rooms they had. A better type of room probably would have been nicer, though.

Reviews.Title: “This location makes the room worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: marimari812
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the french quarter. I happened to be lucky enough to get room 222. It is super BIG! It is a courtyard room on the second floor with a living/kitchen area, 2 king beds and a huge bathroom. Old ...yes...but everything in New Orleans is old. I wouldnt call it outdated by any means...Very nice room. My mom and my little grandson had an interior room with no windows and it was even nice. The pool was great . Our valet guy even ran across the street for us and brought us some cold beer to drink by the pool. The location cant be beat...when you walk out the front door you are practically at jackson square. I will be leaving Indiana in the morning to head back down to the quarter....I have booked room 222 Again !!! (Jan 26, 2010)

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Makes New Orleans seem OLD World again”
Reviews.Author: rabroussard
Reviews.Content: From the old creaky staircases to the elegant rooms with real brass keys, there is a feel in the courtyards and halls of this hotel that brings back old memories of a south long forgotten. It is truly a step back in time

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer care, malfunctioning utilities”
Reviews.Author: review1994
Reviews.Content: we booked the room from one of these online services(ends up not being much cheaper than booking directly with the hotel after all the fees are tacked on), we didn't get the type bed we wanted or reserved when we finally checked in, and the clerk said there was no guarantee(even though it was pre-paid), plus the room had a heater that was so loud it vibrated the entire wall. So they gave us a different room the second night which was ok, and since we didn't pay for it in advance they wouldn't let us stay there our third night, as it was booked by someone else. doesn't make sense since we paid in advance for our first room, and basically got the schleppiest broken down room they had. So we went to the holiday Inn in the french quarter instead and it was much better. what a headache the Place d' Armes was! it is not a 5 star hotel by any means, you have to kiss [--] with the staff to get anything done, as they always know they will have business from unsuspecting tourists in the french 1/4.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint French Quarter Lodging - lacks late-night service”
Reviews.Author: CalifRef
Reviews.Content: This French Quarter hotel, located 2 blocks off Bourbon St., should only be used by people partying in the Quarter, and staying out late. It can be noisy early in the morning with late-nighters coming in & the cleaning staff starting their day. You're right in the middle of the Quarter, so there's constant music/sirens/traffic. The front desk is staffed all night, but seem to only care about checking guest in or out; they weren't quick at check-out, and didn't call for a requested taxi until we were fully checked-out, even though I requested the taxi 30 minutes prior. They command an above-average rate, but don't quite supply what you expect at that price - the TVs are old & unadjusted, the heat/AC is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Place d'Armes!”
Reviews.Author: aceary
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for Voodoo Music Fest a few years ago. We had a great time! Place d'Armes is located right around the corner from Jackson Square on St. Ann St. It is in walking distance to seemingly everything in the French Quarter! The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful, they suggested lots of restaurants that we loved. The court yard area is really beautiful. You do have to pay to park your car here though, and accessing it after it is parked (by the staff) can be a hassle. Our room was nice and clean. It was rather small though, with no windows. We did have an interesting experience here though. Just for fun, we went on a Haunted History Tour of the area. Guess what was one of the stops? Place d'Armes Hotel! Apparently, it is not uncommon to hear "children" running in the halls or laughing. We also heard that the "children" like to move things around in the rooms. My fiance and I were woken several times on the first night from the sound of glasses banging together (this was before we knew the "haunted history" behind the hotel). Do not be afraid though, from what we hear, the minor hauntings make this a popular tourist destination! All in all, we loved the hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: Daffodilly
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for NYE. The rooms are fine, slightly dated and bit fusty. We had a suite on the courtyard and were not bothered by noise (but it was winter). The location is very convenient and hotel staff were very pleasant. No big wait for the car, everyone very friendly. If you get a great rate and anything but an interior room you will be fine. The garden and patio areas are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “For the right price, an excellent deal.”
Reviews.Author: Paul-SArlington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in mid-December for four very rainy days and nites. Notwithstanding the rain, we liked the accommodations and would return. They got 25 inches of rain in December setting a record for the most rain in any month ever. But thatâ€™s another story! The biggest assets of this hotel are its charm, its staff, its location, and most importantly, its low rates, compared to other hotels in the Quarter. The hotel is just a half a block from Jackson Square and one block from Bourbon Street. We booked a deluxe room at $62/nite â€“ not including the healthy 13% local tax. With the deluxe you get either a courtyard room or one facing the street, depending on availability. Because it was very low season we figured we had a good shot at a courtyard room; unfortunately we figured wrong! We ended up with a room on the ground floor but facing the street. In hindsight it probably would have been better to have just paid the few extra bucks to guarantee a courtyard room since it is quiet and peaceful back there. We were first sent to a room on the fifth floor that was dark and small with one small window. Reluctantly, I went back down to the front desk and asked to see a different room. Courtney at the front desk was very accommodating. Lucky for us, the one remaining deluxe room was much, much better. The room (#129) was bigger, the bathroom was much bigger, and the room was much brighter with huge windows. The room also had a 12-foot ceiling which made it feel bigger than it was. The room faced a relatively quiet side street, but trucks did occasionally rumble thru. In general, a very nice room. Having said that I do have one significant complaint about the room: Water in the shower did not drain properly. I do not know whether this is an issue in other rooms, but management should take note as this is never pleasant for hotel guests. A smaller complaint is that the wireless internet was not available for any of the days we were there either. To their credit, we were warned of the internet issue at check in. [I had actually called the hotel before our visit (trying to decide whether to bring my laptop) and was told that our room included internet access, but that not all rooms do. The hotel website seems to indicate something different, so not really sure what is correct.] The hotel breakfast was better than expected based on what I had read here. Even though they donâ€™t have a big selection at all, the croissants and pastries were extremely fresh and good and you can have as much as you want. The OJ was fresh too and there are some very nice attendants who work in the breakfast area and keep it fully stocked. Complimentary newspapers were also available at breakfast. Maid service was also very good, they give you plenty of extra towels and toiletries. They also made our room up when we left the room late one day and even left towels in a plastic bag hanging from our door one day when we did not leave the room. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. Dionne went out of her way to help us with restaurant recommendations and directions and was always very pleasant. We had two excellent breakfasts outside the hotel. Right down the street is Stanley. They have excellent pancakes, served all day, and one serving is just about enough for two people. My wife also loved the reuben there. For a truly authentic Nawlins experience ride the Charles St. street car out to the Camellia Grill. It takes about 25 minutes on the streetcar and youâ€™ll need to ask the driver where to get off, but itâ€™s worth the trip. Just make sure you go on a day or a time that it (hopefully) wonâ€™t be too busy. There are only about 20 seats in the entire place; youâ€™ll never forget the experience. The vegetable omelet was one of the best omelets Iâ€™ve ever had. We also tried the Old Coffee Pot on St. Peters St. around the corner from the hotel and it was worth a try. We didnâ€™t have as much luck at dinner. Deannieâ€™s and Cochon were both good. We thought the Gumbo Shop, around the corner also on St. Peters, was overpriced and couldâ€™ve been better. CafÃ© DuMond is also very close, maybe 100 yards from the front door of the hotel. The beignets were fine, although it is a tourist trap. With all the rain, we tried the Insectarium and it was actually much better than expected. We also had a cab driver take us on a tour thru the lower 9th ward - where the levee failed during Hurricane Katrina. (We arranged this on our ride in from the airport.) This was cheaper and quicker than taking the formal 3-hour tour that we had originally planned. It was $35 for a one-hour tour. It was an interesting way to spend a rainy afternoon. Sadly, some of the abandoned houses are still there, but there are also some brand new, futuristic-looking solar houses too. You may even see Brad Pitt (we didnâ€™t)! The hotel does not have the weather channel or any national cable news channels (cnn, fox, msnbc). When we landed in Baltimore, the Blizzard of â€˜09 was just starting, literally. We had no idea without national channels. The local channels never mentioned what was going on elsewhere so it wouldâ€™ve been nice to have had at least one cable news channel. In general, the hotel is worth it for its uniqueness and excellent location, but only if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot, but it was noisy”
Reviews.Author: somamoons
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean Very affordable ($69 night prepaid) Pretty premises Centrally located Friendly staff Cons: - Noisy - we had a ground level room on Chartres street. We were occasionally awoken by (drunk) people passing by at 2am. The Saints also played in town while we were there - that was not a quiet night by any means!! - Mediocre breakfast - the valet scratched our rental car in at least 2 places

Reviews.Title: “An interesting stay”
Reviews.Author: sunnyusa
Reviews.Content: We visited the French Quarter for the Christmas New Orleans Style events. There was a conference in town during the first half of our stay and we encountered some difficulty getting a room. I had considered staying at the Place D Armes a number of times and they had availability. It was also close to the Saint Louis Cathedral where we planned on attending some Christmas events. The hotel has 8 buildings. Our room was in a building at the back of the hotel. Some building have elevators. Ours did not. We were glad we had help getting our luggage up the steep narrow stairs to the second floor. The hotel has a number of small courtyards and our room overlooked one of them. We've stayed at a number of 100 to 200 year old hotels in the French Quarter. Therefore we were prepared for some eccentricities. For instance the floor in our room was not level or flat. Therefore it felt like you were about to lose your balance as you walked across the room. The coffee machine was located on top of the desk. However the machine had a three prong electrical cord that couldn't be plugged into the extension at the desk. The bathroom was very small. It rained very hard the first night we were there. In the morning there was a small area around the bed that was wet and there were some water stains on the wall. In addition to that the heater stopped working at night. It should also be noted the room didn't have a microwave. We mentioned the water leak and the inoperative heater to management the next day. They wasted no time in getting the heater to work. We asked the person at the front desk about that day's events in the French Quarter. Perhaps because he was slow to answer two other employees management immediately came to our aid. I also asked if they could show me how to fix the heater in case it stopped working again. They had someone waiting for me at the room before I could walk back there. A continental breakfast was included. This consisted of pastries, coffee, tea and juice. There was someone present during the breakfast at all times that made sure you didn't run out of the offerings. Due to the lack of fresh fruit or a toaster for bread we elected to have go out for breakfast a number of times. In summary, the hotel was located in the perfect spot for our visit. The hotel staff was very helpful. It it weren't for the weather we would have liked to have spent some time having coffee in one of their the courtyards while planning the day. Please note that with 8 buildings it is possible that many of the rooms are distinct. Would we stay at the Place D Armes again? We probably would. However we would ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Lush surroundings and southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dutchbeagles
Reviews.Content: Our room was located on the bottom floor just feet from one of the many lush, well maintained gardens. Every morning I walked 10 steps to the patio, sat with a hot coffee (provided by the hotel) and read the paper. This property is so sweet with walled gardens, plantings, fountains and a pool that if room service had been available I would have no need to leave. The staff was very helpful during the worst flooding NOLA had seen in over 50 years. Our room was simply appointed, clean and located in the rear of the property. This hotel is a real gem and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Get a courtyard room. Also, it's a no frills place.”
Reviews.Author: Miami87
Reviews.Content: This was one of the less expensive hotels in NOLA. pros: location. Super close to everything. Excellent coffee in the morning We asked for early check in and it was no problem Cons: cheap sheets. Hard bed Cheap, hard pillows Dark rooms Unfriendly staff Get a courtyard room--it's quieter. We had a balacony room that faced St Anne and it was soooooo loud. Everynight we heard the commercial dumpsters being emptied. This is a no frills hotel. It has not jumped on the luxury for everyone wagon. It provides basic staples at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Out with the old-In with the new”
Reviews.Author: pizota13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet and the location was phenomenol; however, our room smelled really old and musty. The matress had to be very old due the fact that springs were in my back the entire time. The front counter staff was not that friendly and I had to wait for the lone valet guy for over 10 minutes to get our car. we paid 71$ for this room, but we did stay here on a Monday night. They advertise free continental breakfast, but I would more call it free coffee and croissants, because that is what it was. Our room did not have a window. I did know this upon making my reservation. My advice is to pay the extra 20$ and stay somewhere else or preview your room first. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans gem”
Reviews.Author: rolltidebama2000
Reviews.Content: Took my two sons (7 and 9) and wife to see the Saints play the Cowboys. As far as the perfect place to visit the French Quarter with kids go this is the perfect place. Located right outside Jackson Square, we could shop until the kids got bored and then walk back to the room to unload and rest. Just like Jackson Square its central to everything in the quarter. And you have easy access in and out. We had no problems and it was a crowded weekend. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard with a pool (obvious too cold to swim) but it would be an awesome place to hunker down during the warm months. Room was about what you expect in New Orleans. We had plenty of room with King bed and queen pullout. We didn't spend a lot of time in it. The staff was friendly and courteous. We loved the trip and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: GrampaRick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 days in December of '09 and found this hotel to be a great value. It is extremely convenient to everything in the French Quarter and clean. Being an old building we were surprised at how kept up it is. Staff are very helpful and friendly. The limited breakfast is sufficient to get you started for the day. The coffee in the rooms is terrible so make the trip to the coffee room first thing in the morning. The only negative would be that our room was advertised as having a street view but, being located on the fourth floor, the roof over the balcony on the third floor completely blocked our view of the street. When booking a room be sure and know where you are located, the website description isn't as accurate as it should be. We will return though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but way overpriced for such a crummy room.”
Reviews.Author: averagetravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel is that it about this hotel are the location which is right between Jackson Square and Bourbon Street and that it was clean. However, for $230 a night I expected a nice bed, TV, light etc. I havenâ€™t stayed anywhere else in New Orleans, so I donâ€™t know how it compares to other hotels in the area price and quality wise, but I can tell you that Iâ€™m used to spending $70-100 a night and getting a much nicer room. First off, the lock on the door is key only and there is no key for the deadbolt. When I entered my room it had no windows and had a low ceiling. We turned on all three lights in the room but it was still so dark that it would be hard to read or really see what youâ€™re doing when youâ€™re packing your bag etc. The desk was old and scratched, and the TV and alarm clock were at least 15 years old. The TV was 15â€� CRT with a faded picture. The bathroom was also dimly lit and the faucets make a train whistle sound when you turn them on. Where was my wife supposed to put her make-up on? Are we supposed to travel with flashlights when we go to a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: gigimichigan2
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. It was convenient and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and cozy. We had no idea about the history of the place and indeed had some paranormal visitors in the wee hours of the morning who moved some objects and could be heard walking around the room. Caught a photo of the face of man in the mirror next to my bed. Freaked me out pretty good, but I would love to go back

Reviews.Title: “Our Annual New Orleans Trip and Hotel Stay at the Place D' Armes”
Reviews.Author: LSUgreat
Reviews.Content: This is the very first time that we are writing a review on the Place D'Armes...but, we have been going to New Orleans for the first week of December for the past 4 years and have been staying at the Place D'Armes each time we have went. We at first chose The Place D'Armes because of location and price. What better location can one have....right in the middle of Jackson Square? You are 2 blocks from Bourbon Street, just on the other side of the St Louis Cathedral is Pat O'Briens, and one block down is Cafe Du Monde and the ever famous French Market. So, as you can see, you are right smack in the middle of it all!!!! One of the other very pleasent items we encountered was the hotel staff and the GM (Mr. "Bubby" Valentino). The hotel staff is very friendly and will make sure to geaux out of the way to make your stay simply out of this world. It is very nice to have the experience of having the hotel staff, as you enter the hotel upon arrival, smile at you, and ask, "How may we help you". Each time we have stayed, we have asked various hotel staff members for restaurant suggestions and they have been just "spot on" for what we were looking for. One time my wife and I were in a food discussion with the front end staff and the GM, Mr. Valentino, came out of his office (after overhearing the discussion) and gave us a few suggestions as well. One very nice surprise was that the hotel also provides you a "free" breakfast to help you start out your day. It is just a wonderful idea to start out your day by stopping by, having either a fruit filled pastry or a croissant w/jelly, a fresh brewed cup of coffee and orange juice, and being able to read the morning paper. Another one of the items that we simply adore about staying at The Place D' Armes is the history of the buildings and the way that the Valentino's have kept the hotel in that old world style and charm. I learned about the history of the hotel from one of the very old hotel staff members and from Mr. Valentino himself. The building was first used as a slave trade building. You can actually stay in one of thier Junior Suite rooms, which was the actual room where the slaves were kept. The room still has the steel bars over the window...and there is even a part of the wall, by the door, where the slaves carved out to show what part of Africa where they were taken from. After the slave trade was abolished, it was then turned into the very first school (all boys) and stayed the school until one of the boys started a fire in his dorm room and burned most of the school living quarters down. The building was then rebuilt and made into a ware house building. Then it was purchased and made into a hotel (why not, the rooms were already there because of the design of the school and the dorm rooms). The room that my wife and I enjoy to stay in, room 122, was actually the room provided to the "Head Master" of the school. The room has a king-size bed, full bath, a wet bar set-up, and is right in the back of the courtyard, on the first floor of the old dormitory area. The only thing that we ask is that you DO NOT request our room on the very first weekend of December...besides, I think that Mr. Valentino has us booked for that room for next year already! :) Now, on all good reviews, there should always not just be all good items....because there is always something that can be improved upon. This year we did notice that the old matresses have been replaced with new ones (so, our previous years item has been resolved). We still think that paying $28.00 dollars a night is way to high for pareking your car (if you are staying in the hotel)....but, the affordability of the hotel makes up for the extra cost of parking your car. The only last complaint that I can give is that the coffee provided in the room is horriable....LOL....my wife and I always stop by the grocery store (one block away - up Royal Street) and purchase some Community Coffee and filters. Hopefully this will give you a little look into the hotel, the history of the place, and why we will keep going to this hotel every year that we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “read all the reviews - I discovered that most have validity...”
Reviews.Author: paranan
Reviews.Content: Place D'Armes is certainly not the worst hotel...the location is fabulous, the staff is friendly and the courtyard is gorgeous. That's where the good things to say end. The website is VERY misleading as far as "balcony rooms" go. I saw another review in which the reviewer mentioned that she felt lied to because she had to walk out of her room and down the hall to the balcony. Same here. We got one of those same rooms. And then she mentioned that she got switched to a room that had a window that opened up to the balcony...all i can say is that's got to be better than having a room that is adjacent to a balcony that ANYONE in the freaking hotel could access (with a window to said balcony that is directly behind the headboard of the bed). The walls are paper thin. My husband and I were woken up at around 6 am by other vacationers in the next room who we discovered were actually talking at a reasonable volume. There is absolutely NO bathroom privacy. There are two slatted doors and approximately 10 feet separating the toilet from the bed. Not so awesome. The continental breakfast - coffee, oj, water, croissants and some danishes - was mediocre as best. The rooms were pretty shabby. There was a layer of dust on the walls from the ac/ceiling fan. Clearly the walls had not been cleaned in several months. The blanket (not bedspread) had lots of holes (cigarette burns?), the mattress was on beyond firm to "hard." I felt like the room could have easily been broken into - there is a physical key instead of a card and the deadbolt is only able to be engaged when one is in the room. Sunday our rate was $90. Place d'Armes _might_ be worth that...but Sunday our rate was $160 and I feel incredibly ripped off by that.

Reviews.Title: “They have a fanciful idea of what a "Balcony room" is”
Reviews.Author: someplacewarm050
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed the most delightful weekend in New orleans. My only disappointment was when we got to our room at the Place D'Armes I immediatly went to the balcony and discovered that we didn't have a balacony. I had spent two weeks searching for the perfect place to stay with a balacony in New Orleans. There were many hotels that I could have chosen but because the Place D'Arems assured me a balacony, I made my reservation. When I called down to the desk I was informed that the balcony was there I just had to go out the door and down the hall to acces the balcony. Mind you the picture on the internet that was labeled "balcony room" showed a door from the room leading directly to a private balcony. I was very upset and offered a discount on the room and was assured that as soon as a true balcony room opened up, we would be moved. We were moved two days later and found that a balcony room does not include a door but a Window to climb through. Our room was wonderful, the pool was great, the location was the best but I don't like being lied too.

Reviews.Title: “Returning Visitor”
Reviews.Author: ruebourbon3
Reviews.Content: Place D Armes has been a home away from home each time I am in New Orleans. Location is great and a real New Oleans feel. Only draw back is, parking rate is high with no discounts the longer you stay and beware of the bedding, like sleeping on a board. I would recommend this hotel but just be ware..........

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the hotel; garden lovely, people-concierge very helpful, location perfect, and excellent coffee in the breakfast rm”
Reviews.Author: suzyktexas
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Place d'Armes for approx 15 yrs; it is my bday present and we go every yr. As I have been in love w/New Orleans for many yrs, I have a ball walking & taking pix. My husband thoroly enjoys sitting on the balcony of our rm and watching the world go by. Altho we miss very much Miss Pat, the concierge who is gone every Aug, we have found ALL the employees extremely helpful to assist you in any way. Neither of us prefer a larger more contemporary hotel; this one has a great deal of charm which this incredible city exudes. We look forward to our return in 2010 are thinking seriously about Christmas this yr too. sue kubecka

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paradise right in the "heart" of the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandHeather1028
Reviews.Content: If you and your partner are looking for the perfectly romantic place in the French Quarter, then this hotel is the ticket. It's centrally located to most anything anyone would want to see or do - most importantly, the courtyard is indescribable and the most integral part of the romance and intrigue of this hotel - not to mention the history behind the several buildings that makeup the hotel (be sure to ask "Bubby" about it). The general manager (Bubby) and his staff are absolutely excellent at making sure your stay is perfect. We were married in the courtyard and will NEVER forget he experience! The prices are fantastic, considering what other surrounding hotels in the French Quarter charge. Sure...the fancy, well known hotels of the French Quarter are very nice, but my wife and I find that lots of marble and brass and mirrors are a little on the "cold" side; in contrast, the lush foliage - especially the two magnolia trees, which are over 100 years old - make the courtyard of Place d'Armes so romantic and captivating that it's worth staying there JUST to see it, but the rooms are each so unique and perfectly appointed that you won't ever want to leave! We had the opportunity to stay in three totally different rooms and loved each one of them for different reasons. There are many balconies facing the courtyard, as well as one facing Chartres Street, which gives you a spectacular, juxtaposed view of the St. Louis Cathedral and Jackson Square. You CANNOT ask for a better location or a better place to spend a romantic time with your "special" person. Do yourself a favor...book a weekend NOW! and see for yourself - you'll not regret it! And be sure to ask for the general manager; he is absolutely the most warm and personable man I've met in the hotel business, and he'll give you some historical "tidbits" that will leave you hungry for more!

Reviews.Title: “Should not be your first choice in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: risagirl23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an interior room located on the fourth floor. The room was clean, but that was about the only positive thing I can say about it. The TV was not working properly with most channels having a green tint, the clock radio was flashing the incorrect time when we arrived and I had to fix it myself, there was no safe in the room, the sink made the most horrible screeching sound the entire time the hot water ran, the walls were paper thin and we could hear the man coughing who was staying in the room adjacent to us as well as the couple above us having sex, and when people walked by in the hallway you could hear their conversations and everything they were saying as if your door were wide open. I knew that this particular room did not have windows, but after two days, this started to feel very claustrophobic and made it hard to wake up in the morning due to the lack of any natural light at all. The courtyard was the main reason I booked this hotel and planned on spending a lot of time relaxing there, however, this was not possible. There were mosquitoes everywhere and we received at least five bites on various parts of our bodies. These mosquitoes were so aggressive that they even bit through clothing! It was too cool to swim, but no one maintained the pool, not even for aesthetic purposes; there were leaves and debris floating in it the entire four days we were there. The vending machines were the only place in the hotel for you to get water, and it was hit or miss whether they worked or not. We had to tell the front desk on two occasions that the machine had taken our money without returning a bottle and she laughed about it and said it was a testy machine (but refunded the money immediately). At $197 a night, we could have and should have done much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Crasso
Reviews.Content: After being very dissapointed in the French Market Inn 5 years ago when we visited NOLA, we were hesitant to book another similar hotel. We actually had reservations at the Hilton but decided to cancel them and try Place d'Arms based on the good reviews. We are very happy we made the decision we did. The rooms were large , clean and quiet. Our room had a balcony outside of our windows right on Chartres overlooking Jackson Square to the right. The courtyard was beautiful with all the fountains, statues and plants. The continental breakfast was small but the coffee was great. Staff was very helpful and courteous. EVERYTHING is in walking distance. Cafe Du Maude is one block away so I could walk there and bring some coffee back before we really got the day started. Price was more than fair for what we got. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NOLA. It's so much better than a national chain!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel well in advance and took advantage of the saver price direct from the hotel but you can not cancel or amend your booking. We were given a larger room than I had booked which was a bonus. The standard of the room was excellent with free wi-fi and a large bath tub. The hotel is very clean and in a brilliant location. The only downside was the breakfast. All they had was cheap orange juice and croissants or sticky buns / cakes. If they could improve on this, it would be a wonderful place. I would still recommend this hotel though. Parking is very expensive here, look around we managed to park for $10 for 24 hours nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kozzer15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place D'Armes in early September for 3 nights. Our room was above the main reception with its own balcony and t looked out onto St Ann Street. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable, the maid service was daily and they did a good job leaving clean towles every day even when we didn't need them. The bath was small in lenght and depth but as we showered it was irrelevant. The hotel do offer a free continental breakfast but we did not try it as we prefer to go out and about to find somewhere local to eat. The courtyard area was pleasant and quiet, the pool is quite small but looked nice although we did not use it as we spent all our time enjoying the city. The hotel is in a superb location minutes walk from Bourbon Street and Jackson Square, we heard no noise on an evening from Bourbon Street. The only slight drawback was the valet parking which was $25 per night, however I do not know the area and would not know where else to park so would rather know my car was safe although I would have preffered to have payed less! I would recommend this hotel, the room was great, the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful complement to the French Quarter experience!”
Reviews.Author: WilsonMace
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Place d"Armes in October 2009. The entire stay was simply superb. Being a history buff, I enjoyed the old world appeal of the architecture and the presentation of the property in general. This hotel is certainly NOT your "cookie cutter" variety of hotel which can be found in practically every city on the planet. The Place d"Armes IS PART OF the French Quarter and not just a hotel in the French Quarter. The location was perfect (within easy walking distance of every site in the French Quarter); the staff was courteous and helpful; my vehicle was keep safe and secure; the room was clean and well furnished; And, even though the hotel is surrounded by the atmosphere of the Quarter, the room in which we stayed was quiet and peaceful. This was my first stay at the Place d"Armes, but it will not be my last. I plan on staying at this hotel everytime I have opportunity to visit New Orleans. If you are looking for a standard "run of the mill" hotel which can be found anywhere and has no unique attachment to where it is located, don't stay here. BUT, if you would like your hotel to actually be a part of the pleasant memories you take away with you after your visit to the French Quarter, STAY AT THE PLACE d"ARMES!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, service and location put it over the top.”
Reviews.Author: zasu09
Reviews.Content: We are in New Orleans almost every year and have stayed at this hotel many times. Since Katrina there has been a definite improvement in service and the kudos go to lyn Castenada the new manager. Calm, efficiant and friendly attitude from everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! No Complaintd at all”
Reviews.Author: readyforavacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Place d'Armes for 5 nights. 3rd time to New Orleans but first time at this hotel. It was perfect. The location is great. Close to all the action but still very quiet at night. The pool was much appreciated to cool off after sightseeing. Frenchmen Street was within walking distance. I love the old world feel to the hotel and our room was very clean. We had a King room with shared balcony and enjoyed sitting out there in the morning or evening, do some people watching and listen to musicians in Jackson Square. Breakfast was simple but good. Nice to be able to get a coffee/danish before heading out for the day. The staff was excellent, in particular Stewart, who recommened a number of places to eat, all of which were great! Everyone there greeted us with a smile and answered any questions we had. I wouldn't hesitiate to recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: honesty900
Reviews.Content: It's been a few months but if I remember rightly we got room 126. It's at the very back corner of the hotel complex, on the ground floor. It was damp and dingy. My travel partner may have got bed bugs. We stayed there for 2 nights in this room and then insisted on being changed to another room. We got a balcony room on the first floor which was lovely. Should have asked for a change of room immedoately so be sure to do the same. As for breakfast, typical US style breakfast - cheap orange juice, bland croisants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_lover055
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I just got back from NO and stayed 3 nights in the Place D'Armes. The only negative I would give our stay was the $25.00 a day fee for valet parking plus another $3.00 tax on that each day. However, since we wanted to stay in the French Quarter, it turned out to be the most practical way to park our car. There were other lots several blocks away, but there was no assurance that they would be any cheaper for 24 hour parking. The hotel's location was great - the Haunted History Tour and the Cemetary tour both met just a few blocks away. We found out on the Haunted History tour on the last night of our stay that this hotel has had several paranormal sightings over the years. However, we both found the room to be quiet and comfortable (except an occasional noise from old plumbing) The continental breakfast was just croissants and danish, but they were very fresh and tasty. The coffee provided in room was exceptionally good (with the liquid coffee mate I brought from home) I never got around to actually trying the beignets at Cafe du Monde which is just down the block. HERE IS A TIP: If you take the cemetary tour at 1:15, DO take a umbrella especially if it is sunny. The Vaults in the St Louis No 1 cemetary white washed and reflect the heat. I am from Tennessee and thought I was used to the heat, but I almost passed out. I wish I had followed this recommendation. Cafe Pontalba on Jackson Square has wonderful food - I tried the Crawfish Etoffee on the walitress' recommendation - Very Good! Also, if you can get out of the city, go to Destrehan plantation. It's right off of 310, a quick trip out and is gorgeous. Oak Alley is a bit farther out and it is even more beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Old New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: okieinbama
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed in the Quarter before, although I've been to NOLA several times. I loved the experience. The courtyard and pool were quaint and proved to be the perfect place to sit and relax off of the busy streets. We stayed in an interior room with a door off of the courtyard. The room proved to be much larger than we anticipated, although some of the furnishings were older, and the bed was a little hard. It all seemed to be part of the genuine Old New Orleans feel though, and we loved it. The internet service worked great, and the people at the front desk were decent. We asked them for various recommendations and to have a cab called and were treated well, although not great. The guy who carried our luggage was wonderful, though, telling us all the places we needed to visit and truly making us feel welcome. Off-street parking is nice in the Quarter, and they have discounted rates for guests--although it's not included. It was cheaper than I have paid for parking in the CBD. The location can't be beat. The hotel itself was clean, as were the rooms. We enjoyed it thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Lots of Charm”
Reviews.Author: ctlw14
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to spend a long weekend in New Orleans to catch up. We chose this hotel because of it's good reviews here, it's affordable price, and it's amazing location. We arrived on a Friday morning and we able to store our bags while we wandered around town. We had a double room with a window, but no balcony. It over looked the street and we had a great view of the Cathedral. We were able to walk EVERYWHERE we wanted to go in the city from here. The nice part is that it's so central to all the stores, restaurants, tours, Jackson square, etc. but it's not noisy or crazy at all. Our room was beautiful, lots of old style charm (although I'm fairly convinced it's haunted, I've heard rumors). They provided breakfast each day, but we usually chose to go to Cafe Du Monde instead. For the value, you can't find a better hotel in town. I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Louisiana!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rniaGirl82
Reviews.Content: You couldn't beat the location and the price! The hotel was in the middle of the French Quarter, so walking to all our New Orleans destinations was easy. We had an easy walk to public transportation, including the street cars. The company we took our swamp tour with picked us up at the hotel, as did the rental car agency when we rented a car for the day to tour some plantations. All in all, it was a very easy city to get around in without having a car for the whole trip. The price, $79.00 for all days except Friday, couldn't be beat! The courtyard area was charming- a great place to just relax and read a book during the late afternoon before heading out for the evening again. The pool was small but clean and well kept. The choice of restaurants in the city was outstanding, and the people at all of the places both in and outside of New Orleans that we went to were very friendly. Some of our favorite restaurants were Mulate's (great Zydeco music and dancing), Cafe Dumond, The Court of Two Sisters. We even learned how to eat crawfish, which is not a skill most Californians possess!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back/Closest to Cafe Du Monde and Jackson Square”
Reviews.Author: SF2MOGirl83
Reviews.Content: From the moment I got on my airport shuttle I heard great things about this hotel. The driver who had lived in N.O. his whole life said it was a great place to stay because it wasn't directly on Bourbon Street, but close to it. It looks basic from the curb but I loved all the flags representing the countries of the guests and the old lanterns that burn throughout the night. I had only reserved a basic room but when I told the front desk clerk it was my first time in N.O. and I was alone until my friends met me the next day...she most definitely decided to take care of me and placed me in a balcony room. Which it seemed online was a higher charge for the night, and after talking to my neighbors on said balcony...it was confirmed they had paid $50+ more for their room than I did for mine! (I even booked for under $100 before taxes) The room was decorated with an old french country feel...I imagine like most non-chain hotels in N.O. But I liked the decor. The bathroom was a little out of date but not in anyway the worst I have seen. The room had a king bed, armoire with TV and some storage drawers, small table and two chairs. There was a small closet as well. The balcony was a dream come true. It was amazing to enjoy a sunset before dinner and hear all the sounds of Jackson Square and Bourbon Street in the distance. In the morning you can walk up to Cafe Du Monde since it is literally half a block from the hotel and enjoy beignets on the balcony...or enjoy the free breakfast in the wonderful historic little cafe off the lobby. I spent my post breakfast/pre check out time in the goregous Southern courtyard, book in hand, feet in the pool. When I come back to N.O. I will for sure check the rates for the Place D'Armes and might even spring full price to get the balcony room again...it was exactly what I wanted for my first New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good but a great location”
Reviews.Author: NYfuncouple
Reviews.Content: Can not agree more with the previous review; aside from the location, I can not say anything good about the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 3:35 PM on Thursday, September 02. The staff at the front desk was counting money; it took about 3 minutes before they finally looked at us. "Last name?" - that was the first phrase we heard. No welcoming, no "HI", no smile. After I provided the information, the next thing was "His name?". His name was not of a dog, but of my partner standing next to me. Never mind that she could have asked him directly; for some reason she decided not to and stick to her prison-like questions. Finally, after taking his information, she said - " The check- in time is 4 PM, you are too early and you room is not ready" . She asked me to leave my phone number and said that she would call when they room is ready. She did not offer to us to wait at the court yard, or in the dining room, to read a paper, etc. We went for a walk in the FQ. By 5 PM, not hearing back from the hotel, we went back. The room was ready. Even though I made my fully prepaid reservation in January and specifically asked for a courtyard room ( and confirmed my request at least 3 times), I did not get what I requested. I am not complaining about the room because I knew from the friends (who stayed there before ) that the rooms are a bit outdated. But there were dead plants on the balcony and the pots were being used as garbage cans. Judging by the amount of garbage,I don't think they were ever cleaned. In 3 days of our stay we never heard a word of greetings from the front desk staff. One day I asked people by the pool about their experience, and it turned out that they all had the same treatment. There was actually one front desk person who made a point of turning away when you looked at her. Since our flight was at 6 AM, we asked for a wake up call. The person who took our request ( the same slim lady that would tun away) sighed as if I asked her to carry us to the airport on her back. No wonder that the wake up call neve happened. Luckily we had called the car service in advance and the driver woke us up. The person who was at the front desk at that moment was actually very apologetic to us and very friendly ( may be that's why they keep her at night?) Not sure how the hotel made top 10 - once again, aside from the location, there is nothing going for it. The breakast is very basic ( the breakfast serving staff was very nice, I have to mention). But the rooms are very outdated and in need of repair ( once again, something we knew and expected - so no complain about that). But the staff rudeness of Place d'Armes was something I never experienced in my 7 years of travel to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever Experienced in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: retro_librarian
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this hotel got to rank #9 in the top 10 hotels in New Orleans. It is in a great location, but that is about the only good thing about this hotel. Inhospitable staff behind desk, which is rare in New Orleans! Very disappointing! It was our first (and last) stay at this hotel. We should have been informed about things like the time and location of breakfast, but were not. A piece of paper with this information would have sufficed. Neither were offered. Our room was dark, musty, noisy, shabbily furnished, and the bed was uncomfortable, and our pillows were lumpy. My husband and I did not sleep very well, because we were itching all night. Could have been due to the poor quality bed linens. I have been visiting New Orleans and staying in the French Quarter for at least 20 years. This is the worst experience that I have ever had. Newlyweds, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Charm”
Reviews.Author: travelapple
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in the perfect location! room was big with window I belive the deluxe room, tucked away in our own hallway, the courtyard and pool area was charming! Enjoyed the feel at the hotel, like old New Orleans! the continental breakfast wasnt much but good coffee and tea to start the day before the real New Orleans food!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Place d Armes”
Reviews.Author: Turquoiseharlem
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of years ago when we got engaged and decided to come back for our 1st anniversary. We love the locaton about this hotel the most. We got your avg. room inside with no window, which is OK for us. We booked well in advance and got our rooms for about $80 a night. The hotel does have other rooms that have windows, suites, courtyard which are simply beautiful. We love that it is quiet and in Jackson Square. Close to everything. You are a couple of blocks from Bourbon, you can walk out and be in Jackson Square, one block from Decauter and Cafe Du Monde. Tons of restaurants and entertainment. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful as well. We love this hotel and would go back again, actually the only place I would stay in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location--Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_mtex
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in late August. This hotel has a wonderful and caring staff and our Courtyard room was roomy and very nice. Hotel price was very attractive, and being just at the corner of Jackson Square, very near the St. Louis cathedral--it's the very heart of the French Quarter. We'll definitely stay there next year if they keep their reasonable prices. Only minor comment is: the pool needs a cosmetic makeover. But, this didn't really bother us--we were too busy combing the streets of the French Quarter and didn't even use the pool. All in all, the Place D'Armes is a Big Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION IN THE QUARTER”
Reviews.Author: chase54
Reviews.Content: When I found out this hotel is owned by the same company who ownes the hotel we stayed at last year I tried to change reserfvation to another hotel. I was suprised and releaved when we got to the hotel. It is clean, other reviews complained about mold in the shower and dirty smelly carpet. I found none of this. The bathroom appeared to have been receintly redone. The ony cmplaint is that the shower rod feel down a couple times. We got a room with no window, which was just fine by me. I don't go to New Orleans to sit in a hotel room looking out a window. There is a continental breakfast, nothing great but it is coffee and juice to get the day started. They have a killer courtyard, with different seating areas. The pool is large and clean. Criss was the door/bell person. He does a fantistic job. Helps people with luggage, packages or anything he can. Opposite to the other hotel where the bell operson never moved from behing their stand. Criss is always anxious to answere questions, give directions or assiste guests with whatever they need. He does a fantistic PR job for the hotel. The only complaint I had is that our room was never cleaned until after 3 or 4 in the afternoon. Thats when I wanted to go back to the hotel and relax befor heading out for the evening. But I could not because the room was not clean. One day they came after 5 pm to clean the room. They did not leave soap or shampoo in the room for several days. The location can not be better, location is on the corner or Jackson Square close to just about everything in the quarter. Over all we had a good experience and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great service...Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: cpass7
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to New Orleans to bring our daughter to Tulane and thought we would take advantage of the trip and stay in the French Quarter. We arrived before noon and our room was not ready, we were referred to a place for a great lunch and they offered to put our bags in the room when it became available.
