When we returned, our bags were brought to the room. Although we booked an interior room, we were not sure what that meant. The room had no windows, which I found to be a bit annoying, but after you come to grips with it, it is not that bad. The room was quiet and the air conditioning was fantastic. The hotel is quite charming and has all of the appeal of the French Quarter, without all of the noise of Bourbon St.! The location could not be better as it is in short walking distance of all the things one wants to see in the Quarter, and just a short stumble back from a night on Bourbon St! The ONLY downside of this hotel is the parking. It has a garage on-site, but all the cars are transported upstairs via an elevator 1 car at a time, and on Saturday night we waited 30 minutes to have our car brought down, which caused us to be late for a reservation. In the future, we know to call ahead...no big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly fabulous, we loved every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: JLWSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for people who love history and the quaintness of the local flavor of their destination. It is in the heart of the French Quarter and within walking distance to many great shops and restaurants. The rooms are lovely and very authentic but still extremely comfortable and modern. The first morning there, I awoke before my family and went downstairs and had coffee and a croissant in the most lush green, serene courtyard next to a fountain. It was so peaceful. The employees at the hotel are very friendly and helpful and I will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A true New Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: karacantrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place D'Armes Hotel for a week to celebrate our anniversary and attend a friend's wedding. The location is absolutely superb! It's mere steps to St. Louis Cathedral, the French Market and Cafe du Monde, Jackson Square, and even Bourbon Street if you're inclined to that sort of experience. Truly in the heart of the French Quarter. Yet, it remained a quiet, serene little respite from the hustle and bustle of the Quarter. Like New Orleans itself, the Place D'Armes Hotel has a rather shabby chic aesthetic. We loved this, but it may not suit everybody. This is not to suggest the hotel isn't clean, but rather that it isn't vanilla or sterile. The lovely hotel courtyard teems with vegetation and lots of small, local wildlife like birds, lizards, dragonflies and the like. Each room is carved out of a series of old town houses and each is unique often featuring exposed brick and strange little nooks with writing desks. The staff are polite and helpful (though some exhibit the New Orleanian brusqueness that has sometimes been compared to a softened version of New York toughness). They were quick to offer sugestions about what to do, see, or eat when asked and always knew directions to anything we needed from grocery stores to nail salons. On top of all that, New Orleans is a traveller's dream. We experienced everything from Bourbon Street carousing to prayers in St. Louis Cathedral to book shopping in the rooms where William Faulkner wrote to food, food, and more food. It was our first time back since the storms and I'm kicking myself for waiting so long.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: heather8983
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here over halloween for our short honeymoon. We loved our room. It just has so much character. We arrived slightly ealry from when check in was and that was no problem for them at all (it was only about a 1/2 hour early). We had an escort to show us where our room was as it was on a the top floor kind of tucked away in a corner. It was kind of nice to be away from the busyness of the halloween feastivities until we were ready to.

Reviews.Title: “A T aste of Nawlins'”
Reviews.Author: bigrgeorgia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with 2 of our grown grand children stayed 2 nights to celebrate one of the kids birthday ( she was also born near New Orleans). This hotel is great if you want to see the French Quarter. It is located a half block from the Quarter and is easy walking to most places we wanted to visit. We had rooms in a dead end courtyard which were private and nice. Rooms were clean and have everthing you need. The staff was very accommodating. Don't miss the fried chicken at Willie Mae's Scotch House on St. Ann. It is billed as"The World's Best Fried Chicken" and it is!

Reviews.Title: “70th birthday present to my mother”
Reviews.Author: gemstone61
Reviews.Content: Over the last 20 years I have stayed in a lot of places in the french quarters. But this time I tried a new place Place d'Armes. I probably have walked by this place a thousand times over the years. I couldn't be happier with my choice! From the time we arrived till the time we left the service we received was great! The rooms were very clean a must! It was close to shopping and the restaurants. The valet parking was great on site I didn't have to walk blocks to park! This will be the place for me to stay again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetatour54
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending three nights at the Place d'Armes in New Orleans. The location can't be beat for convenience. It's in the middle of all things French Quarter. The staff was the friendliest I have ever encountered in New Orleans. Our room was lovely, although a bit small. I peeked into a few others and they all seemed to vary considerably in layout and size. Furnishings were pretty and clean. It was quiet. Some of the prettiest pictures I took of the whole trip were in the Place d'Armes courtyard! I'll be returning as long as the prices stay so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value.”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: It started badly. We arrived at 13h00 and were told in no uncertain terms arrival time was 15h00, and that was that. No attempt was made to see if the room was ready, or to hurry it along. But then this was the approach taken with all the arriving guests, and the front desk attitude was very much take it or leave it! But it got better- the location is superb- near everything in the Quarter- walking distance- and to the waterfront area. The room was really fabulous- beautifully decorated, great balcony, and no noise at night, with Bourbon Street just 2 blocks away. The courtyard was really special, and the place oozes character. Breakfast is as per the other reviews somewhat sparse, but adequate and uncrowded. The hotel has parking which is a big plus, though we didn't use it. I think we paid around $130 a night which is serious good value for what has to be the best located hotel in the Quarter. We'd go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans, Je t'aime!”
Reviews.Author: Pjoseph85
Reviews.Content: Place d'Armes is a gem of the Vieux Carre. Lovely little space, with no noise coming in off the street. Pool's open till 10, and there's a lovely little breakfast put out for guests every morning, consisting of juice, coffee and pastries. Close enough to the best places in the Quarter. We visit New Orleans every summer, and the Place d'Armes is a place we will return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rather dull room.”
Reviews.Author: quiUK
Reviews.Content: When in New Orleans, it's likely you're not going to spend much time in your hotel room, so in that respect the Place D'Armes is ideal - it's location is perfect for the all the major sights in the French Quarter. However, it's only a so-so hotel. Our room was dark and pokey - ok, so it was an internal windowless room (not what we had reserved, but renovations meant our room choice was unavailable and we were reimbursed the difference), however some more lighting would have been welcome. The bathroom was also very small by American standards. Service was only fair, and the complimentary buffet breakfast was passable. Having said all that however, it's a good value place to lay your head in an expensive touristy city so what more can you expect at the price! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: musicwomn9
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel to be close to everything in the quarter. Friendly staff, great rooms and great location. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Attkica
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from NOLA after a 5 day stay. The Place D Armes was such a good experience. It was centrally located and we could always make our way back there to take a break when needed. Cafe Du Monde, Bourbon Street, Pat Obriens, Jackson Square, Johhny's are so close. The room was what we expected, very neat and clean, nothing extravagant. We had a balcony room that overlooked St. Ann it was nice to be out there in the morning and evenings, but the trash trucks were loud in the early morning hours. We enjoyed all of the ammenties that the hotel offered such as the light breakfast ,the beautiful pool, and the entire courtyard. The room always had plenty of towels, soaps and shampoos, and coffee. The entire staff at the hotel was as good or better than any place I have ever stayed. They were courteous and quick to respond to your needs. I applaud their efforts. We will definitely stay there again on our next visit and we will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great to capture the charm of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: GoTigahs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. It captures the charm of the city and is just cute! We all really liked it and would stay again: Pros: LOCATION, friendly staff, charm (this place is New Orleans), the rooms were clean, price, history Cons: thin walls and ceilings/floors (we were on the 2nd floor and heard every movement from the people above us. During the day the cleaning staff would shout down the hall, and at night, people coming in were loud in the halls, our neighbor got up one night and nipped this with one group), the bedding looked worn. The pool was small; but, to be expected. Our kids liked it and the courtyard and thought it was need we were provided KEYS--not "credit cards" to open the doors. Oh, I think parking was around $25/night; but, seemed secure. The breakfast provided was ok; but, in a city like NO, why go all out on breakfast when people like to venture out for food as it is one of the city's attractions! This place was fantastic for us. Next time, I'll just bring ear plugs if we find ourselves in a noisy situation.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the light sleepers!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location which is by far its best amenity. The courtyard and pool area are beautiful (but crowded during our stay). We booked the jr. suite which was a good value for the money with a sitting area, refrigerator and microwave. However, this is one of the noisiest hotels I have ever stayed in. I don't know if it is because it is old or what but the floor squeaks like crazy. We stayed on the second floor and our third floor neighbors did a lot of walking around up there. The squeaking was so loud that it woke both of us many times during the night and in the morning. We basically had to go to sleep when our neighbors went to sleep and wake up when they woke up. The halls are also loud and we could hear all the comings and goings. The bed is a typical hotel bed which is not great but not the worst I've ever had. Overall, a good value and great location but not quite as wonderful as all the other reviewers thought it was!

Reviews.Title: “What great value”
Reviews.Author: kritch
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed At the Place Dâ€™Armes Hotel in July for 4 nights. I booked directly through the hotel and got a great rate of $87 per night. We also booked a room with a balcony. After checking in, we went to our room to find that it was not a balcony room. While clean and very lovely, the room was very small. I went back to the front desk and explained that I had booked a room with a balcony. The woman at the reception was very helpful and explained that while today there were not any rooms available with a balcony, there would be tomorrow and if we wanted to switch we simply had to leave our bags and the porter would move our luggage. Very appreciated. Despite looking over a road, there was no noise or disturbances that night in our room. When we came back from our day out to our new room we were pleasantly surprised that our new room not only had a huge private balcony but our new room was massive. Huge bed and bathroom. The air conditioning is impressive if not somewhat loud. We managed to sleep with it off and just have the fan going. Breakfast was simple croissant and juice. The service was always helpful and courteous and the hotel was beautiful. This is not a fancy hotel but it is very homey and in a safe part of the French quarter. We never once felt unsafe. All the staff were very good, no complaints. Place Dâ€™Armes is a great hotel to stay in if you are visiting the French quarter and are wanting a Nawlins experience. After driving past the big name hotels we realised you definitely miss out on the atmosphere when staying in the generic hotels that you would experience when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: MissLouisianagirl
Reviews.Content: Great little historic hotel. The staff was super friendly! Location is so perfect to wander around the French Quarter! Off street parking garage tended by wonderful attendants! This hotel has a little wear- but the courtyard is fabulous!- perfect example of New Orleans-greenery, brickwork, balconies, great picture settings! I have a bug phobia- rooms were old but clean and no bugs! Would absolutely stay here again! I have visited New Orleans my entire life- this has been the best experience- authentic French Quarter- Everything I hoped for!- I have stayed in more expensive-plusher hotels- but -- I could have been anywhere in the world- cookie cutter--this has been the best stay-- very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: Belladonna82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The staff was very professional and helpful. The interior rooms are small but the are not bad if you are there to enjoy the city, and not spend all your time in the room. I would recommend this hotel for couples more then families with lots of kids.

Reviews.Title: “Would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of everything, and still have a clean and safe stay.”
Reviews.Author: cj2224
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to New Orleans, and the most memorable. This hotel was the best of four different hotels and bed and breakfasts that I have stayed in. We had room 302, which was a balcony room off of the front of the building. It was wonderful! Much more than we had expected it to be. I felt that the price of $95.00 a night was extremely reasonable for a room that had this kind of view, and a hotel that was perfectly placed within walking distance of anywhere you wanted to go in the French Quarter. There are many places within New Orleans that I have not felt safe staying in, but this hotel felt very safe. I also felt that our automobile was parked in a secure spot. We decided to go with this hotel based off of the reviews that we found on this website. I find that these are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Undamaged by Katrina, the Place d'Armes is a gem in the heart of the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Bijoux5
Reviews.Content: Our family has been flying into New Orleans and staying at the Place d'Armes for nearly a decade. We come for the Krewe of Carrollton's Weekend (their parade is the second Sunday before Mardi Gras). No matter what time of the day or night we arrive, we are always warmly greeted as "friends" and made to feel very welcome. Gas lights and wrought iron gates are by the brick entrance and there is a beautifully decorated Mardi Gras tree in the lobby. A daily continental breakfast is served in an airy room that looks out on St. Ann's where the horse drawn buggies clop by and there is a beautiful inner courtyard to have a picnic of muffalettas or Po-Boys in. You can go out on a balcony that's next to Muriel's Restaurant where you can get great photos of the St. Louis Cathedral in Jackson's Square and watch small street parades (like the Krewe of Cork) or hear jazz street musicians. There is at least one haunted hotel room (on the second floor)! The Place d'Armes accepts AAA discounts and is located right in the French Quarter; close to the sweetest pralines (Aunt Sally's), most famous beignets (Cafe Du Monde~~legend has it if you get any powdered sugar on you when eating them, you'll return to NOLA), and best Hurricanes (Pat O'Brien's~~go to the piano room for great entertainment~~try to drink a Magnum with your friends out by the flaming fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Great location - pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: november_moon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location - just off Jackson Square on a quiet side street, easy walking distance to everything in the Quarter. The hotel itself is in some neat old buildings, so lots of charm. We had originally reserved a balcony room, but had to change our dates and no balcony rooms were available for our new dates, so I reserved another type of room. However, when we checked in, I asked if there had been a cancelation and their had been, so they upgraded us to a balcony room no extra charge. That was great. Our room was fine - nothing out of the everyday, but reasonably comfortable, spacious, and everything in working order. The balcony was a big plus though - nice to sit out and watch the people go by, read, have a drink, etc. Breakfast was very basic - coffee, juice, crossants. It would have been nice to have some fruit, other baked goods, maybe some yogurt. The courtyard and pool area is pretty good - nice and shady.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: DeaconCouple
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I visited New Orleans and I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff was friendly and always had a smile or a kind word to offer. The grounds were well kept and the pool was clean and clear every day. Nice fountains, plants, tables with umbrellas and place to just sit and relax. The breakfast was O.K. with the usual items such as pastry, croissants, juice and coffee, but hey... it was free. The room was obviously old, in a good sense; with a beamed ceiling and closed off fireplace. It was clean, had a great air conditioner and no critters. The bathroom was pretty small but I didn't plan on spending my vacation in there! Only downside was that I had to request housekeeping to bring more towels because they didn't automatically do it. (From the time I called, it took less than 10 minutes to have new towels brought to the room!!)The location was fantastic and a ten minute walk in any direction put you to the far ends of the French Quarter. They even held our bags for us after we checked out, because of a late flight back home. A nice gem in the middle of New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: gatorgirl587
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be everythng described on the website. Our room, a double deluxe with a courtyard view, was very comfortable and a bargain for the price. The staff was friendly and accomodating. You cannot beat the location! I will stay here again during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Front Desk wasn't the best, but I loved the location and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: McSchmidty
Reviews.Content: I think the desk could improve. I called down asking for salt and they told me they would send the bell man up. I never saw the salt. I arrived at noon knowing I probably couldn't check in right away. I stressed that we had been up since 4a on a plane. Pretty much they blew me off and told me I had to wait until 3. (i work at a hotel so I know that its not that hard to put a rush on a room) I was a little cranky I got over it. Last thing... They don't have a business center to print airline tickets. I ask them since they didn't have a computer for me to use if I could get the airline to fax it. They told me sure. What they left out is that they where going to charge me for the fax!!! Now for the Good!!! I my room. We booked the Junior Suite. The bellman and housekeeping where the best!!! The location is awesome!!! Very close to Jackson Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaO06
Reviews.Content: We happened across this motel because of stopping at the Kentwood Visitors Center upon entering Louisiana. Judy and the 2 other ladies working there, pointed out the pamphlets in regards to "special" prices at various hotels in New Orleans. The prices were good for that particular day; the best part of this was that we called the motel from the visitors center and had a room reserved. The experience at the visitors center helped. Arriving at the hotel, we were greeted warmly by the lady at the desk. She remembered me calling and reserving the room a couple hours earlier. The bellman not only took our luggage to our room, the hanging bags were placed in the closet along with the suitcases. When we checked out the next morning, we called the desk to let them know we were ready to leave and within 5 minutes the bellman was at our door, ready to take our luggage to the parking garage. The only complaint we have is that we didn't know to pull into the garage immediately upon arriving at the hotel... the person in the garage was taking a vehicle and parking it, so we made the mistake of trying to park on the narrow street. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, terrific rate, update needed”
Reviews.Author: lacatngirl
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! This hotel is in the best possible location for touring the French Quarter, about 50 steps from Jackson Square! I can't imagine staying anywhere else for the location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool needs some attention, but the courtyards are the big draw. You feel like you are in another world while sitting in the middle of the quarter. The privacy of the courtyards leave you in awe of the breathtaking beauty. The rooms are VERY dated and in need of updating. The carpets in the room were very dirty. The decor is beyond being appropriate for the quarter as they are at the point of appearing dirty and old. Our room had been cleaned I am sure but there was peeling wallpaper, strings from clothing left on the carpet from previous travelers, mold on the windowsill above the ac unit, and a collection of hairspray film on the door facing in the bathroom, not to mention a wine bottle cork found under the bed and worn comforters. Details, details, details......very important! I would love to stay here again after some updates are done. It is nice to get the "french quarter feel" but this hotel gave me too much of the "feel" for my liking. Love the city, the quarter, and the location of the hotel, but not the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is great old hotel right at the heart of the French Quarter. We splurged and got a room with a second story balcony. It was wonderful. We saw lots of parades for weddings and posed for lots of pics for the carriage tours that go by every five minutes. The room was nice, super comfy bed. Service was very good. Great location, but can be kind of loud.

Reviews.Title: “It don't get no better than Place D'Armes!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keinika
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to NOLA, but my 2nd time staying in the French Quarter. For anyone that knows anything about the quarter, this is your best bet as far as location, price, service, and quality. The hotel is located on St Ann street about a half block down from Jackson Square. So you are literally in the middle of it all! It was a 15 - 20 minute cab ride from the airport, not bad at all. We arrived about 11a, so our room wasn't ready yet. However they stored our luggage for us and gave us some great suggestions for lunch. There was a little issue with my check in and my friends, but it was quickly resolved. At about 4:00pm, our room was ready (the time it was supposed to be). My husband and I had a balcony room. BE AWARE: some of the balconys are private and some are shared and what you request is NOT garunteed. We requested a private balcony and we got a private one and the larger of the two that were on our floor! Our room (228) was up the stairs right behind the front desk and the bellman met us there with our bags. (What service!) Ask for this room, it has the larger balcony and its easy to get to after a long day or night! When we opened the door, we were greeted by a little sitting room right there at the door. (How cute) The bathroom was sparkling, the bed had fresh covers and we just adored the exposed brick wall that sat behind the tv and desk area. We had two doors to the balcony (only one opened) and you were able to the lock them. The baclony faced St Ann street and came equipped with our own lantern and patio set. The only thing we didn't like was that it had a slight lean to it and there were no flowers or foliage. There, also, were a few cigeratte butts and bottle tops left behind, but I called to the front desk and someone came immdiately and took care of it. BE AWARE: They don't have allies in NOLA so the trash is put out on the street for pickup, so there's the smell and noise of the garbage trucks you have to deal with. Its not that bad, but I guess it depends on where you live. We' re from Chicago so we are used to noise and smells! :) The shower was amazing and there was a heat lamp available for use. Nice tolietries, plenty of towels, and they kept extra supplies in the closet. The AC worked well, easily controllable, just had an outdated panel. The bed was huge, bigger than the queen we booked and it came with extra pillows and blanket. The cable could have been a little better....only 1 movie channel. The room was really spacious, bigger than we expected. They were a few burn marks on the table and 2 tears on the wall, but no hotel is perfect! They had 3 courtyards...one with the pool, one with a fountain and a smaller one around the back. At night, there will lights in the trees in the courtyard with the fountain and golfish in the fountain (so cute). The breakfast is scarce, only croissants, danishes, coffee, juice, and tea. The could use some cereal, fruit, and one hot item. There's a garage, but we didnt use it. My friend had a courtyard room. At first her's was around the back. It was ok, just a wall for a view so hardly no sunlight. She called and complained and they gave her a new room the next day. Her 2nd room was alot better. It opened up the fountain courtyard and was alot larger. The service was great! Everytime we had an issue, they took care of it right away. They booked our Creole Queen cruise, tried to print our boarding passes (it was there fault why they couldn't print them, airline issue), gave us maps, suggestions for dining, call our cab, and even kept our luggage after we checked out because our flight wasn't until 7:00pm. NEVER HAD AN ISSUE WITH THE STAFF! I read some of the other reviews and alot of people complained about the Interior room. CALL BEFORE YOU BOOK!!!!!!!!!!!! They will tell you that room has no windows and being that its hot there it can get musty! Others complained about about the furniture and the look of the hotel. This is a old hotel with alot of history. Its a BOUTIQUE hotel, meaning the furniture might look a little vintage and old school. If you want up-to-date style, try the W, Hilton, or Harrah's....you're going to pay for it too! But if you want a quaint New Orleans hotel in the heart of it all with the whimsy of the Vieux Carre...Place D'Armes is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “If you want no worries stay here. Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: qcSheri
Reviews.Content: Garden paridise in the middle of the French Quarter. Stayed here 5 1/2 years ago and it has maintained its beauty and elegance also most of the wonderful and friendly staff was the same too, all so kind and helpful. The Place d'Armes has a garden area that is so tranquil and peaceful you almost don't want to leave. The sun peacefully flickers though the palms and magnolia trees on to the red brick and black iron in this private coart yard complete with the perfic size pool to cool off in after walking around the local sights. Great for couples and or a family. Felt so safe and had no worries what so ever, they even have a car garage for your car. New Orleans have been through so much, I travel alot and I have to say that the people of this city are the kindest and most understanding and they need our support so visit New Orleans and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Stay at the Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: ManyPurrl
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th trip to Nola and my 7th stay at the Place (my other was at another Valentino hotel, the St. Marie). We always stay at this hotel for the following points. 1-The staff is wonderful. This is a consistant fact, every time, every position. 2-The rooms are great. I have stayed in every type of room, this time in an interior room. You CANNOT beat the price for a nice, clean and well appointed room in the Quarter at a hotel that has parking. If you can, I am not aware of it. 3-The location rocks. We hang around Decatur and Royal streets and love being able to pop into the room to use the bathroom and drop off purchases. 4-The courtyard is beautiful. This is the courtyard you picture when you think of New Orleans. 5-Safety. We always go as a small group of women and appreciate the layout of the hotel and location so far as going in and out at night.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Gem, Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: BenThereJr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. While lacking some amenities (i.e. no microwave, refrigerator, flat screen TV, or jetted tub) you don't miss them because your room, while elegant and charming, is more of a place to rest between walking to the wonderful shops, restaurants and historical attractions that New Orleans has in abundance. The hotel is tucked just far enough from Bourbon and Canal Streets to be pretty quiet, but it is smack in the French Quarter and as charming as can be. The hotel appears to be composed of 6 or 7 different buildings, each slightly different, but all with a harmonizing style. My favorite aspect of the hotel is the courtyard that offers a small pool and a patio where you are surrounded by greenery and cool shade.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. In the middle of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: olywater
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, can't say enough great things about it. Ask for room 215 if you are looking for 2 double beds. Overlooks the courtyard and has it's own balcony. The room was nice, nothing spectacular but was perfect for us. We were looking for a neat hotel and we found it. Go to Cafe du Monde for breakfast because the hotel only serves croissants, pastries, and coffee. Not bad but not the best. They do give out USA Today and the local paper for free. Never felt unsafe once and everything is so close. The front desk is willing to print your boarding passes for you if you ask. Go to Lafitte's on Bourbon if you drink. It is supposed to be the oldest bar in the US. Very cool and maybe the highlight of my trip. :) It is $25 to park there but we didn't think that was too bad considering the car was safe and we were right downtown!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base from which to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Terry2106
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to New Orleans and you can easily walk to all the places of interest. I couldnn't believe how centrally situated it was. We had a large room with a good sized bathroom.The decor was rather dark and heavy but maybe that was to be in keeping with the style of the buildoing. It was through a couple of courtyards and initially a bit difficult to find our way back to!!! Staff were friendly; breakfast was a bit basic but really matched the description of it in the otel blurb. I liked the complementary daily paper.The room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Get a Room with Windows”
Reviews.Author: angela52376
Reviews.Content: The staff here were excellent, friendly, and very helpful. Our room was not ready when we checked in about 4 p.m. and the desk clerk called up immediately to find out when it would be ready and the bellhop actually went and talked to the maids to tell them to do ours first. It was ready in 15 minutes and he took our bags upstairs (we had a 3rd floor room) and took us to the room. I can't say enough about how friendly and nice the staff were. I read other reviews here talking about impolite staff, but we didn't encounter a single one. The desk clerk even happily printed our boarding passes for our flight home with no hassle at all and they have a nice list of recommended restaurants they give to guests. The room was beautiful and actually quite spacious for an older hotel in the French Quarter. Six years ago we stayed at another hotel and our room was literally the size of a closet. Our room had access to a shared balcony on the 3rd floor and two huge windows that let in plenty of light. The air conditioning worked like a charm and there was also an overhead ceiling fan. The room showed no signs of disrepair or aging and the decor was nice. The only thing I would suggest would be to update the faucets in the shower and the water pressure wasn't the greatest but adequate, also the toilet didn't flush the best, you had to hold the handle down until the bowl emptied completely, but other than that, it was well worth the $99 a night (weeknight rates) that we spent, especially since you can easily pay just as much or even more for a less nice hotel in the French Quarter. The bed wasn't the most comfortable I've ever slept in but it wasn't terrible and I don't usually find any hotel beds that comfortable but the pillows were nice and plump. I would recommend if you have one of the rooms on the 3rd floor that you be patient about maid service as they don't seem to get around to those rooms until around 3:30 - 4:00 p.m. but that's understandable considering how many rooms there are and they can't really start until check out at noon. The courtyard was beautiful and we spent more time there than the balcony. The only problem was the heat and humidity were quite high and you don't get much of a breeze in the courtyard. However, they do have a pool there, it's a bit small, but nice to keep cool in. They also serve a continental breakfast in a very nice room off the courtyard. It's nice if you want to just grab a quick croissant or danish (nothing special) but I would suggest that they offer some fruit with breakfast like most places serve that offer a continental breakfast. They're also very close to Cafe du Monde so you could just skip the breakfast and go get beignets. I've read some negative reviews on here but what I've noticed is that most of them are people that booked what they call "interior" rooms, that is rooms without windows. Yes, in a high humidity atmosphere you may get a "musty" smell in such a room, and yes, believe it or not, there are bugs in New Orleans being near water and with its climate, get used to it (though we didn't see any in our room.) If you are claustrophobic or have problems with not having natural light, don't get an interior room either. We were already aware of this when we booked from reading reviews so we made sure to request a room with windows. To be honest, the rates for such rooms aren't that much higher than the interior rooms, so it's worth the extra few bucks and you'll enjoy this hotel much more if you get one of the non-interior rooms. It's so often true that you get what you pay for so if you want to be cheap and not pay the bit of extra money for a better room, then don't complain. Also, though we didn't book through an internet site like travelocity or expedia, when I was looking for hotels on their sites, I noticed that you are automatically booked for the lowest rate room if you book through them which is the interior rooms, so if you use them, make sure you upgrade and it doesn't hurt to call the hotel and make sure your booking is for the upgraded room before arriving. We will definitely be returning to Place d'Armes when we go back to New Orleans in the future. They definitely made our trip pleasant and enjoyable, especially after our experiences with other "older" hotels in the quarter that cost just as much and weren't nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again”
Reviews.Author: wcoklahoma
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed here. The staff is always nice and helpful. Called 2 monthe prior to our visit talked to Mr. Valentino and he got us the same room we had the year before. We had some friends come in and spend a couple of days with us. It was their first trip to New Orleans but it won't be their last. We plan on visiting New Orleans again next year.Our friends that visted us and another couple are planning on travelling with us to New Orleans next year. This place has a great pool and courtyard. I wish that we had the courtyard at our home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: rxman
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and decided on this hotel due to it's location. If you want location, this is the place to stay. I will warn you that the staff is 50/50 on being polite. Our check in was slow and they kept no records of our reservation. I didn't bring our vouchers from the website that I booked from and they were going to make me go across the street and pay to use a computer to print it. Thank goodness I had my iphone. The beds and pillows are terrible and the air-conditioning was not good. We did somehow get a balcony room (302) which was nice, but could hear every drunk making noise throughout the night. If you are a sound sleeper and beds don't matter, then stay here. You will not find a better location. You also should be warned that it is haunted, and you can google that info. I will not stay here again. It is a beautiful hotel and has a nice courtyard, but I feel that if the management would run it better it would have potential to be a 4 star hotel. I hope this review isn't to harsh, but I must say that they need to work on the updating of the bedding and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: collierje
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay. The stay was more than helpful and the location is hard to beat being right off of Jackson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Do not accept Room 125 or any of the back courtyard rooms”
Reviews.Author: MikeH58
Reviews.Content: Booked this 5 months ago only to be found we were placed in a terrible room. Returned from a walk around town on first evening to find an infestation of flying termites. Had to complain hard to be moved to another hotel. Was told this was the second infestation in the last couple of days. Room had a terrible musty smell. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the French Quarter - pure excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Merapi36
Reviews.Content: I was traveling thru with my mom who was an original french quarter native in the 70's. I booked this room using a travel site, not really knowing what i was getting myself into but hoping to pick somthing my mom would just love. It was golden! The location was right smack dab in the middle of it all, just a short walk from Burbon st for those partiers, close to the cathedral, river and of course Cafe du Monde. It's nice to be able to walk everywhere! We took a ghost tour and the hotel was actually highlighted on the tour, another thing i didn't realize...i'm a scardy cat so i had trouble sleeping after hearing that (nothing scary happend tho :) The only negative I had was the windowless rooms, i guess i just like to have natural light, but other than that it was the topping on the cake of my week in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: BuckRutledge
Reviews.Content: Just off Jackson Square and within very easy walking distance to Cafe DuMonde, the location is perfect. However, when booking be sure to secure a room with a balcony to the street or that accesses the relaxing courtyard. They have older rooms at the very back at the hotel that looks out onto nothing but a wall and requires a torturous climb up narrow stairs. The better rooms can be accessed by an elevator. They serve breakfast (croissants and coffee) and make newspapers available.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl06
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter, walking distance to all the major attractions which tipify the New Orleans French Quarter. Although the building shows its age, it is well maintained and a true value for anyone interested in being in the heart of the French Quarter. There is a small swimming pool within the quaint courtyard which is lushly landscaped with many plants and some magnificent magnolia trees. While there is no restaurant on the premises, a continental breakfast is served int he morning and excellent restaurants are steps away. The staff is always friendly and helpful making for a very comfortable stay. Having lived in and visiting New Orleans many times, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewed by locals”
Reviews.Author: nolasgirl504
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded our expectations, even by locals' standards. It was more convenient, authentic and charming than most of the five star New Orleans hotels. We stayed on a Thursday night because we had an early photo shoot in Jackson Square on Friday. As the Place d'Armes is right across the street and gets great reviews we thought we'd give it a try. We are both from New Orleans, but neither of us had stayed at this hotel before. We wanted a balcony room so we could take some pictures with the cathedral in the background. Our first experience with the hotel was the night bellman, Robert. He was possibly the nicest and most positive person on the face of the earth. We weren't in the best of moods when we arrived late after a full workday and a long drive, but by the time we got to our room, his attitude had completely turned ours around. The room was much larger than we had expected with very high ceilings, perhaps 15'. Floor to ceiling windows, great morning light. Our room also had a small alcove with a large mirror and table by a window where my wife could get ready. The large balcony was fantastic with a great view of Jackson Square. It was perfect for breakfasting in the Quarter. It felt like living in the French Quarter. The room was immaculate. The bathroom was clean with a good shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Surprisingly, the room was extremely quiet and allowed us to get a good night's sleep (although granted it was a Thursday night in summertime, which is typically slow for New Orleans). The lush tropical courtyard was very peaceful. Parking, which is usually a problem in New Orleans, was convenient and reasonable. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bermuda2
Reviews.Content: This was my second vist at this small hotel. It is quiet, clean, the staff are courteous. It is perfectly located at the edge of the French Quarter w/in easy walking distance to great restaurants, shops, bars if interested. Also convenient to the Riverside Street Car, which for $1.25 will take the rider to either the Convention Center or Canal Street, where you can change to another Street Car. Very safe at night- only one entrance, which leads into the small lobby, which is always staffed. Simple continental breakfast in AM. Reqest a courtyard room- very quiet-all you hear is water fountains and a few birds in the AM. Perfect, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Bogart45
Reviews.Content: Our 11th annual trip to New Orleans for Jazz Fest. Based on a friend's recommendation and Trip Advisor, we stayed at the Place D'Armes for the first time. For the previous five years, we stayed at the Hotel Monteleone, who inexcusably raised their rates considerably. Nothing bad to say about this place. Nice sized rooms, basic yet full amenities. Staff was friendly. I did prebook and pay in full which included a roll-a-way bed. It was not in the room when we arrived and when I asked for it, it was delivered within ten minutes. HOwever, they recharged for the roll-a-way. No biggie but a slight inconvenience. Courtyards were fine. The balcony in the back buildings overloop Jackson Square. Nice feature. Great location... cafe du monde down the street, three blocks to the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street. Anyway, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Balcony Room Rate”
Reviews.Author: KKemp
Reviews.Content: Having chosen the Balcony Room rate, imagine my disappointment on arrival to learn I was SHARING the balcony for which I was paying extra with any and all hotel guests who weren't paying for a balcony. The general manager adjusted 2 of my 3 nights when I phoned to question the practice. The hotel was full so I was not able to have a room with a private balcony, which is what I wanted and thought I was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: GulfHibiscus
Reviews.Content: Second trip to New Orleans, first trip to Jazz Festival. We have stayed at Place d'Armes both times and this time we brought along 3 of our adult children. Can't beat this hotel for location and service. Everything is within walking distance and it reminded us of walking around Italian cities . Their courtyard is a great place to relax before or after seeing the sights. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal French Quarter Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityYall
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Place d'Armes for an entire week and loved every minute of uor stay. I would highly recommmend getting the upgrade to a suite with a balcony. The baclony on the interior courtyard was large and wonderful- facing out to the pool and getting plenty of sun. The room itself was cozy enough for our purposes- we didn't spend much time there except to sleep, but the beds were comfortable, the bathroom small but functional, and the closet/ desk space fine for our needs. The hotel is just steps away from Jackson Square and Bourbon Street, but there is amazingly no noise or crowd issues to deal with. It felt like a secret treasure we had discovered. I'm actually hesitant to tell people about it, because I loved it so much that I always want it to be available when we go back. Make sure that at least one morning, you wake up in time for the free croissants and cafe au lait- they were AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirenzeGirl
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in New Orleans before (both before and after Katrina), I usually avoid the Quarter because it is so noisy, but this time the accommodations could not have been better. The hotel is perfectly situated but remains quiet even on a Saturday night. The bathroom was a little small, but given the location, it is a small price to pay; being at this hotel reminded me of all the great European hotels, and that is clearly what they are trying to emulate. The continental breakfast was delicious, there is free parking on site, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the courtyard is stunning (and a great place to hang out in the evenings before you go to dinner). It is also situated next to my favorite restaurant in NOLA, Muriel's. You cannot go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good in some ways--not so good in others”
Reviews.Author: futurelawyer2005
Reviews.Content: Great location.....literally corner of Jackson Square. On site FREE parking garage...no walking. Things not so good.....to make the rooms affordable or to be able to even get a room available, you have to get an INSIDE room. Whew.....not a pleasant experience. The room itself is ok. It's just the lack of light and inability to use the "free wi-fi" advertised that is the biggest problem. As for our specific room, the chair cushions and bed throw pillows were smeared with some unidentifiable substance. We had a tiny furry visitor in the middle of the night who took a likening to some jelly beans in a bag we had bought earlier in the day. As for the hotel itself, you either get a fantastic desk clerk or you get the most sour of all human beings who decided long ago that you weren't worth spitting on to save your life. Basically, customer service is either great or horrific. The pool is tiny but refreshing especially since many hotels in the Quarter do not have them. Sitting outside in the garden area by the pool is supposed to be relaxing until a group of rowdy drunk college guys come out there and mess it all up. Other than that, if you are looking for a moderately decent budget hotel with some antique historical flair, choose the Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Mixed Bag-But I'd Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: KBrogan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an odd mixture of lovely architecture and a gorgeous courtyard coupled with rooms that really need a facelift. Our side of the hotel had no elevators so you have to lug your luggage up and down. The beds were hard, the carpets dirty and the television small and sporadically on the fritz. But I STILL WOULD GO BACK! Why? Well it has the best location for the price. It's far enough away from Bourbon Street and the surrounding bars to get a good night's sleep, yet it's in the middle of everything, including being close to the Cathedral, Cafe Du Mond, the flea market, the electric cars and all of the French Quarter. Next door is the pricey, but delicious, restaurant, Muriel's where you can get some delicious Alligator appetizers (and it was delicious) and crawfish crepes. I liked the hotel staff and you do get a continental breakfast, so.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Great Place To Stay In The French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: cheferin
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival from the airport, our room was not quite ready but the bellman was quick to store our luggage while my wife and I dipped off for a quick cajun lunch. When returned, our room was ready and we were suprised by the simply gorgeous, southern flare of our room which overlooked St Ann street. The room was clean and smelled fresh. The balcony was large enough for a small gathering of people and offered a quiet view of the street below. When checking out,the staff was very friendly and offered there assistance without prompt. During our stay the staff was amazing at recommending things to see and do. I would definately stay here again! Everything to do in the quarter is relatively close to walk to and the courtyard is a landscaping masterpiece!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the expense of comfort”
Reviews.Author: sparkygirl
Reviews.Content: I have been going to New Orleans for years and this is the first time that I stayed here. I loved the location and the courtyard. My only complaint with this hotel is the beds. They are smaller doubles. I'm not that tall and my feet hung over the bottom. The mattress was very thin and if you pressed down you could feel all the coils. The bottom sheet wasn't long enough for the mattress. At the bottom there was a gap of about three feet where your feet would touch the mattress pad. When you think about how many other feet also touched the mattress pad it becomes kind of gross. The blanket also had stains that looked like they had not been washed. Unfortunately, I know all this because I was trying to rearrange the blanket and sheet so that I had more cushion. I feel that this could be a top hotel since it has great location, competent staff, and wonderful courtyard. Unfortunately, the lack of sleep and aching back make it hard to decide whether I would come back. Definitely a pros verses cons type situation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's location made it great for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: friend84
Reviews.Content: We have a 4 yr. old and were looking for a place to stay for Mardi Gras in the 20-26 Feb. range. It was about a month before Mardi Gras and most hotels were sold out. My partner didn't want to hear the noise of partying at night in the Quarter, while I wanted to be close to Jackson Square, Cafe du Monde, and the flea market, and I thought it'd be nice to be within walking distance of Bourbon St. or areas of the Quarter where we'd get to hear music, see people's costumes, and take part in the revelry of the street. So the Place d' Armes met our needs perfectly for location--in the heart of the Quarter with Jackson Square just steps away--but we could get a room at the back of the building, facing a narrow back courtyard, so we heard little of the noise of the street. The room had interior brick walls, a fireplace and a nice big window. It did seem somewhat small (especially small bathroom) but it fit the bill for charm and for being a nice, quiet retreat, just a tad bit darkish in terms of lighting. The breakfast was average (adding fresh fruit or cereal would do a lot) but some other places didn't even include breakfast so at least we had our croissant or roll or whatever we had in the morning--and the o.j. was good. We also liked getting a copy of the newspaper in the breakfast room each morning. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the extra security provided at the front door was reassuring during the Mardi Gras time. The hotel is not swank but is charming and low-key, with a lovely, lush garden around fountains in the courtyard. We'd definitely stay here again, particularly during Mardi Gras, when we'd especially want to be in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gia0330
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and again we had a wonderful time. We always request the same building - the 3rd floor of the building facing Chartres. If you are expecting a fancy hotel with all the amenities...this is not the place for you. So don't stay there and complain about it later. It does have free wi-fi and all the usual items one expects in a hotel room. The buildings are 1800's & 1900's so you will find brick interior walls and it can get muggy in your room. The rooms we have stayed in had fans and a/c (although a bit noisy) but it worked well to move the air around and keep it cool. There are signs of mice (holes chewed, not droppings!!) , but most of the buildings and residences in the French Quarter have them. It's part of the territory!! There are some interior rooms - meaning no windows. Our room during our last stay was a double room with a small room on the other side of the entry door (open, no doors). We needed a roll-away and this small room, under the window, was the only place to put it. Our guest who slept there got quite warm at night since the fan is over the double bed as is the a/c. We were steps away from the balcony that looks onto the beautiful courtyard, however, with no chairs on this 3rd floor balcony we preferred to sit on the Chartres St. balcony. Be aware that these are 'shared' balconies on this side. So don't expect privacy - keep your blinds closed and be a tolerant of those who choose to have coffee or a drink sitting outside listening to the music in Jackson Square. (We had someone come out at 9pm and tell us to move because they could see us outside!). The staff is wonderful and very helpful. From the desk clerks, valets, bell staff, grounds crew and maids, everyone made our visit even more delightful. Remember, If you want to have a friendly hotel staff, be friendly to them! We heard some wonderful stories and were given great advice on places to go that were beyond the average tourist spot. The continental breakfast is basically coffee, tea, croissants and orange juice. Not impressive, but it's free, the oj is great, and beignets every day can get to be a bit much! The history of the hotel - a former boarding school that burned down on a Good Friday killing the occupants - is very interesting. We first heard it on a Haunted History Tours (ask for Jonathan or Brent or Tina). We had several 'experiences' both stays: the smell of fire, the elevator in our building tends to act up (a floor button goes on, elevator stops, no one is there and several times as we got in before we even pressed "3" it went on for us - no one was on the 3rd floor waiting). There is an interior stairwell in this building that is steep, circular and a bit dark - late one night we decided to take these stairs and my daughter and her friend were both pushed. Not hard, more of a 'move out of the way' type of push. We, like others including some staff, have heard children laughing, talking late at night and there were no children near us. Supposedly a man with a beard, hat and 1800's style clothes has appeared to some; we've yet to see him. But we never felt afraid during any of this - if we did, we wouldn't go back! The hotel doesn't really advertise themselves as haunted and it took a few conversations with the bellman to get him to confess his experience. Just know, it's an old building and things have happened there! It is situated perfectly, right next to Muriel's restaurant (also haunted!). If you go out on either the St. Ann or Chartres St balconies you can view part of Jackson Square and watch the vendors ply their wares and the musicians serenading. Because of it's location, you feel fairly safe walking late at night, although don't try it alone! There is no room service, however, the desk clerk will give you a list of places who deliver to the hotel. It is a wonderful hotel to experience the French Quarter from. Which is why I've already made our reservations there for Halloween 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Place!”
Reviews.Author: bskthound1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time. We asked for the same room as previous stay and happy with the room. The staff was wonderful this visit. We traveled with an elderly gentleman this time and the location just can't be beat for ease of walking distance to the best of the Quarter. St. Patrick's Day a very wonderful front desk staffer gave our elder friend a ride to Pat O's. He asked for a cab and as she was leaving for the day she dropped him off at the front door of Pat O's. Just can't say enough for the kindness, assistance and friendliness of the staff there. We will absolutely come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Place D Armes!”
Reviews.Author: ADM12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a few days during mardi gras and we enjoyed it! The room overlooked Chartres street and there was a balcony right outside our room which made it feel like our own! Surprisingly there wasnt any noise to disturb us during the night so we slept well! The bathroom was clean as well. We did have a problem with the cleaning service since they didnt come everyday that we were there and we had to call for extra soap etc but that wasn't a big deal cause we were there for a short period! The carpet int he rooms and the hallway seemed to need updating though, since it appeared very old... The courtyard and tiny pool added to the quaint ambiance of this hotel! One of the ladies at the front desk was very friendly and helpful which we appreciated since we are not from the US! I wished the breakfast offered healthier options though, like one fruit and toast or cereal... The location was the best, easy to get to restaurants etc We enjoyed our stay in New orleans, loved the restaurants especially Acme Oyster House, Cafe du Monde, Angeli's, LA Pizza Kitchen and the Gumbo Shop!

Reviews.Title: “Staff not very friendly, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Texarkanababy
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed by the lack of friendliness of the staff, but hotel was more than adequate, with wonderful location. The courtyard is just beautiful. I would probably stay again, thanks to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ~ Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jrprez
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. You can't beat the location. Just steps from the famous Jackson Square and central to everything in the French Quater. Very quaint with cute courtyards and nice rooms. We had a nice sized King Room with a 4 poster bed and very large tub. Our only complaint was that the free wifi did not work inside our room, so I had to go sit out in the courtyard to access it. (And it just happened to be freezing cold during our stay.) The courtyard was nice but could have used a bit of trimming and the pool was dirty, even though it was too cold to use anyway. The free breakfast consisted only of croissants and danish with coffee and juice. Nothing to write home about, but the hotel is just down the street from the famous Cafe Du Monde, so you hop over there for beignets and cafe au lait. We also trecked over to Johnny's Po Boys for some great breakfast subs. The service was fine, we had no issues. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic French Quarter with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: mlavoie1956
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Place d'Armes and loved every minute of it. Beautifully restored French Quarter buildings, gives you the sense of the historic area with all the updates to keep you comfortable. The room was very nice; original brick walls, high ceilings, and a great balcony view of the courtyard.( If you get a balcony room, some of the rooms are interior) The staff was very helpful & friendly , Denette, the lady who was on the front desk during the day, was able to guide us in seeing the sites and making reservations for activities. Everyone on staff always greeted us with a good morning and asked how we were doing or could they help us with anything. Great coffee with the continental breakfast. I really enjoyed sitting in the courtyard with my coffee in the morning before heading out. Fantastic location, right in the center of the French Quarter, easy walk to Jackson Square , Decatur street, the French Market , and all the shops and attractions. As with many places in the French Quarter the exterior tells you nothing about the interior. The price was average for this type of accommodation but the service was 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad of it”
Reviews.Author: RedDogJourney
Reviews.Content: First off, this review is from someone who loves boutique hotels. If you need 5-star chain hotel amenities, look somewhere else. The location is GREAT and the staff is stellar. The bellman, Nate, is excellent and seems to know every good cabbie in New Orleans. Beautiful landscaping and inner courtyard. Free wifi in the room that I found to be reliable. Free pastries and coffee in the breakfast room each morning, but I skipped it because the hotel is close to several good restaurants. Now the room-Almost ALL French Quarter hotels have their fair share of shabby-chic, but this room left out a lot of the chic. Beds, floors & bathroom were clean, but the furniture was mismatched and battered. There were no windows in our room (210) so it was very dark. There was clearly a roof leak at some point because you could see the mold pattern on one of the interior walls and it smelled like mold sometimes. My friend coughed all night from the mold. In general, I think it's an ok place, but I would steer clear of room 210 and ask if they have any rooms with windows.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better location than Place D'Armes”
Reviews.Author: sharpee2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Place D'Armes for 10 nights. 6 were with my wife on a leisure vacation and 4 with a co worker for a conference. My room with my wife was great. It was large, spacious, clean and had a nice balcony to watch the crowds go by. The only complaint would be the garbage trucks every morning at 3 AM. Oh well......... My second room was a window less interior room that was small, smelled really bad, not very clean and always smelled like cigarette smoke(as it drifted through the ventalation system). I was not in the room that much but I would recommend if you make a booking to be sure and get either a room with windows or a balcony. I would not recommend this room to my worst enemies. The location was the BEST asset of this hotel. We stopped numerous times to drop off bags, go to the bathroom or just rest for a while. It is close to EVERYTHING you need in the French Quarter. We walked everywhere and never felt lost! It is a 25 minute walk to the convention center and is a pleasure after a long evening on Bourbon Street. We felt safe the whole time in NO and return to Place D'armes again. Front Desk and Conciege were very helpful and were there 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Our place in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Mmiko
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in New Orleans. We have stayed there numerous times over the last 20 years. We have been back since the hurricane and things are back to normal. It is such a quaint place with charming surroundings. The rooms overlook two courtyards with a pool and fountains. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the French Quarter. We never even both to rent a car since we can walk everywhere we want to from our room. Breakfast is included with the price of the room and the courtyard is beautifully landscaped with blooming plants. We have already booked our trip for this year!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: sjbbullcreek
Reviews.Content: great stay, location could not be better, very nice motel. I WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet, Lovely, in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Tour1252
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. In the center of everything, always felt safe. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the continental breakfast was sufficient, nice breakfast room. Beautiful courtyard, but the rooms were not as pictured online, smaller and no couches as shown on website. We would have like something in the room other than a desk chair to sit on. Parking was overpriced and they wouldn't honor parking coupon because we were told we had had gotten too good of a room rate. Overall I think we'd stay there again but be more specific when booking our room. This was a last minute trip and the hotel we generally stay at was unavailable. Given the high amount of crime in New Orleans, this is a perfectly placed hotel for overall safety.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gravedigger_1
Reviews.Content: My Father, sister & I just returned from the Place d Armes and we all had a wonderful experience there. If you are expecting the five star resort experience, stay away from here. But if you are looking for a Bed and Breakfast type of environment that is close enough to Bourbon Street and Jackson Square this is the perfect spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: sallyann_chicago
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for New Year's and had a terrific time! This is place we love to return to again and again. .A destination to consider it whether it's been a while or you've not visited yet...New Orleans is open and welcoming company ! Our absolute favorite place to stay is the Place d'Armes. Perfectly located just steps from Jackson Square, it has everything you need and keeps away those things you don't. The rooms are clean and comfortable and charming in a way that is personal, not mass produced giant chain generic. Breakfast and free wifi are included and parking is the most reasonably priced in town. This is a hotel that acts and feels like a home.

Reviews.Title: “The Place was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: plumboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in Room 302 with my partner. I booked the room directly on the hotel's website with the "Value Rate" about two months previously -- so we got a really great deal. I also called after making the reservation and requested a room with a balcony on the street. Room 302 is a pretty large room with a king bed and a large balcony facing St. Ann Street (FYI: Room 301, next door, also has a balcony on St. Ann Street). The hotel's location really can't be beat -- especially for a first time trip to NO and the French Quarter. I also liked it because the block was never desolate -- it never felt unsafe or creepy. The FQ is so small, nothing is really far away from anything else, but the Place's central location was a nice extra. The staff were all nice and helpful when we needed anything. The room was super clean, and the bed was comfortable. But, as others have said, this is not a luxury accommodation, and if you need everything to be perfect, I wouldn't stay here. One of the blankets on the bed had a rip in it (we didn't care!) and the pillows were not great -- though we got slightly better ones when we asked. Aside from the coffee, the breakfast was not very good, and I'd suggest skipping it. But, even with those few negatives, I'm still giving this place 5 stars because everything else it offers counter-balances those few little things. Even though there were normal city noises as others have pointed out, I'm so glad we had a room with a balcony on the street. There were at least a couple little parades that went by our room at night, and it was great just to be able to run out and check it all out. We could also hear jazz and other stuff happening at Jackson Square -- it would just pass by every once in a while, unexpected. We loved the furnishings, the French doors, the wrought iron on the balcony -- it all worked well. On our last day, as we were waiting for our cab to the airport, we finally got to sit out in the courtyard. Very lush and pretty. Next time, we might ask for a room back there just for the experience. Also, a newish deli is on the corner of Royal and St. Ann -- Sean Kelly's Royal Street Deli -- is just a half block away. Great sandwiches you can bring back to your room if you don't feel like going out. It's all very convenient. We'll definitely be back -- highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Annasites55
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this place. Of the 8 times we've been to NOLA, we've stayed here 7 times in a row. The balcony room we've booked the last 2 times (223, I think...) is awesome! Nothing like having your own balcony to have coffee on each morning. The breakfast could be a bit better, but it's not bad, and we love this hotel anyway. : )

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Verdun96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5-day New Years getaway to New Orleans If you want to get a real feel of the French Quarter I would highly suggest the Place dâ€™Armes. This is no cookie cutter chain hotel. It is a splendid property made up of a series of buildings that surround a beautiful courtyard. It seems that no two rooms are quite the same and the hotel fits into the European charm that surrounds you while enjoying the French Quarter. Our room had a huge sitting area with a sink and a very comfortable king sized bed in the adjacent room. Though we spent very little time in the room, what time we did spend there was in a clean room that was very pleasant, comfortable and accommodating to our needs. What made our trip to the Place dâ€™Armes special was the staff. Everyone we encountered was outgoing and helpful. From the bellmen who first greeted us to the desk clerk that checked us out, we found that all of the associates we encountered in-between genuinely seemed to be glad we were there. And last but not least, the Place dâ€™Armes location is awesome. You literally fall right into Jackson Square as you leave the property. Upon exiting the hotel if you look to your left you will see the CafÃ© Du Monde and if you look right you will see Royal Street with Bourbon Street the next block down. No more chain hotels for us on our next visit to the Big Easy, the Place dâ€™Armes will be our hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Courtyard, but Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week. The courtyard was quaint and cute. The lobby was nicely decorated with a Christmas tree and trimmings. I was booked along with someone else and they gave us rooms in two different buildings, quite a distance away from each other. I thought that they could have done a little better on that, but it is a small hotel so maybe not. The rooms were inside rooms and were clean and nicely furnished. The hotel was in an excellent location. But to he honest, the service was courteous and adequate, but we got the Omni for a lower rate than this hotel where we were pampered and it was a nicer hotel. The breakfast consisted of croissants and jellies and orange juice. Also when we made the reservation, the person was courteous yet not really welcoming. Everything was clean and the bathroom had a hairdryer as did the other hotels that I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, though no frills”
Reviews.Author: khc5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, with the location being the most ideal quality. Steps from Jackson square and Cafe du Monde. The room we had was a room facing a narrow courtyard, which made it wonderfully quiet. The only problem I have is the room was realtively no frills and not totally "clean." There was a little bit of mold in the bathroom and the room had a bit of a strange smell. That being said, it wasn't disgusting in the least. It's just an older hotel where the rooms haven't received too much of a facelift in a long time. The location was what sold me, and if I went back I may try a different hotel. Still, not a bad experience, really.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Ideal location for New Orleans French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Wheedler123
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with this place. It's location was ideal being very close to Bourbon St, Jackson Square, Cafe Du Monde, Decateur, etc. The building and courtyard is really charming. The price was reasonable and we liked having the garage on premises b/c parking can be tough in NOLA. The room we had was a basic room. It met our expectations for what we paid, but it was a little dated (bathroom was probably last updated/styled in the 80s?). We feel the cleaning service could have been a little better; but nothing worth detailing here in this review. Their breakfast was disappointing....coffee, croissants, danishes...thats all, but as Cafe due Monde is a 3 minute walk away....just go there! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: gloriajean47
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Place d'Armes a number of times over the years and always find it charming. It has a great location and we felt very safe at this property. The staff was helpful and access is easy to about anywhere. We got a great price and even with added parking fee, it was a real value. Our room did not have a window but that was fine with us, very quiet. The halls did have an odd chemical smell several days we were there. It was enough to be annoying. The bedding shams on our bed also needed cleaning attention as there were visible stains. But, overall, the location and charm of this hotel are a great value. We attended the free concerts at St. Louis Cathedral and they were just wonderful! We plan to return next year for the pre-Christmas festivities..

Reviews.Title: “Authentic New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: K8eros
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just off of Jackson Square, I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and much nicer than the other people we came across in NOLA. The location is great! The customer service was excellent!!! Our room didn't have a window, which made it hard to figure out when it was time to get up, but it also blacked out the room at night and we had no issues sleeping. Even with all the lights on, the room was not well lit enough to read though. Although there was a funny odor in the hall, it was not in the room, thank goodness. My only real complaint was that we returned one day from a full day roaming the city and found out room door open. The cleaning crew had not shut it completely when they left and although nothing had been stolen, it was only out of pure luck. I would recommend this hotel to almost anyone and I felt very safe here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trinkets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Place D Arms Nov 24-28th 2008 for our 10 year anniversary. We LOVED the place...LOCATION was the main reason for my choice of this hotel, it was between Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, easily walking distance to both areas and very safe at night. The unexpected bonus was how great the staff was with their knowledge and friendliness, making us feel right at home. ..say Hi to Lyn and Nathanial for us...Our room (129) was fantastic...it was a window room, first level, with a seperate entrance hallway. It was an older room but very clean and furnished with all the amenities we needed. And for the price we paid ($99 P/N) it was well worth every penny. The courtyard was charming with the lights and water fountain, to cold for us to swim but not for us to hang outside at a table and have a beer. Breakfast was included in the price, supplying crossaints and danishes and orange juice, not a lot of food but enough to get you through to lunch time. A few things to see on your trip: the Cathedral, Cafe Du Monde, the day Cemetary/ History walking tour, but the BEST New Orleans experience was the carriage ride. They have 2 options, a carriage to yourself for $60 1/2 hour ride (or longer if you wish for more money), or option #2 was a group carriage ride for $12 Per Person. We chose the private one and if you decide to do this ask for Dennis and Mercedes...amazing ride, lots of laughs and just a romantic wonderful experience.... Thank you New Orleans for a GREAT 10 year anniversary trip....we will be back for sure ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: SisterTraveller
Reviews.Content: My sister and I met up with four friends for a few days in the French Quarter. We really liked this hotel. It is small and beautiful with a great location and good rates. Our room was comfortable and quiet. Being October, it was too cold to use the pool, but it would be fun in summer, and the surrounding courtyard is very nice with romantic little white lights scattered among the trees. The hotel buildings are historic and well-maintained. For a great view of the activity on Jackson Square, take your breakfast up to the communal balcony overlooking Chartres Street. We felt like we had personal tour guides in Norma and Robert at the front desk. They made our forays into (and outside) the city so easy. Their knowledge of the area and which tours to take helped us use our time wisely and see so much more than we would have on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
